original: rigs kyi bu nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing na sems can mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang lhan cig tu 'grogs pa rnams kyi nang na byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa de lta bus pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe rnam pa de lta bu'i don
analyzed: rigs kyi bu nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing na sems can mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang lhan cig tu 'grogs pa rnams kyi nang na byang chub sems dpa' rnam pa de lta bus pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad pa spyod pa'i tshe rnam pa de lta bu'i don
translated: “Son of noble family, in the buddha-fields of the five degenerations and afflictions, among sentient beings who are accompanied by roots of nonvirtue, the bodhisattva practices the six perfections with such an attitude.🔽At that time, he accomplishes the benefit of such a kind.

original: bya ba bsdu ba'i dngos pos sems can rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshul khrims la sbyor bar byed /
analyzed: bya ba bsdu ba'i dngos pos sems can rnams 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshul khrims la sbyor bar byed /
translated: By means of the four ways of gathering, he connects sentient beings to supramundane morality,

original: 'god par byed do //
analyzed: 'god par byed do //
translated: and he establishes them.

original: yon tan gyis sangs rgyas kyi yon tan don bya ba la sems can rnams 'god par byed pa 'di dag kyang byang chub sems dpa'i skyes bu chen po'i khur to //🔽sems can gyi bsdu ba'o //
analyzed: yon tan gyis sangs rgyas kyi yon tan don bya ba la sems can rnams 'god par byed pa 'di dag kyang byang chub sems dpa'i skyes bu chen po'i khur to // sems can gyi bsdu ba'o //
translated: These are the great being bodhisattva’s burden:🔽the gathering of sentient beings,

original: sems can gyi tshogs so //
analyzed: sems can gyi tshogs so //
translated: the assembly of sentient beings,

original: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par byed pa'o //
translated: the ripening of sentient beings,

original: gang sems can shin tu dbul po las yongs su thar bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: gang sems can shin tu dbul po las yongs su thar bar byed pa'o //
translated: and the complete liberation of sentient beings from poverty.

original: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la 'god par byed pa'o //🔽ji lta bur sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par ma dag par byang chub sems dpa' la la rnam pa de lta bu'i rtsal byed cing /
analyzed: rnam par thar pa'i sgo gsum la 'god par byed pa'o // ji lta bur sangs rgyas kyi zhing rnam par ma dag par byang chub sems dpa' la la rnam pa de lta bu'i rtsal byed cing /
translated: and he establishes them in the three doors of liberation.🔽“In whatever way a bodhisattva manifests his power in a buddha-field that is impure,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ba spu'i khung bu ji snyed pa de snyed kyi don bya bas sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ba spu'i khung bu ji snyed pa de snyed kyi don bya bas sems can yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: to that extent he matures beings through the performance of his various deeds, as many as are the pores of his body.

original: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i don mthun pa sems can yongs su smin pa'i rtsal chen po gang zhe na /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu gzhan yang byang chub sems dpa'i don mthun pa sems can yongs su smin pa'i rtsal chen po gang zhe na /
translated: “Moreover, son of noble family, what is the bodhisattvas’ great power of ripening beings through being in accord with their aims?

original: rigs kyi bu nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad pa spyod pa na gang gi tshe bdag @291b brtson par 'gyur pa /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir byang chub sems dpa' pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyad pa spyod pa na gang gi tshe bdag @291b brtson par 'gyur pa /
translated: “Son of noble family, when bodhisattvas practice the six perfections in this buddha-field of the five degenerations and afflictions, they exert themselves.

original: yang na ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / yang na ni tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par 'gyur ba de dang der sems can rnams sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: yang na ni sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa dang / yang na ni tshul khrims dang / bzod pa dang / brtson 'grus dang / bsam gtan dang / shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la brtson par 'gyur ba de dang der sems can rnams sbyor bar byed do //
translated: or else to the perfections of moral discipline, patience, perseverance, meditative concentration, and wisdom.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa byin pas zas sam /
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa byin pas zas sam /
translated: When a bodhisattva gives a gift,

original: skom nas yan lag gi dam pa mgo'i bar du gtong bar 'gyur ba de ltar sems can rnams la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan ston pa de la sbyor bar byed do //🔽gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' srog gcod pa spangs shing sems can rnams la snying rje ba de de ltar srog gcod pa zlog par byed /
analyzed: skom nas yan lag gi dam pa mgo'i bar du gtong bar 'gyur ba de ltar sems can rnams la sbyin pa'i pha rol tu phyin pa'i yon tan ston pa de la sbyor bar byed do // gang gi tshe byang chub sems dpa' srog gcod pa spangs shing sems can rnams la snying rje ba de de ltar srog gcod pa zlog par byed /
translated: he or she causes sentient beings to take up the practice of generosity by showing them the virtues of the perfection of generosity, from giving food and drink up to giving the supreme gift of one’s own limbs and head.

original: sems can thams cad la snying rje bar sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la snying rje bar sbyor bar byed do //
translated: When a bodhisattva has given up killing and has compassion for sentient beings, he or she causes them to turn away from killing and to take up the practice of compassion for all sentient beings.

original: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshul khrims la 'god par byed pa nas yang dag par lta ba'i bar du smra bar bya'o //🔽ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' bdag bzod pa'i yon tan lnga dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / bag la nyal ba spang ba'i phyir bzod pa sgom par byed pa nas mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa thob pa'i bar du de la sems can rnams sbyor bar byed cing mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa'i bar du 'god par byed do //
analyzed: 'jig rten las 'das pa'i tshul khrims la 'god par byed pa nas yang dag par lta ba'i bar du smra bar bya'o // ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' bdag bzod pa'i yon tan lnga dang ldan par 'gyur ba dang / bag la nyal ba spang ba'i phyir bzod pa sgom par byed pa nas mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa thob pa'i bar du de la sems can rnams sbyor bar byed cing mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa'i bar du 'god par byed do //
translated: I will speak to them about the morality that transcends the world, up to the right views.🔽I will cause sentient beings to engage in the patience that I have cultivated in order to acquire the five good qualities of patience and to abandon latent tendencies, up to the patience of the nonarising of phenomena, and I will establish them in the patience of the nonarising of phenomena.

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' bdag brtson 'grus brtsams nas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i lus kyi las byin gyis brlabs pa dang / dge ba'i ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las byin gyis brlabs pa @292a *//
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' bdag brtson 'grus brtsams nas sems can yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir dge ba'i lus kyi las byin gyis brlabs pa dang / dge ba'i ngag gi las dang / yid kyi las byin gyis brlabs pa @292a *//
translated: I will cause sentient beings to engage in the vigor that I have undertaken, in order to ripen sentient beings, and I will establish them in the vigor that blesses the virtuous actions of body, speech, and mind.

original: nas dge ba'i rgyur 'du shes pa dang / zhi ba dang / snying rje chen po'i rgyur 'dus byas rnams rnam par mi spong ba de la sems can rnams sbyor bar byed /
analyzed: nas dge ba'i rgyur 'du shes pa dang / zhi ba dang / snying rje chen po'i rgyur 'dus byas rnams rnam par mi spong ba de la sems can rnams sbyor bar byed /
translated: and they connect them to the causes of peace and great compassion.🔽“Bodhisattvas abide in the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas in order to train the hearers and solitary buddhas. They practice concentration in order to perfect the hearers’ and solitary buddhas’ concentration.

original: 'god par byed do; ;ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos dang / rang rgyal ba 'dul ba'i phyir nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la gnas te bsam gtan la bsam gtan du byed do; ;de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir nyan thos dang /🔽rang rgyal ba dang bral ba'i bsam gtan la bsam gtan du byed do //
analyzed: 'god par byed do; ;ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' nyan thos dang / rang rgyal ba 'dul ba'i phyir nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la gnas te bsam gtan la bsam gtan du byed do; ;de bzhin gshegs pa'i ting nge 'dzin yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir nyan thos dang / rang rgyal ba dang bral ba'i bsam gtan la bsam gtan du byed do //
translated: They practice concentration free from the hearers and solitary buddhas in order to perfect the Thus-Gone One’s absorption.

original: byang chub sems dpa' bdag med pa'i bsam gtan la bsam gtan du byed pa nas 'khyil ba dang / ldog pa'i bsam gtan thob pa'i bar du de la sems can rnams de dang de dag gi yon tan la sbyor bar byed /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bdag med pa'i bsam gtan la bsam gtan du byed pa nas 'khyil ba dang / ldog pa'i bsam gtan thob pa'i bar du de la sems can rnams de dang de dag gi yon tan la sbyor bar byed /
translated: “Bodhisattvas practice concentration on selflessness, and they connect beings to the qualities of concentration, from the attainment of the concentration of coiled and reversed nāḍīs

original: 'god par byed do //
analyzed: 'god par byed do //
translated: He makes them enter.

original: ji lta bur byang chub sems dpa' bdag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par brtson pa na thabs sna tshogs kyis shes rab kun 'byung bar byed do; ;ji ltar bdag mngon sum du 'gyur ba de ltar sems can rnams sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: ji lta bur byang chub sems dpa' bdag shes rab kyi pha rol tu phyin pa la mngon par brtson pa na thabs sna tshogs kyis shes rab kun 'byung bar byed do; ;ji ltar bdag mngon sum du 'gyur ba de ltar sems can rnams sbyor bar byed do //
translated: In whatever way the bodhisattva, who is himself engaged in the perfection of wisdom, causes the arising of wisdom through various methods, in just that way he causes beings to engage.

original: ji lta bur chos thams cad la ye shes thob cing pha rol ma yin pa'i rkyen mngon par shes pa de ltar sems can gyi rgyu'i phyir chos 'di dag 'byung ba 'di ni /
analyzed: ji lta bur chos thams cad la ye shes thob cing pha rol ma yin pa'i rkyen mngon par shes pa de ltar sems can gyi rgyu'i phyir chos 'di dag 'byung ba 'di ni /
translated: In whatever way he attains the knowledge of all phenomena and the superknowledges, in just that way he causes the arising of these phenomena for the sake of beings.

original: sems can yongs su smin par sbyor ba'i thabs la mkhas pa'i ye shes te /
analyzed: sems can yongs su smin par sbyor ba'i thabs la mkhas pa'i ye shes te /
translated: This is the wisdom of skill in means for engaging in the ripening of beings.

original: gang gi las kyis sems can rnams @292b dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par nus pa de'i bar du sbyor ba'i byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir chags pa med do //
analyzed: gang gi las kyis sems can rnams @292b dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed par nus pa de'i bar du sbyor ba'i byin gyis brlabs pa'i phyir chags pa med do //
translated: He is not attached, because he blesses the engagement up to the point where beings are able to generate the roots of virtue through his actions.

original: sems can nyan thos kyi theg pa ba rnams nyan thos kyi theg pa la sbyor bar byed do; ;sems can rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: sems can nyan thos kyi theg pa ba rnams nyan thos kyi theg pa la sbyor bar byed do; ;sems can rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa rnams rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: They connect beings who are followers of the Śrāvaka Vehicle to the Śrāvaka Vehicle. They connect beings who are followers of the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle to the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle.

original: sems can rnams ji lta bur phra ba'i chos las ye shes mngon sum du 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ltar byang chub kyi spyod pa zab mo la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: sems can rnams ji lta bur phra ba'i chos las ye shes mngon sum du 'byung bar 'gyur ba de ltar byang chub kyi spyod pa zab mo la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: They connect beings to the profound bodhisattva conduct in such a way that the arising of wisdom through the most subtle of phenomena becomes manifest.

original: las kyi rnam par smin pa la mkhas pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i dran pa rnam par mi spong ba 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pas rab tu 'byed pa'i ye shes mngon par bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi rnam par smin pa la mkhas pa'i ye shes dang ldan pa'i dran pa rnam par mi spong ba 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pas rab tu 'byed pa'i ye shes mngon par bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: This wisdom that is endowed with skill in the ripening of karma and that is undistracted mindfulness is accomplished by the bodhisattvas’ wisdom that is revealed through skill in means.”

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' chos dang sems la dbang byed par rab tu shes shing skad cig mar 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid la'ang rtog pa dang / sems can la snying rje chen po rnam par spong ba 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su smin pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' chos dang sems la dbang byed par rab tu shes shing skad cig mar 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid la'ang rtog pa dang / sems can la snying rje chen po rnam par spong ba 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su smin pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: It is also the skill in means of the bodhisattva to know how to control the mind and phenomena, to understand the characteristics of momentary destruction, and to abandon great compassion for sentient beings.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' sems can stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid du dmigs pa'ang med cing sems can rnams theg pa gsum la sbyor bar byed pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par sbyor ba'i rgyun ma bcad pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su smin pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' sems can stong pa nyid dang / don dam pa stong pa nyid la spyod pa thams cad kyi mtshan nyid du dmigs pa'ang med cing sems can rnams theg pa gsum la sbyor bar byed pa dang / sems can yongs su smin par sbyor ba'i rgyun ma bcad pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su smin pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: It is also the skill in means of the bodhisattva to not observe the characteristics of all practices of the emptiness of sentient beings and the emptiness of the ultimate, to connect sentient beings to the three vehicles, and to not interrupt the continuity of connecting with the ripening of sentient beings.

original: gang @293a *// byang chub sems dpa' lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi 'du byed bdag med pa dang ldan pas chos ston pa la dmigs pa med pa dang / nyan pa dang / sgra dang / dbyangs la dmigs pa med pa dang / las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la dmigs pa med pa dang /
analyzed: gang @293a *// byang chub sems dpa' lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi 'du byed bdag med pa dang ldan pas chos ston pa la dmigs pa med pa dang / nyan pa dang / sgra dang / dbyangs la dmigs pa med pa dang / las kyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa la dmigs pa med pa dang /
translated: “Bodhisattvas teach the Dharma with physical, verbal, and mental activity that is devoid of self, and they do so without reference point. They teach without reference point to the listener, to sound, and to melody, and without reference point to the ripening of karmic results.

original: sems can rnams snying rje ba'i phyir yang sems can phyin ci log la yang dag par 'du ba med pa rnams la sems can gyi mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'brel pa ston pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su sbyang ba mngon
analyzed: sems can rnams snying rje ba'i phyir yang sems can phyin ci log la yang dag par 'du ba med pa rnams la sems can gyi mtshan nyid kyi rjes su 'brel pa ston pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su sbyang ba mngon
translated: “Bodhisattvas teach the characteristics of sentient beings to those who are not truly united with sentient beings but who are mistaken about sentient beings, out of compassion for sentient beings. This is the bodhisattvas’ accomplishment of the purification of sentient beings through their skill in means.

original: par bsgrubs pa'o; ;byang chub sems dpa' rang bzhin gyis 'du byed par mi dmigs shing gtong bar mi dmigs pa dang / len pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'ang ma yin la /
analyzed: par bsgrubs pa'o; ;byang chub sems dpa' rang bzhin gyis 'du byed par mi dmigs shing gtong bar mi dmigs pa dang / len pa dang / rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu'ang ma yin la /
translated: “Bodhisattvas do not observe the natural formation of anything, nor do they observe the relinquishment of anything, nor do they observe the acceptance of anything, nor do they observe the ripening of karmic results.

original: sems can la snying rje ba'i phyir yang sbyin pa byin par 'gyur la sems can rnams la sbyin pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin par yang ston par byed pa dang / sbyin pa po bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po la sbyor bar byed pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su smin pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can la snying rje ba'i phyir yang sbyin pa byin par 'gyur la sems can rnams la sbyin pa'i 'bras bu rnam par smin par yang ston par byed pa dang / sbyin pa po bsod nams bya ba'i dngos po la sbyor bar byed pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su smin pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: They give gifts out of compassion for sentient beings, and they show sentient beings the results of giving that will ripen for them. They also connect givers with the bases of meritorious action. This is how bodhisattvas, by means of their skill in means, accomplish the full maturation of sentient beings.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar sems can gyi lus spyod pa med pa dang / 'gyur ba med pa dang / mi gtsang ba'i gzugs brnyan lta bur rab tu shes pa dang / sems brag ca lta bur brtag pa dang / 'du byed sgyu ma'i rang bzhin lta @293b bur rab tu shes pa dang /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar sems can gyi lus spyod pa med pa dang / 'gyur ba med pa dang / mi gtsang ba'i gzugs brnyan lta bur rab tu shes pa dang / sems brag ca lta bur brtag pa dang / 'du byed sgyu ma'i rang bzhin lta @293b bur rab tu shes pa dang /
translated: Moreover, bodhisattvas know that the bodies of sentient beings are without action, without change, and like reflections of something impure. They know that the mind is like an echo, and that compounded things are like the nature of an illusion.

original: sems can rnams la snying rje chen po rab tu sbyor ba rnam par mi spong ba dang / sems can rnams lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi 'du byed la sbyor bar byed pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu yang dag par ston par byed pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su smin pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: sems can rnams la snying rje chen po rab tu sbyor ba rnam par mi spong ba dang / sems can rnams lus dang / ngag dang / yid kyi 'du byed la sbyor bar byed pa dang / rgyu dang 'bras bu yang dag par ston par byed pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su smin pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: It is also the bodhisattva’s skillful means to bring sentient beings to full maturity, by not abandoning the application of great compassion to sentient beings, by applying to sentient beings the formative activity of body, speech, and mind, and by teaching them the truth of cause and effect.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ji lta bur bdag med cing mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i tshul khrims la rtog par byed pa dang / spyod pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rab tu shes pa dang / 'di la sems can gyi btang snyoms su rab tu sbyor bar mi 'gyur ba dang /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ji lta bur bdag med cing mngon par 'du mi byed pa'i tshul khrims la rtog par byed pa dang / spyod pa'i mtshan nyid kyang rab tu shes pa dang / 'di la sems can gyi btang snyoms su rab tu sbyor bar mi 'gyur ba dang /
translated: Moreover, the bodhisattva should reflect on the morality of non-self and non-performance, and should understand the characteristics of practice. He should not apply himself to the indifference of sentient beings,

original: sems can rnams dang phung po gsum la sbyor bar byed pa 'di ni /
analyzed: sems can rnams dang phung po gsum la sbyor bar byed pa 'di ni /
translated: but should apply himself to the three groups of sentient beings.

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims su slob pa dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab la sbyor bar byed pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i sems can yongs su smin pa bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: lhag pa'i tshul khrims su slob pa dang / lhag pa'i sems dang / lhag pa'i shes rab la sbyor bar byed pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pa'i sems can yongs su smin pa bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: This is also the bodhisattva’s skillful means to bring beings to maturity, in that he or she causes them to train in superior morality, superior mind, and superior wisdom.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar lus dang ngag dang yid kyi 'du byed skad cig tu 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid du shes te /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' 'di ltar lus dang ngag dang yid kyi 'du byed skad cig tu 'jig pa'i mtshan nyid du shes te /
translated: “Moreover, the bodhisattva knows that the formative predispositions of body, speech, and mind are characterized by momentary disintegration.

original: 'dus ma byas kyi gnas dang bral par yang dag par rjes su mthong zhing sems can rnams la ting nge 'dzin dang / bzod pa'i rgyu dang / 'bras bu mtshungs par ston pa de la sems can rnams sbyor bar byed pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su smin pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas kyi gnas dang bral par yang dag par rjes su mthong zhing sems can rnams la ting nge 'dzin dang / bzod pa'i rgyu dang / 'bras bu mtshungs par ston pa de la sems can rnams sbyor bar byed pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su smin pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: He or she sees that they are devoid of an unconditioned realm, and yet he or she causes beings to engage in the causes and effects of meditative concentration and patience, demonstrating them to be equivalent. This is also the bodhisattva’s skillful means to bring beings to maturity.

original: byang chub @294a *//
analyzed: byang chub @294a *//
translated: “Moreover, the bodhisattva, in order to bring beings to maturity,

original: sems dpa' ji ltar yang blang ba med pa dang dor ba med pa'i 'du byed thams cad shes shing rgyu dang 'bras bur yang rtog pa dang / chos thams cad skye ba dang / 'gog par dmigs pa med pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen gyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dang bral bar rab tu mi shes pa dang /
analyzed: sems dpa' ji ltar yang blang ba med pa dang dor ba med pa'i 'du byed thams cad shes shing rgyu dang 'bras bur yang rtog pa dang / chos thams cad skye ba dang / 'gog par dmigs pa med pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen gyi 'bras bu rnam par smin pa dang bral bar rab tu mi shes pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattvas know that all formations are neither to be adopted nor discarded, and they understand cause and effect. They do not apprehend the arising or cessation of any phenomena, and they do not understand the ripening of the results of causes and conditions.

original: sems can rnams yongs su smin pa med pa dang / snying rje chen po'i rgyun mi gcod pa dang / yang sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa rab tu spang pa dang / phung po yongs su shes pa dang / ye shes mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus brtsam pa dang /
analyzed: sems can rnams yongs su smin pa med pa dang / snying rje chen po'i rgyun mi gcod pa dang / yang sems can rnams kyi nyon mongs pa rab tu spang pa dang / phung po yongs su shes pa dang / ye shes mngon sum du bya ba'i phyir brtson 'grus brtsam pa dang /
translated: They do not bring sentient beings to full maturity, and they do not sever the continuity of great compassion. They do not eliminate the afflictions of sentient beings, and they do not apply diligence to the complete understanding of the aggregates and the direct realization of wisdom.

original: rgyu'i 'bras bu ston par byed pa dang / sems can le lo can rnams brtson 'grus la dmigs pa'i sdug bsngal 'dzin pa la sbyor ba 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su smin pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyu'i 'bras bu ston par byed pa dang / sems can le lo can rnams brtson 'grus la dmigs pa'i sdug bsngal 'dzin pa la sbyor ba 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su smin pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: This is also a bodhisattva’s skillful means to bring about the maturation of sentient beings, in that it causes those sentient beings who are lazy to take up the practice of bearing suffering in order to be diligent.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar yang bsam gtan la bsam gtan du byed cing 'du byed thams cad mi rtag par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / myong ba med pa dang / byas pa med pa dang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar yang bsam gtan la bsam gtan du byed cing 'du byed thams cad mi rtag par yang dag par rjes su mthong ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / myong ba med pa dang / byas pa med pa dang /
translated: “A bodhisattva should practice concentration in such a way that he sees all conditioned things as impermanent, as suffering, as selfless, as not to be experienced, as not to be done,

original: bya ba med pa dang / kun nas ldang ba med pa dang / skad cig tu zad pa med pa'i ye shes la mkhas pa'i 'du byed rnams yang dag par rjes su mthong ba dang / sems can rnams la'ang phung po la brten pa'i @294b bsam gtan la tshangs par spyod pa mngon par shes pa thob pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu ston pa dang /
analyzed: bya ba med pa dang / kun nas ldang ba med pa dang / skad cig tu zad pa med pa'i ye shes la mkhas pa'i 'du byed rnams yang dag par rjes su mthong ba dang / sems can rnams la'ang phung po la brten pa'i @294b bsam gtan la tshangs par spyod pa mngon par shes pa thob pa'i rgyu dang 'bras bu ston pa dang /
translated: They also teach sentient beings the cause and effect of the attainment of the higher perceptions of pure conduct in the meditative concentrations that are based on the aggregates.

original: bsam gtan gyis nyon mongs pa spang bar byos shig /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyis nyon mongs pa spang bar byos shig /
translated: They say, “You should abandon the afflictions through meditative concentration.”🔽In this way, they connect sentient beings to meditative concentration without any other motivation.

original: ces de ltar las gzhan ma yin pas sems can rnams bsam gtan la sbyor bar byed pa dang / thob pa chen po thob par byos shig /
analyzed: ces de ltar las gzhan ma yin pas sems can rnams bsam gtan la sbyor bar byed pa dang / thob pa chen po thob par byos shig /
translated: They say, “You should attain the great attainment.”

original: ces bsam gtan la sems sbyor bar byed pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su smin pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: ces bsam gtan la sems sbyor bar byed pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa' thabs la mkhas pas sems can yongs su smin pa mngon par bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: In this way, they connect the mind to meditative concentration. This is also the bodhisattvas’ accomplishment of the full maturation of sentient beings through their skill in means.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar blang ba med cing dor ba med pa dang / chags pa dang / khong khro ba gnyis ka dang bral bas thams cad btang snyoms thob pa dang / nan tan dang / bdag shes pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa dang /
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' ji ltar blang ba med cing dor ba med pa dang / chags pa dang / khong khro ba gnyis ka dang bral bas thams cad btang snyoms thob pa dang / nan tan dang / bdag shes pa dang / mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa dang /
translated: Furthermore, bodhisattvas attain equanimity by not adopting or rejecting anything and by being free from both attachment and aversion.

original: bsam gtan gyi dbang po la yid kyi 'du byed rnams rtog par mi byed /
analyzed: bsam gtan gyi dbang po la yid kyi 'du byed rnams rtog par mi byed /
translated: They are intent on the power of concentration, yet they do not conceptualize or think about mental formations.

original: rnam par rtog par mi byed pa dang / sems can rnams la snying rje chen po rab tu sbyor ba yongs su 'grub pa rab tu mi spong ba dang / shes rab sgom pa la brtson pas sems can rnams 'khor ba'i btson ra las rab tu thar par ston pa dang /
analyzed: rnam par rtog par mi byed pa dang / sems can rnams la snying rje chen po rab tu sbyor ba yongs su 'grub pa rab tu mi spong ba dang / shes rab sgom pa la brtson pas sems can rnams 'khor ba'i btson ra las rab tu thar par ston pa dang /
translated: They do not give up the accomplishment of applying great compassion to sentient beings, and they teach sentient beings how to be liberated from the prison of saṃsāra by being diligent in cultivating wisdom.

original: sems can rnams thos pa dang bsam gtan la brtson zhing tshol ba sgom pa la sbyor bar byed pa dang / yang byang chub sems dpa' ji lta ji lta bur dge ba'i chos kyi khyad par khong du chud pas 'khor ba'i 'dam las rgal bar 'gyur ba de lta de lta bur sems can rnams chos de dang de dag la yang dag par gzhog par byed /
analyzed: sems can rnams thos pa dang bsam gtan la brtson zhing tshol ba sgom pa la sbyor bar byed pa dang / yang byang chub sems dpa' ji lta ji lta bur dge ba'i chos kyi khyad par khong du chud pas 'khor ba'i 'dam las rgal bar 'gyur ba de lta de lta bur sems can rnams chos de dang de dag la yang dag par gzhog par byed /
translated: Moreover, to the extent that bodhisattvas understand the distinctive qualities of virtue and thereby cross over the swamp of cyclic existence, to that extent they cause sentient beings to engage in those qualities,

original: sbyor bar byed /
analyzed: sbyor bar byed /
translated: to apply themselves to them,

original: @295a *// 'god par byed pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi thabs la mkhas pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir don mthun pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po mngon par bsgrubs pa'o //
analyzed: @295a *// 'god par byed pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i ye shes kyi thabs la mkhas pas sems can rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir don mthun pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po mngon par bsgrubs pa'o //
translated: and to be established in them. This is also the accomplishment of the means of attraction of sharing the same aim through the bodhisattvas’ skill in the means of knowledge for the sake of bringing sentient beings to full maturity.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i ba spu'i khung bu ji snyed pa de snyed kyi sems can yongs su smin pa don mthun pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i ba spu'i khung bu ji snyed pa de snyed kyi sems can yongs su smin pa don mthun pa'i bsdu ba'i dngos po'o //
translated: for each pore of a bodhisattva’s body, there are that many sentient beings to be brought to full maturity through the means of attraction of sharing the same aim.

original: gzhan yang nyon mongs pa rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du ngan song gsum dang / ngan song du spyod pa'i nyes pa dang / sems can nyon mongs pa dang / tshe dang / lta ba dang / bskal pa'i rnyog pas byang chub sems dpa' rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di las smon lam gyi rgyun mi gcod cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi tshogs la mngon par mi 'dod pa dang /
analyzed: gzhan yang nyon mongs pa rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du ngan song gsum dang / ngan song du spyod pa'i nyes pa dang / sems can nyon mongs pa dang / tshe dang / lta ba dang / bskal pa'i rnyog pas byang chub sems dpa' rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di las smon lam gyi rgyun mi gcod cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi tshogs la mngon par mi 'dod pa dang /
translated: Furthermore, in a buddhafield with the five defilements of afflictions, the bodhisattva does not interrupt the stream of aspiration to purify the three lower rebirths, the faults of conduct in the lower rebirths, the afflictions of sentient beings, the defilements of life, view, and eon, and the bodhisattva does not aspire to the collection of qualities of a buddhafield.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par smon lam mi byed do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par smon lam mi byed do //
translated: He does not aspire to a completely pure buddhafield.

original: yang nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis byang chub kyi spyad pa spyod pa na sems can mtshams med pa byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos spong ba dang / 'phags pa la skur ba 'debs pa dang /
analyzed: yang nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du pha rol tu phyin pa drug gis byang chub kyi spyad pa spyod pa na sems can mtshams med pa byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos spong ba dang / 'phags pa la skur ba 'debs pa dang /
translated: Moreover, in a buddhafield with the five defilements of afflictions, when practicing the conduct of enlightenment with the six perfections, the bodhisattva does not interrupt the stream of aspiration to purify the three lower rebirths, the faults of conduct in the lower rebirths, the afflictions of sentient beings, the defilements of life, view, and eon, and the bodhisattva does not aspire to the collection of qualities of a buddhafield.

original: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang lhan cig tu 'grogs pa rnams bsdu ba'i dngos po rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gis sems can rnams yongs su smin pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang lhan cig tu 'grogs pa rnams bsdu ba'i dngos po rnam pa bzhi po 'di dag gis sems can rnams yongs su smin pa skyed par byed do //
translated: By means of these four means of gathering disciples, they bring beings to full maturity.

original: theg pa gsum la sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: theg pa gsum la sbyor bar byed do //
translated: They introduce them to the three vehicles.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la dgod par byed do //
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug la dgod par byed do //
translated: They establish them in the six perfections.

original: de'ang 'dir de tsam gyis @295b byang chub kyi spyad pa spyod cing sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: de'ang 'dir de tsam gyis @295b byang chub kyi spyad pa spyod cing sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: And by doing just that, they practice the conduct of awakening and bring beings to full maturity.

original: 'dir yang 'dul ba 'dzin pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: 'dir yang 'dul ba 'dzin pa nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Here too, they are the upholders of the monastic code, and so on, up to and they fully awaken to unsurpassed and perfect buddhahood.

original: byang chub thob pa na'ang sems can mtshams med pa byed pa nas mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang lhan cig tu 'grogs pa'i bar du yongs su smin par 'gro zhing sems can rnams theg pa gsum la yongs su smin par byed pa nyon mongs pa'i lta ba thams
analyzed: byang chub thob pa na'ang sems can mtshams med pa byed pa nas mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang lhan cig tu 'grogs pa'i bar du yongs su smin par 'gro zhing sems can rnams theg pa gsum la yongs su smin par byed pa nyon mongs pa'i lta ba thams
translated: And when they attain awakening, they bring to full maturity those beings who have committed the actions with immediate result, up to and those who are keeping company with those who have severed the roots of virtue. They bring beings to full maturity in the three vehicles.

original: cad las yongs su thar par byed pa 'di'ang rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: cad las yongs su thar par byed pa 'di'ang rigs kyi bu /
translated: It is also the one who liberates all beings from all suffering.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir byang chub sems dpa' rtsal chen pos yongs su smin pa'i go cha'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir byang chub sems dpa' rtsal chen pos yongs su smin pa'i go cha'o //
translated: This is the armor of the bodhisattvas who have attained great power in this buddhafield, which is defiled by the five degenerations.

original: gang byang chub sems dpa' las sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par sems can gyi go cha rnam pa de lta bus sems can yongs su smin par bya bar mi nus pa 'di'ang rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gang byang chub sems dpa' las sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par sems can gyi go cha rnam pa de lta bus sems can yongs su smin par bya bar mi nus pa 'di'ang rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble son, this buddhafield is defiled by the five degenerations, and in it the bodhisattvas are not able to bring beings to maturity by means of the armor of the bodhisattvas.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha de lta bu dang ldan pas sems can yongs su smin pa'o //🔽yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul nam mkha'i mdog gis 'dul ba'i bzod pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po go cha de lta bu dang ldan pas sems can yongs su smin pa'o // yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul nam mkha'i mdog gis 'dul ba'i bzod pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo /
translated: “Noble son, the bodhisattva great beings who are endowed with such an armor bring beings to maturity.

original: le'u gsum pa'o ////🔽rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: le'u gsum pa'o //// rigs kyi bu /
translated: The Sūtra of the Sky’s Luminous Display, the third chapter.

original: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi tshogs gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi tshogs gang zhe na /
translated: “Noble son, what is the bodhisattvas’ accumulation of qualities of a buddhafield?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po snying rje chen @296a *//
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po snying rje chen @296a *//
translated: in this buddha realm, which is afflicted by the five degenerations, bodhisattva mahāsattvas who possess great compassion,

original: po dang ldan pa bar 'ga' ci zhig tu skyes pa na sems can mtshams med pa byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos spong ba dang / 'phags pa rnams la skur ba 'debs pa dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang lhan cig 'grogs pa rnams yongs su smin par byed /
analyzed: po dang ldan pa bar 'ga' ci zhig tu skyes pa na sems can mtshams med pa byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos spong ba dang / 'phags pa rnams la skur ba 'debs pa dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang lhan cig 'grogs pa rnams yongs su smin par byed /
translated: having been born here for some reason, bring to maturity sentient beings who commit the actions of immediate retribution, who abandon the sublime Dharma, who denigrate the noble ones, and who associate with the roots of nonvirtue.

original: dge ba'i chos thams cad la sbyor bar byed /
analyzed: dge ba'i chos thams cad la sbyor bar byed /
translated: They cause them to engage in all virtuous qualities.

original: nyon mongs pa dang / lta ba'i bag chags thams cad las sems can yongs su smin par byed cing /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / lta ba'i bag chags thams cad las sems can yongs su smin par byed cing /
translated: They bring sentient beings to maturity, causing them to be free from all afflictions and habitual tendencies toward views.

original: sems can re re'i don gyi phyir bskal pa'i sdug bsngal mang po bzod pa nas sems can de 'khor ba'i 'dam las sgrol ba dang / sangs rgyas gcig gi thad du phul ba nas sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi thad kyi bar du phul lo //
analyzed: sems can re re'i don gyi phyir bskal pa'i sdug bsngal mang po bzod pa nas sems can de 'khor ba'i 'dam las sgrol ba dang / sangs rgyas gcig gi thad du phul ba nas sangs rgyas bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi thad kyi bar du phul lo //
translated: For the sake of each and every sentient being, he endures many eons of suffering, and he liberates that sentient being from the mire of cyclic existence. He makes offerings to a single Buddha, and then to a hundred thousand times ten million billion Buddhas.

original: gang gi tshe sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba la brten par 'gyur ba de sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la bya ba byas pa dang / rnam par rol pa mngon par shes pa ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob pas phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing chu bo gangg'a'i bye ma snyed du rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis nye bar 'gro bar nus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba la brten par 'gyur ba de sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la bya ba byas pa dang / rnam par rol pa mngon par shes pa ting nge 'dzin gyi stobs kyi pha rol tu phyin pa thob pas phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing chu bo gangg'a'i bye ma snyed du rdzu 'phrul gyi stobs kyis nye bar 'gro bar nus par 'gyur ro //
translated: When sentient beings are established in the roots of virtue, he has served the Blessed Buddhas, and he has attained the perfection of the power of meditative concentration, which is the superknowledge of magical transformation. He is able to go by his magical power to the Buddha-fields in the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River.

original: de na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la bsnyen bkur to //
analyzed: de na sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la bsnyen bkur to //
translated: There he serves the Blessed Buddhas.

original: de na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi tshogs nye bar rtogs so //
analyzed: de na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi tshogs nye bar rtogs so //
translated: There he realizes the accumulation of the qualities of the Buddha-fields.

original: de na yongs su dag pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi tshogs chen po'ang ci 'dra ba yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
analyzed: de na yongs su dag pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi tshogs chen po'ang ci 'dra ba yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
translated: He will also see the great accumulation of qualities of the completely pure buddha realm.

original: de na'ang rigs kyi bu de'i shin tu sred pa dang @296b ldan par skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de na'ang rigs kyi bu de'i shin tu sred pa dang @296b ldan par skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Noble son, he will be born there with great craving.

original: rigs kyi bu des yang de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la yongs su zhus pa /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu des yang de bzhin gshegs pa de dag la yongs su zhus pa /
translated: The noble son will ask those thus-gone ones,🔽‘What are the actions by which bodhisattvas are born in a completely pure buddha realm?

original: las cis na byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par skye bar 'gyur; sangs rgyas la blta ba dang / chos nyan pa dang / dge 'dun la bsnyen bkur bas 'bral ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las cis na byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par skye bar 'gyur; sangs rgyas la blta ba dang / chos nyan pa dang / dge 'dun la bsnyen bkur bas 'bral ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will never be separated from seeing the Buddha, hearing the Dharma, and serving the Saṅgha.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pas 'dres pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pas 'dres pa med pa'o //
translated: They will not be mixed up with the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis 'dres pa med pa'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa thams cad kyis 'dres pa med pa'o //
translated: They will not be mixed up with any afflictions.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs thams cad kyis 'bral ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang gzungs thams cad kyis 'bral ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will never be separated from all absorptions and dhāraṇīs.

original: yang nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du mi skye ba ji tsam pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang mi rgya'o //
analyzed: yang nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du mi skye ba ji tsam pa bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu 'tshang mi rgya'o //
translated: I will not attain unsurpassed and perfect awakening until my buddhafield is free from the five degenerations and the afflictions.

original: byang chub thob pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de rgya che zhing sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi tshogs kyis rgyas par 'gyur ro; ;byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po dag la yang dag par zhugs pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing de khyab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub thob pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de rgya che zhing sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi tshogs kyis rgyas par 'gyur ro; ;byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po dag la yang dag par zhugs pas sangs rgyas kyi zhing de khyab par 'gyur ro //
translated: When I attain awakening, my buddhafield will be vast and filled with the qualities of a buddhafield, and it will be filled with bodhisattvas who have entered the Great Vehicle.

original: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i sems can gyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i sems can gyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It will be free of the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas.🔽The blessed buddhas said to that noble son,

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis rigs kyi bu de la ji lta ba bzhin du gsungs pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das de dag gis rigs kyi bu de la ji lta ba bzhin du gsungs pa /
translated: “Excellent!

original: las gang dang gang spyod pa dang / nan tan gang gis yon tan de dag thob par 'gyur ba de'ang rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: las gang dang gang spyod pa dang / nan tan gang gis yon tan de dag thob par 'gyur ba de'ang rigs kyi bu /
translated: Whatever actions they perform and whatever practices they undertake, they will attain those qualities.

original: tshe rabs su yon tan dang spyod pa'i nan tan la brtson par 'gyur ba nas der skye bar 'gyur ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: tshe rabs su yon tan dang spyod pa'i nan tan la brtson par 'gyur ba nas der skye bar 'gyur ba'i bar du'o //
translated: Son of noble family, they will strive in their lives to perfect those qualities and practices, and they will be reborn there.

original: yon tan ji tsam pa thams cad yongs @297a *//
analyzed: yon tan ji tsam pa thams cad yongs @297a *//
translated: To the extent that they have all those qualities,

original: su rdzogs shing sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi tshogs rgya chen po thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing du khyab par 'gyur ro //🔽gang na rigs kyi bu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba de nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa rnam par spangs pa ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag pa rnams la theg pa
analyzed: su rdzogs shing sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi tshogs rgya chen po thams cad kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing du khyab par 'gyur ro // gang na rigs kyi bu bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba de nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa rnam par spangs pa ste byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag pa rnams la theg pa
translated: they will be filled with all the vast accumulations of qualities of a buddha realm.

original: chen po dag pa'i gtam smra bar byed kyi /
analyzed: chen po dag pa'i gtam smra bar byed kyi /
translated: Wherever sons of noble family attain manifest, complete enlightenment in unsurpassed, perfect buddhahood, that place is free from the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas. There, the bodhisattva great beings, who are pure, speak the teachings of the Great Vehicle.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi gtam ni /
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi gtam ni /
translated: the discourses of the śrāvakas,🔽and the discourses of the pratyekabuddhas.

original: ma yin no //
analyzed: ma yin no //
translated: He does not speak of the disciples and solitary sages.

original: sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed pa dang / yongs su spyod pa byas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan mang po dang ldan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi yon tan tshad med pa la 'jug pa'i ye shes la mkhas pa rnams la chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: sems can dge ba'i rtsa ba skyed pa dang / yongs su spyod pa byas pa dang / byang chub sems dpa'i yon tan mang po dang ldan pa dang / sangs rgyas kyi yon tan tshad med pa la 'jug pa'i ye shes la mkhas pa rnams la chos ston par byed do //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those who have planted the roots of virtue, who have practiced the conduct, who are endowed with the many qualities of the bodhisattvas, and who are skilled in the wisdom that engages with the immeasurable qualities of the buddhas.

original: gang dag la chos ston pa de dag thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par skye bar bya ba'i phyir ston gyi /
analyzed: gang dag la chos ston pa de dag thams cad sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par skye bar bya ba'i phyir ston gyi /
translated: He teaches the Dharma to those who will be born in a pure buddha realm in order to purify all buddha realms.

original: yongs su ma dag par ma yin no //
analyzed: yongs su ma dag par ma yin no //
translated: He does not teach to those who will be born in an impure realm.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byang chub kyi spyod pa bsngags par byed kyi /🔽yongs su ma dag pa ni /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa drug yongs su rdzogs par bya ba'i phyir sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byang chub kyi spyod pa bsngags par byed kyi / yongs su ma dag pa ni /
translated: He praises the conduct of awakening in order to purify a buddha realm and complete the six perfections.

original: bsngags par mi byed do //
analyzed: bsngags par mi byed do //
translated: He does not praise an impure realm.

original: sems can gyi bsam pa yongs su dag pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag dang 'grogs shing sten pa dang / sdom pa la dgod pa dang / yon sbyong ba bsngags par byed kyi /🔽yongs su ma dag pa ni /
analyzed: sems can gyi bsam pa yongs su dag pas dge ba'i bshes gnyen de dag dang 'grogs shing sten pa dang / sdom pa la dgod pa dang / yon sbyong ba bsngags par byed kyi / yongs su ma dag pa ni /
translated: They associate with and attend spiritual benefactors who are pure in their intentions toward sentient beings, and they establish them in vows and praise the purification of generosity.

original: ma yin no //🔽rigs @297b kyi bu; gang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag thams cad kyis sngon rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su ma dag par thog mar sa bon
analyzed: ma yin no // rigs @297b kyi bu; gang sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par 'das pa'i de bzhin gshegs pa dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas de dag thams cad kyis sngon rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su ma dag par thog mar sa bon
translated: But they do not do so with those who are impure.🔽Son of noble family, all the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddhas who have passed through the pure buddha realms first planted the

original: bskyed nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: bskyed nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: seeds in impure buddha realms with the five degenerations, and then gave rise to the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: gang yang phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa tshad med grangs med par da ltar gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po dag la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la theg pa chen po
analyzed: gang yang phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa tshad med grangs med par da ltar gyi sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das bzhugs shing 'tsho skyong ba byang chub sems dpa' theg pa chen po dag la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la theg pa chen po
translated: In the same way, in the present, the blessed buddhas who dwell in the infinite and innumerable pure buddhafields of the ten directions, and who teach the Great Vehicle to the bodhisattvas who have entered the Great Vehicle,

original: dag pa'i gtam smra ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyis sngon nyon mongs pa dang rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir thog mar sa bon bskyed nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: dag pa'i gtam smra ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa de dag thams cad kyis sngon nyon mongs pa dang rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir thog mar sa bon bskyed nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: all those thus-gone ones first generated the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening in this buddhafield of afflictions and five corruptions, after planting the seeds here.

original: 'dir yang sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba la brten par gyur to //
analyzed: 'dir yang sngon dge ba'i rtsa ba la brten par gyur to //
translated: Here, they also relied on roots of virtue in the past.

original: mngon par shes pa gang gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan du 'gro ba'i mngon par shes pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: mngon par shes pa gang gis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing gzhan du 'gro ba'i mngon par shes pa thob par gyur to //
translated: By means of supernormal knowledge, they attained the supernormal knowledge of going from one pure buddhafield to another.

original: gang na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi tshogs tshad bzung ba dang brtags pa der phyin chad kyang skye bar smon lam byas pas /
analyzed: gang na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi tshogs tshad bzung ba dang brtags pa der phyin chad kyang skye bar smon lam byas pas /
translated: Wherever the assembly of qualities of a buddha-field is measured and examined, one makes a prayer to be born there.

original: der bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //🔽yang phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par phyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang @298a *//
analyzed: der bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub kyi bar du mngon par 'tshang rgya'o // yang phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par phyis bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang @298a *//
translated: Up to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, one will fully awaken there.

original: chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba de dag thams cad kyis rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su ma dag par thams cad kyi thog mar dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sa bon bskyed nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub bo //
analyzed: chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba de dag thams cad kyis rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su ma dag par thams cad kyi thog mar dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sa bon bskyed nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs par byang chub bo //
translated: Moreover, all those who fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening in the pure buddha-fields of the ten directions, having first generated the seed of the root of virtue in the impure buddha-fields of the five corruptions, will fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: gang gi tshe sems bskyed pas mngon par shes pa thob pa ni /
analyzed: gang gi tshe sems bskyed pas mngon par shes pa thob pa ni /
translated: When one attains the superknowledges through generating the mind,

original: sa rab nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: sa rab nas sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: From the eighth stage up to the stage of buddhahood, they purify the buddha-fields and fully awaken to unsurpassed, perfect enlightenment.

original: gang yang phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byang chub sems dpa' dag da ltar chos kyi sgra sna tshogs kyis nyon mongs pa sna tshogs dang bral zhing chos zab mo'i tshul la 'jug pa'i ye shes la mkhas pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang /
analyzed: gang yang phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byang chub sems dpa' dag da ltar chos kyi sgra sna tshogs kyis nyon mongs pa sna tshogs dang bral zhing chos zab mo'i tshul la 'jug pa'i ye shes la mkhas pa dang / phyir mi ldog pa dang /
translated: Those bodhisattvas in the pure buddha-fields of the ten directions, who now, by various means, are free from various afflictions, skilled in the wisdom that enters the way of the profound Dharma, irreversible,

original: gang yang chos zab me'i bzod pa thob pas dga' ba dang bde ba myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang yang chos zab me'i bzod pa thob pas dga' ba dang bde ba myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: and those who, having attained the acceptance of the profound Dharma, experience joy and bliss.

original: gang yang da ltar khyed cag sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing mi mjed rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir mngon par lhags pa khyed cag thams cad kyi sngon thams cad kyi thog mar
analyzed: gang yang da ltar khyed cag sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa nas de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing mi mjed rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir mngon par lhags pa khyed cag thams cad kyi sngon thams cad kyi thog mar
translated: “All of you who have now come from the pure buddha realms to this buddha realm of the Thus-Gone Śākyamuni, this buddha realm of the Sahā world with its five corruptions, in the beginning

original: nyon mongs pa dang rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sa bon bskyed nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du dge ba'i rtsa ba'i sa bon bskyed nas bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sems bskyed do //
translated: planted the seeds of roots of virtue in a buddha realm with afflictions and five corruptions, and generated the mind set on unsurpassed and perfect awakening.

original: thams cad kyi thog mar pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brtson par byas pa de la'ang mngon par shes pa gang gis @298b phyis phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa gzhan du 'gro ba'i mngon par shes pa thob par gyur to //
analyzed: thams cad kyi thog mar pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brtson par byas pa de la'ang mngon par shes pa gang gis @298b phyis phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa gzhan du 'gro ba'i mngon par shes pa thob par gyur to //
translated: In the beginning, you exerted yourselves in the six perfections, and through those superknowledges you attained the superknowledge of going to other pure buddha realms in the ten directions.”

original: gang na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi tshogs kun tu shes shing rtogs pa der gyis skye pa mngon par shes pa'i smon lam byas pas de dag nyid kyi nan tan gyis zhugs pas bsam pa ji snyed pa yongs su rdzogs so //🔽sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa der skyes pa rnams sangs rgyas gzhan 'phel ba'i phyir yang rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su ma dag pa 'di ni /
analyzed: gang na sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi tshogs kun tu shes shing rtogs pa der gyis skye pa mngon par shes pa'i smon lam byas pas de dag nyid kyi nan tan gyis zhugs pas bsam pa ji snyed pa yongs su rdzogs so // sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa der skyes pa rnams sangs rgyas gzhan 'phel ba'i phyir yang rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su ma dag pa 'di ni /
translated: The bodhisattva's vow is: May I be born in a buddha-field where I can know and understand the entire collection of qualities of the buddha-field. By the power of his practice of that vow, he fulfills all his intentions.

original: mi 'dod do //
analyzed: mi 'dod do //
translated: Those born in that pure buddha-field do not desire this impure buddha-field, which is defiled by the five degenerations, in order to increase the buddha-fields of other buddhas.

original: nyon mongs pas bsgribs pa dang / lta ba dog pa thong pa 'di dag smod cing 'di la snying rje chen po mi skyed pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'i /
analyzed: nyon mongs pas bsgribs pa dang / lta ba dog pa thong pa 'di dag smod cing 'di la snying rje chen po mi skyed pa de dag byang chub sems dpa' zhes bya'i /
translated: Those who, obscured by afflictions and narrow-minded, despise this [impure buddha-field] and do not generate great compassion for it, are called bodhisattvas,

original: sems dpa' chen po zhes mi bya'o //🔽rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: sems dpa' chen po zhes mi bya'o // rigs kyi bu /
translated: but not great beings.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: Son of noble family, it is like this:

original: dper na / gtar mkhan mkhas pa la la mchog tu dri zhim pa dang ldan pa'i sman gyi yo byad kyis mi zher ba dang long ba rnams kyi mig gi nang cung zad tsam rab tu zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: dper na / gtar mkhan mkhas pa la la mchog tu dri zhim pa dang ldan pa'i sman gyi yo byad kyis mi zher ba dang long ba rnams kyi mig gi nang cung zad tsam rab tu zhi bar byed do //
translated: For example, a certain skilled surgeon, with a medicinal ointment of the most excellent fragrance, would slightly soothe the eyes of the blind and the sightless.

original: zhi bar shes nas de dag gcig la gcig smras pa /
analyzed: zhi bar shes nas de dag gcig la gcig smras pa /
translated: Having become aware of the peace, they would say to one another:

original: bdag cag gis gzugs kyi snang ba la lta bar brtsams te bdag cag sgron mar gyur pa'i sman pa'i khyim 'di nas byung la 'gro bar bya'o snyam nas phyir 'ong ba'ang med pa mang po de dag kyang gang sman pa'i khyim de las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bdag cag gis gzugs kyi snang ba la lta bar brtsams te bdag cag sgron mar gyur pa'i sman pa'i khyim 'di nas byung la 'gro bar bya'o snyam nas phyir 'ong ba'ang med pa mang po de dag kyang gang sman pa'i khyim de las 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “We have begun to see the appearance of forms. We have come out of this house of the physician who is like a lamp. We will go forth.” And many of them, without returning, would leave that place.

original: ji lta bur nad 'di rab tu zhi ba med pa de dag mig gi nad yun ring bor gnas pa bltas nas yang 'ong ngo //🔽de dag kyang sman pa'i khyim der @299a *//
analyzed: ji lta bur nad 'di rab tu zhi ba med pa de dag mig gi nad yun ring bor gnas pa bltas nas yang 'ong ngo // de dag kyang sman pa'i khyim der @299a *//
translated: But those whose disease is not completely pacified would stay on, watching for a long time the disease of their eyes.

original: gnas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnas par 'gyur ro //
translated: And they would remain in that house of the physician.

original: de dag yun mi ring bas kyang nad thams cad grol bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag yun mi ring bas kyang nad thams cad grol bar 'gyur ro //
translated: And after a short time, all their diseases would be cured.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de bzhin du gang byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gang la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / lta ba ngan pas rtag tu gtso ba'i sems can rnams la la la dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung bar 'gyur ba de dag kyang ji ltar yon tan khong du chud pa de ltar rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de las 'byol bar 'dod do
analyzed: de bzhin du gang byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gang la 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug dang / nga rgyal dang / rgyags pa dang / lta ba ngan pas rtag tu gtso ba'i sems can rnams la la la dge ba'i bshes gnyen gyis yongs su bzung bar 'gyur ba de dag kyang ji ltar yon tan khong du chud pa de ltar rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing de las 'byol bar 'dod do
translated: in the same way, those bodhisattvas who are in a buddhafield with afflictions and five degenerations, and who are constantly overwhelmed by desire, anger, ignorance, pride, conceit, and bad views, if they are taken care of by a spiritual friend, they will want to leave that buddhafield with five degenerations as much as they have understood its qualities.

original: // gang yang de las 'das shing sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par rnam par spyod pa de nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gdon mi za bar 'gro bar 'dod do //
analyzed: // gang yang de las 'das shing sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par rnam par spyod pa de nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du gdon mi za bar 'gro bar 'dod do //
translated: Those who go beyond that and want to practice in a completely pure buddhafield will certainly go to a buddhafield with afflictions and five degenerations.

original: de dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing dpag tu med pa grangs med pa rdul shin tu phra ba snyed las shin tu 'das pas yun ring por sdug bsngal 'dod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang sangs rgyas kyi zhing dpag tu med pa grangs med pa rdul shin tu phra ba snyed las shin tu 'das pas yun ring por sdug bsngal 'dod par 'gyur ro //
translated: They will have to endure suffering for a long time, for countless, immeasurable, incalculable eons.

original: gang gi tshe de dag sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su ma dag pa der bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang mi rgya ba 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi tshogs yongs su
analyzed: gang gi tshe de dag sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su ma dag pa der bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang mi rgya ba 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa' rnams kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi tshogs yongs su
translated: When they do not attain supreme perfect enlightenment in a pure buddha-field, this is the bodhisattvas’ accumulation of the qualities of a buddha-field.

original: dag pa'o // rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: dag pa'o // rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: why is this?

original: nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du snga dro'i dus gcig gis kyang tshul khrims bsrungs so //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du snga dro'i dus gcig gis kyang tshul khrims bsrungs so //
translated: In a buddha-field with afflictions and five turbidities, they have observed discipline,

original: tshul @299b khrims bsgoms so //
analyzed: tshul @299b khrims bsgoms so //
translated: cultivated discipline,

original: sbyin pa byin no //
analyzed: sbyin pa byin no //
translated: practiced generosity,

original: bsam gtan la bsam gtan byas so //🔽brtson 'grus brtsams so //
analyzed: bsam gtan la bsam gtan byas so // brtson 'grus brtsams so //
translated: practiced concentration,🔽practiced diligence,

original: bzod pa bsgoms so //
analyzed: bzod pa bsgoms so //
translated: and cultivated patience,

original: shes rab kyi yon tan brtsams so //
analyzed: shes rab kyi yon tan brtsams so //
translated: The good qualities of wisdom are begun.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bskal pa brgya stong du'ang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brtson pas spyad pa spyod pa'ang ma yin no //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par bskal pa brgya stong du'ang pha rol tu phyin pa drug la brtson pas spyad pa spyod pa'ang ma yin no //
translated: It is not by striving for a hundred thousand eons in the six perfections that one will purify a buddhafield.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: why is that?

original: gang yang nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du thams cad kyi thog mar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sa bon bskyed do //
analyzed: gang yang nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du thams cad kyi thog mar bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu sa bon bskyed do //
translated: In a buddhafield with afflictions and five degenerations, one first plants the seeds of unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening.

original: yang rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing der 'gro zhing 'dir de tsam gyi brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i brtson 'grus kyis dge ba'i chos yongs su tshol ba la mngon par brtson par gnas so //
analyzed: yang rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing der 'gro zhing 'dir de tsam gyi brtson 'grus brtsams pa'i brtson 'grus kyis dge ba'i chos yongs su tshol ba la mngon par brtson par gnas so //
translated: Then, in that buddhafield with five degenerations, one goes there and abides in striving for the virtue of seeking the Dharma with the striving that is begun here.

original: gang de lta bu'i ye shes snang ba thob pa de thams cad yul smra ba rnam par dpyod pa'i ye shes g-yo ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang de lta bu'i ye shes snang ba thob pa de thams cad yul smra ba rnam par dpyod pa'i ye shes g-yo ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Whoever attains that kind of light of wisdom will have the wisdom that is unmoved by the analysis of the speech of the objects.

original: 'jig rten gyi chos rnams las 'phags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi chos rnams las 'phags par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be exalted above worldly dharmas.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhing lta ba snang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhing lta ba snang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will see the buddha-fields.

original: sems can gyi spyod pa brjod du med pa mngon par shes pa'i ye shes la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sems can gyi spyod pa brjod du med pa mngon par shes pa'i ye shes la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be skilled in the knowledge of the superknowledges of the inexpressible conduct of beings.🔽“He will not give up on beings whose bodies are impaired and who are accompanied by unwholesome roots.🔽He will give them medicine and medical supplies according to their illness, and he will give them whatever they need.🔽He will give them whatever they need.🔽He will give them whatever they need.

original: sems can lus ma rungs pa dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dang lhan cig tu 'grogs pa rnams la yongs su gtong ba'ang med /🔽sems can lus nyon mongs pas dkrugs pa rnams ci 'dra bar mthong ba la sems kyi nad ci phan du rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir de 'dra ba'i sems kyis sman gyi @300a *//
analyzed: sems can lus ma rungs pa dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba rnams dang lhan cig tu 'grogs pa rnams la yongs su gtong ba'ang med / sems can lus nyon mongs pas dkrugs pa rnams ci 'dra bar mthong ba la sems kyi nad ci phan du rab tu zhi bar bya ba'i phyir de 'dra ba'i sems kyis sman gyi @300a *//
translated: He will give them whatever they need.

original: yo byad rab tu ston par byed do //🔽gang gi nyon mongs pas sems can ngan du spyod pa dang ldan par mthong ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag bdag gis spangs te /
analyzed: yo byad rab tu ston par byed do // gang gi nyon mongs pas sems can ngan du spyod pa dang ldan par mthong ba'i nyon mongs pa de dag bdag gis spangs te /

original: sems can de la snying rje chen po bskyed do //
analyzed: sems can de la snying rje chen po bskyed do //
translated: He will give them whatever they need.🔽He will

original: nyon mongs pa de dag spang pa'i phyir brtson pas sems can rnams 'dul bar byed do //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa de dag spang pa'i phyir brtson pas sems can rnams 'dul bar byed do //
translated: He disciplines sentient beings by striving to eliminate those afflictions.

original: ji ltar nyon mongs pa las yongs su thar par bya zhes 'dod chags spyod pa rnams mi mdzes pa la rab tu sbyor bas rab tu zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: ji ltar nyon mongs pa las yongs su thar par bya zhes 'dod chags spyod pa rnams mi mdzes pa la rab tu sbyor bas rab tu zhi bar byed do //
translated: How does he liberate them from the afflictions? He pacifies those who engage in desire by applying them to the unattractive.

original: zhe sdang spyod pa rnams byams par rab tu sbyor ba dang / gti mug spyod pa rnams rten cing 'brel bar sbyor ba dang / skal pa dang bcas par spyod pa rnams dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba dran par rab tu sbyor ba dang / 'dod chags snrel zhing spyod pa rnams byams pa dang /
analyzed: zhe sdang spyod pa rnams byams par rab tu sbyor ba dang / gti mug spyod pa rnams rten cing 'brel bar sbyor ba dang / skal pa dang bcas par spyod pa rnams dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba dran par rab tu sbyor ba dang / 'dod chags snrel zhing spyod pa rnams byams pa dang /
translated: He applies those who engage in hatred to loving-kindness, those who engage in delusion to the principles of conditionality, those who engage in a mixture of all three to mindfulness of breathing, and those who engage in a mixture of all four to the four establishments of mindfulness.

original: mi dge ba rab tu sbyor ba dang / zhe sdang snrel zhir spyod pa rnams mi mdzes pa dang / byams par rab tu sbyor ba dang / gti mug snrel zhing spyod pa rnams mi mdzes pa dang / rten cing 'brel par rab tu sbyor ba dang /🔽lta ba ngan pa thob pa rnams stong pa nyid rab tu thob pa dang / rkyen stobs can rnams la rjes su srung ba dang ldan pa rab tu sbyor ba dang / rab tu gzung du med cing dngos po med pa dang / sgrog pa med par shes pa rnams zab mo rnam par zhi ba rab tu sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: mi dge ba rab tu sbyor ba dang / zhe sdang snrel zhir spyod pa rnams mi mdzes pa dang / byams par rab tu sbyor ba dang / gti mug snrel zhing spyod pa rnams mi mdzes pa dang / rten cing 'brel par rab tu sbyor ba dang / lta ba ngan pa thob pa rnams stong pa nyid rab tu thob pa dang / rkyen stobs can rnams la rjes su srung ba dang ldan pa rab tu sbyor ba dang / rab tu gzung du med cing dngos po med pa dang / sgrog pa med par shes pa rnams zab mo rnam par zhi ba rab tu sbyor ba dang /
translated: Those who engage in delusion and are inclined to wrong views are made to engage in emptiness.🔽Those who are powerful and have protectors are made to engage in guarding others.🔽Those who know that things are ungraspable, unreal, and insubstantial are made to engage in profound peace.

original: spros par shes pa rnams lhag mthong spros pa'i gtam rab tu sbyor bas zhi bar byed do //
analyzed: spros par shes pa rnams lhag mthong spros pa'i gtam rab tu sbyor bas zhi bar byed do //
translated: Those who know that things are conceptual are made to engage in the conceptual discourse of insight in order to pacify their conceptual thoughts.

original: nges par 'dod pa @300b rnams rim gyis smra ba dang / tshig zad pa rnams bsdu ba rab tu sbyor zhing zhi gnas dang lhag mthong du rab tu sbyor ba dang / lhag mthong la gus pa can rnams nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la rab tu sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: nges par 'dod pa @300b rnams rim gyis smra ba dang / tshig zad pa rnams bsdu ba rab tu sbyor zhing zhi gnas dang lhag mthong du rab tu sbyor ba dang / lhag mthong la gus pa can rnams nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la rab tu sbyor ba dang /
translated: those who desire certainty are gradually made to speak, those who have exhausted their words are made to engage in collecting and applying them, those who are devoted to insight are made to engage in the sphere of infinite space,

original: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la gus pa can rnams rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la rab tu sbyor ba dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la gus pa can rnams cung zad med pa'i skye mched du sbyor ba dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched la gus pa can rnams mtshan ma med par rab tu sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: nam mkha' mtha' yas skye mched la gus pa can rnams rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la rab tu sbyor ba dang / rnam shes mtha' yas skye mched la gus pa can rnams cung zad med pa'i skye mched du sbyor ba dang / cung zad med pa'i skye mched la gus pa can rnams mtshan ma med par rab tu sbyor ba dang /
translated: those who are devoted to the sphere of infinite space are made to engage in the sphere of infinite consciousness, those who are devoted to the sphere of infinite consciousness are made to engage in the sphere of nothingness, those who are devoted to the sphere of nothingness are made to engage in the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception, and those who are devoted to the sphere of neither perception nor non-perception are made to engage in the signless.

original: smon lam la gus pa rnams smon pa med par smra bar rab tu sbyor ba dang / tshul khrims la gus pa can rnams ngan song gsum las yongs su thar par rab tu sbyor ba dang / thos pa la nga rgyal can rnams sred pa thams cad 'byung ba med par rab tu sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: smon lam la gus pa rnams smon pa med par smra bar rab tu sbyor ba dang / tshul khrims la gus pa can rnams ngan song gsum las yongs su thar par rab tu sbyor ba dang / thos pa la nga rgyal can rnams sred pa thams cad 'byung ba med par rab tu sbyor ba dang /
translated: Those who respect aspiration are applied to the absence of aspiration. Those who respect discipline are applied to complete liberation from the three lower realms. Those who are proud of their learning are applied to the absence of the arising of all craving.

original: dgon pa la nga rgyal mngon par brtson pa rnams dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan can la nga rgyal mngon par brtson pa rnams tshad med par rab tu sbyor ba dang / phung po la rtag par 'du shes pa rnams 'byung ba dang zad par rab tu sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: dgon pa la nga rgyal mngon par brtson pa rnams dang / sbyangs pa'i yon tan can la nga rgyal mngon par brtson pa rnams tshad med par rab tu sbyor ba dang / phung po la rtag par 'du shes pa rnams 'byung ba dang zad par rab tu sbyor ba dang /
translated: Those who strive for the qualities of asceticism are applied to the immeasurable. Those who perceive the aggregates as permanent are applied to arising and exhaustion.

original: khams la bdag gir bya ba yongs su spangs pa rnams smig rgyu bar rab tu sbyor ba dang / skye mched yongs su spangs pa rnams spu ba'i phung por rab tu sbyor ba dang / 'dod pa'i khams yongs su spangs pa rnams chu shing gi snying po med par rab tu sbyor ba dang /
