analyzed: khams la bdag gir bya ba yongs su spangs pa rnams smig rgyu bar rab tu sbyor ba dang / skye mched yongs su spangs pa rnams spu ba'i phung por rab tu sbyor ba dang / 'dod pa'i khams yongs su spangs pa rnams chu shing gi snying po med par rab tu sbyor ba dang /
translated: those who have abandoned the elements as one’s own apply themselves to the mirage; those who have abandoned the sense sources apply themselves to the mass of cotton; those who have abandoned the desire realm apply themselves to the corelessness of the plantain tree;

original: gzugs kyi khams yongs su spangs pa rnams las @301a *//
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams yongs su spangs pa rnams las @301a *//
translated: those who have abandoned the form realm apply themselves to the impermanence of action;

original: byed mi rtag par rab tu sbyor ba dang / gzugs med pa'i khams yongs su spangs pa rnams 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal bar rab tu sbyor ba dang / bsam gtan la dga' ba dang bde ba yongs su spangs pa rnams chos thams cad la bdag med par rab tu sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: byed mi rtag par rab tu sbyor ba dang / gzugs med pa'i khams yongs su spangs pa rnams 'du byed thams cad sdug bsngal bar rab tu sbyor ba dang / bsam gtan la dga' ba dang bde ba yongs su spangs pa rnams chos thams cad la bdag med par rab tu sbyor ba dang /
translated: those who have abandoned the formless realm apply themselves to all formations being suffering; those who have abandoned the joy and happiness of concentration apply themselves to all phenomena being selfless;

original: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'dod pa rnams mya ngan las 'da' ba zhi bar rab tu sbyor ba dang / gzhan yang lam ngan pa yongs su spangs pa rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rab tu sbyor bas lta ba de dag rab tu zhi bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i sdug bsngal 'dod pa rnams mya ngan las 'da' ba zhi bar rab tu sbyor ba dang / gzhan yang lam ngan pa yongs su spangs pa rnams dge ba bcu'i las kyi lam rab tu sbyor bas lta ba de dag rab tu zhi bar bya'o //
translated: Moreover, those who have abandoned bad paths are to be introduced to the path of the ten virtues.🔽Those who have abandoned attractive people are to be introduced to the unattractive.🔽Those who have abandoned attachment to form are to be introduced to blue color.

original: yid du 'ong ba'i skye bo yongs su spangs pa rnams mi mdzes par rab tu sbyor ba dang / gzugs la chags pa yongs su spangs pa rnams ro sngon por rab tu sbyor ba dang / sgra la chags pa yongs su spangs pa rnams brag ca 'byung ba zad par rab tu sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: yid du 'ong ba'i skye bo yongs su spangs pa rnams mi mdzes par rab tu sbyor ba dang / gzugs la chags pa yongs su spangs pa rnams ro sngon por rab tu sbyor ba dang / sgra la chags pa yongs su spangs pa rnams brag ca 'byung ba zad par rab tu sbyor ba dang /
translated: Those who have abandoned attachment to sound are to be introduced to the exhaustion of the arising of echoes.

original: dri la chags pa yongs su spangs pa rnams rlung du rtog par rab tu sbyor ba dang / ro la chags pa yongs su spangs pa rnams mi mdzes pa sna tshogs rab tu sbyor ba dang / reg pa la chags pa yongs su spong ba rnams mi gtsang ba'i yan la gsum cu rtsa drug rab tu sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: dri la chags pa yongs su spangs pa rnams rlung du rtog par rab tu sbyor ba dang / ro la chags pa yongs su spangs pa rnams mi mdzes pa sna tshogs rab tu sbyor ba dang / reg pa la chags pa yongs su spong ba rnams mi gtsang ba'i yan la gsum cu rtsa drug rab tu sbyor ba dang /
translated: Those who have abandoned attachment to smell are applied to wind. Those who have abandoned attachment to taste are applied to various unpleasant things. Those who have abandoned attachment to touch are applied to the thirty-six impure substances.

original: snying rje med pa rnams byams par rab tu sbyor ba dang / gtong ba med pa rnams sbyin pa chen po ltar rab tu sbyor ba dang / gti mug gis bsgribs pa rnams kha ton la rab tu sbyor ba dang / 'dus pa rnams 'phags pa'i rigs la dga' bar rab tu sbyor ba dang /
analyzed: snying rje med pa rnams byams par rab tu sbyor ba dang / gtong ba med pa rnams sbyin pa chen po ltar rab tu sbyor ba dang / gti mug gis bsgribs pa rnams kha ton la rab tu sbyor ba dang / 'dus pa rnams 'phags pa'i rigs la dga' bar rab tu sbyor ba dang /
translated: Those who are without compassion are applied to love. Those who are ungenerous are applied to great generosity. Those who are obscured by delusion are applied to recitation. Those who are gathered are applied to delight in the noble lineage.

original: sdug @301b bsngal 'dul ba rnams rim gyis sems rtse gcig tu 'dus par rab tu sbyor ba dang / 'du byed thams cad kyis mngon par spros pa rnams sgyu ma lta bur rab tu sbyor bas nyon mongs pa de dag zhi bar 'gyur ro //🔽bam po lnga pa /
analyzed: sdug @301b bsngal 'dul ba rnams rim gyis sems rtse gcig tu 'dus par rab tu sbyor ba dang / 'du byed thams cad kyis mngon par spros pa rnams sgyu ma lta bur rab tu sbyor bas nyon mongs pa de dag zhi bar 'gyur ro // bam po lnga pa /
translated: In this way, those afflictions are pacified.

original: gzhan yang sems can lha dang mir skye bar bsam pa rnams la dge ba bcu'i las yongs su dag par sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: gzhan yang sems can lha dang mir skye bar bsam pa rnams la dge ba bcu'i las yongs su dag par sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Moreover, they apply themselves to the pure ten wholesome actions in the case of those beings who aspire to be born as gods and humans.

original: nyan thos kyi theg par bsam pa rnams la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang ldan par yid la byed pa sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi theg par bsam pa rnams la 'phags pa'i bden pa bzhi dang ldan par yid la byed pa sbyor bar byed do //
translated: They apply themselves to the mental activity associated with the four noble truths in the case of those who aspire to the vehicle of the hearers.

original: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg par bsam pa rnams la rten cing 'brel bar smra ba yid la byed pa sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas kyi theg par bsam pa rnams la rten cing 'brel bar smra ba yid la byed pa sbyor bar byed do //
translated: They apply themselves to the mental activity of dependent origination in the case of those who aspire to the vehicle of the solitary buddhas.

original: sems can theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa drug sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: sems can theg pa chen po la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams la pha rol tu phyin pa drug sbyor bar byed do //
translated: They apply themselves to the six perfections in the case of beings who have entered the Great Vehicle.

original: thog mar sems bskyed pa rnams la lhag pa'i bsam pa phyir mi ldog pa'i sems sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: thog mar sems bskyed pa rnams la lhag pa'i bsam pa phyir mi ldog pa'i sems sbyor bar byed do //
translated: First, he causes those who have generated the Thought to apply themselves to the irreversible Thought of the superior intention.

original: sems can pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams snying rje chen po la yongs su mi skyo bas sems yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir spyod par byed do //
analyzed: sems can pha rol tu phyin pa drug spyod pa la yang dag par zhugs pa rnams snying rje chen po la yongs su mi skyo bas sems yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir spyod par byed do //
translated: He causes those sentient beings who have set out to practice the six perfections to practice with a mind that is not wearied by great compassion in order to ripen their minds.

original: byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa rnams la de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi tshogs yongs su dag par sbyor bar byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' phyir mi ldog pa rnams la de'i 'og tu sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi tshogs yongs su dag par sbyor bar byed do //
translated: Then, he causes the irreversible bodhisattvas to apply themselves to the purification of the collection of qualities of the buddha-field.

original: ji lta bur sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa gzhan du rnam par spyod cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi tshogs yongs su dag par sbyor bar byed pa de dag de'i 'og tu mngon par shes @302a *//
analyzed: ji lta bur sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa gzhan du rnam par spyod cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi tshogs yongs su dag par sbyor bar byed pa de dag de'i 'og tu mngon par shes @302a *//
translated: In whatever way he practices in other purified buddha-fields, he causes them to apply themselves to the purification of the collection of qualities of the buddha-field.

original: pas rnam par rtse'o //
analyzed: pas rnam par rtse'o //
translated: Then, they play with the superknowledges.

original: ji lta bur sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa bzhin du rnam par spyod cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi tshogs mngon par 'dod pa de dag de'i 'og tu mngon par shes pa rnam par rtse ba de la skye bar 'dod pa ji snyed pa der skye'o🔽// yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing nyon mongs par rnam par mi spyod cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi tshogs yongs su dag pa 'dod pa'ang med pa der skye bar 'dod pa de ji tsam pa der skye'o //
analyzed: ji lta bur sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag pa bzhin du rnam par spyod cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi tshogs mngon par 'dod pa de dag de'i 'og tu mngon par shes pa rnam par rtse ba de la skye bar 'dod pa ji snyed pa der skye'o // yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing nyon mongs par rnam par mi spyod cing sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi yon tan gyi tshogs yongs su dag pa 'dod pa'ang med pa der skye bar 'dod pa de ji tsam pa der skye'o //
translated: As they wish, they can manifest the pure buddha fields, and they can manifest the accumulations of merit and wisdom of the buddha fields.🔽They can also manifest the impure buddha fields, and they can manifest the accumulations of merit and wisdom of the buddha fields.

original: yang nyon mongs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bar mi 'dod pa de la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i bar du'o //
analyzed: yang nyon mongs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du 'gro bar mi 'dod pa de la bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub tu mngon par 'tshang rgya ba'i bar du'o //
translated: They can also manifest the buddha fields that are neither pure nor impure, and they can manifest the accumulations of merit and wisdom of the buddha fields.

original: rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du sems can lta ba dog pa rnyed pa dang / mtshams med pa byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos spong ba dang / 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang lhan cig tu 'grogs pa rnams rgyun gcod do //
analyzed: rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du sems can lta ba dog pa rnyed pa dang / mtshams med pa byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos spong ba dang / 'phags pa la skur pa 'debs pa dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang lhan cig tu 'grogs pa rnams rgyun gcod do //
translated: In the Buddha-field of the five degenerations, he cuts the continuity of sentient beings who have acquired the narrow view, who commit the actions of immediate retribution, who abandon the holy Dharma, who slander the noble ones, and who associate with the roots of nonvirtue.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par sems can bsam pa yongs su dag pa rnams la sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byed cing /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par sems can bsam pa yongs su dag pa rnams la sangs rgyas kyi bya ba byed cing /
translated: In the completely pure Buddha-field, he performs the activities of a Buddha for sentient beings with completely pure intentions.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi chos tshad med grangs med pa rnams la 'jug pa'i ye shes la mkhas pa rnams la chos ston par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sangs rgyas kyi chos tshad med grangs med pa rnams la 'jug pa'i ye shes la mkhas pa rnams la chos ston par byed do //
translated: He teaches the Dharma to the bodhisattvas who are skilled in the wisdom that engages the immeasurable and innumerable qualities of the Buddha.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' rnyog la lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir rnam pa de lta bu'i rtsal byed kyang gang byang chub sems dpa' la la sangs rgyas kyi zhing @302b yongs su dag par rnam pa de lta bu'i rtsal byed mi nus so //
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' rnyog la lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir rnam pa de lta bu'i rtsal byed kyang gang byang chub sems dpa' la la sangs rgyas kyi zhing @302b yongs su dag par rnam pa de lta bu'i rtsal byed mi nus so //
translated: Moreover, although a bodhisattva may display such power in this buddha-field of the five degenerations, there are some bodhisattvas who are unable to display such power in a pure buddha-field.

original: yang rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems can gcig gi 'dod chags kyi spyad pa stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig rab tu shes pa de ltar thabs rab tu sbyor ba stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig gis 'dod chags rab
analyzed: yang rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems can gcig gi 'dod chags kyi spyad pa stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig rab tu shes pa de ltar thabs rab tu sbyor ba stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig gis 'dod chags rab
translated: Moreover, if a bodhisattva in this buddha-field of the five degenerations knows the twenty-one thousand types of conduct of desire of a single sentient being, and with twenty-one thousand applications of skillful means,

original: tu zhi bar byed pa dang / gal te sems can gcig gi zhe sdang spyod pa stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig rab tu shes pa de ltar thabs la mkhas pa stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig gis zhe sdang zhi bar byed pa dang / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems can gcig gi skal pa dang bcas par spyod pa stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig rab tu shes pa de bzhin du thabs la mkhas pa stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig gis zhi bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: tu zhi bar byed pa dang / gal te sems can gcig gi zhe sdang spyod pa stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig rab tu shes pa de ltar thabs la mkhas pa stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig gis zhe sdang zhi bar byed pa dang / gal te byang chub sems dpa' sems can gcig gi skal pa dang bcas par spyod pa stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig rab tu shes pa de bzhin du thabs la mkhas pa stong phrag nyi shu rtsa gcig gis zhi bar byed pa dang /
translated: If he knows twenty-one thousand ways of dealing with the hatred of a single being, he will pacify that hatred with twenty-one thousand skillful means.🔽If he knows twenty-one thousand ways of dealing with the fortune of a single being, he will pacify that fortune with twenty-one thousand skillful means.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gang gis sems can gcig gi skal pa dang bcas par spyod pa nyon mongs pa kun nas ldang ba rab tu zhi bar nus pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rtsal chen po byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gang gis sems can gcig gi skal pa dang bcas par spyod pa nyon mongs pa kun nas ldang ba rab tu zhi bar nus pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rtsal chen po byed do //
translated: If a bodhisattva is able to pacify the afflictions that arise in the fortune of a single being, he will act with great power as a bodhisattva.

original: gang sems can gcig gi nyon mongs pa'i rgyu spyod pa stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi rab tu shes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'ang sems can gcig gi dgos pas brtson 'grus brtan pa la mos shing pha rol gnon pa na thabs la mkhas pa stong phrag brgyad
analyzed: gang sems can gcig gi nyon mongs pa'i rgyu spyod pa stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi rab tu shes pa'i byang chub sems dpa' de'ang sems can gcig gi dgos pas brtson 'grus brtan pa la mos shing pha rol gnon pa na thabs la mkhas pa stong phrag brgyad
translated: The bodhisattvas who know the eighty-four thousand causes of the afflictions of a single being, when they are dedicated to the stable diligence that is necessary for a single being, apply the eighty-four thousand skillful means to subdue those who are difficult to subdue.

original: cu rtsa bzhi rab tu sbyor ba dang pha rol gnon pas gzir ba rnams byang chub sems dpa' rtsal chen po 'di la ltos shig /🔽ji ltar sems can gcig gi nyon mongs pa @303a *//
analyzed: cu rtsa bzhi rab tu sbyor ba dang pha rol gnon pas gzir ba rnams byang chub sems dpa' rtsal chen po 'di la ltos shig / ji ltar sems can gcig gi nyon mongs pa @303a *//
translated: “Look at the great power of this bodhisattva!

original: rab tu zhi bar nus pa de ltar gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi nas gling gcig gi sems can yongs su tshang ba re re'i dgos pas nyon mongs pa spyod pa'i mtshan nyid stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi rab tu zhi bar byed cing gling gnyis pa dang /
analyzed: rab tu zhi bar nus pa de ltar gnyis dang / gsum dang / bzhi nas gling gcig gi sems can yongs su tshang ba re re'i dgos pas nyon mongs pa spyod pa'i mtshan nyid stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi rab tu zhi bar byed cing gling gnyis pa dang /
translated: Just as he is able to pacify the afflictions of a single being, he is able to pacify the eighty-four thousand characteristics of the afflictions that are necessary for two, three, four, and so on, up to the complete number of beings in a world system.

original: gling bzhi pa nas phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing chu bo gangg'a'i bye ma snyed du sems can thams cad nyon mongs pa thams cad las yongs su thar par byed pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du bzod pa thob pa
analyzed: gling bzhi pa nas phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing chu bo gangg'a'i bye ma snyed du sems can thams cad nyon mongs pa thams cad las yongs su thar par byed pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du bzod pa thob pa
translated: In the same way, the bodhisattva who has attained acceptance in a buddhafield with five corruptions🔽liberates all sentient beings from all afflictions in all the buddhafields of the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges river.

original: zhes bya'o // ji ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems can re re'i nyon mongs pa'i dbang po spyod pa stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhis 'jug pa de ltar sems can gcig gi mos pa stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi rab tu shes shing bri ba'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes
analyzed: zhes bya'o // ji ltar yang byang chub sems dpa' sems can re re'i nyon mongs pa'i dbang po spyod pa stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhis 'jug pa de ltar sems can gcig gi mos pa stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi rab tu shes shing bri ba'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes
translated: And just as the bodhisattva knows the eighty-four thousand mental activities of each sentient being, he knows the eighty-four thousand interests of each sentient being, and he knows the characteristics of their decrease.

original: pa dang / 'phel ba'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes pa dang / gnas pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes pa dang / rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes pa dang / mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid rab tu shes pa dang /
analyzed: pa dang / 'phel ba'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes pa dang / gnas pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes pa dang / rtogs pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes pa dang / mi rtag pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes pa dang / sdug bsngal gyi mtshan nyid rab tu shes pa dang /
translated: the characteristic of increase, the characteristic of abiding, the characteristic of realization, the characteristic of impermanence, the characteristic of suffering,

original: bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes pa dang / sems can gyi mtshan nyid rab tu shes pa dang / stong pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes pa dang / dben pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes pa nas de bzhin du mtshan nyid med pa'i bar du 'du shes pa dang /
analyzed: bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes pa dang / sems can gyi mtshan nyid rab tu shes pa dang / stong pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes pa dang / dben pa'i mtshan nyid rab tu shes pa nas de bzhin du mtshan nyid med pa'i bar du 'du shes pa dang /
translated: the characteristic of selflessness, the characteristic of sentient beings, the characteristic of emptiness, the characteristic of isolation, and so forth up to the characteristic of signlessness and the characteristic of wishlessness.

original: mya ngan las @303b 'da' ba'i mtshan nyid du rab tu shes pa dang / sems can re re'i chags pa'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs brgyad cu rtsa bzhi rab tu shes pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi spyod pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par shes par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mya ngan las @303b 'da' ba'i mtshan nyid du rab tu shes pa dang / sems can re re'i chags pa'i mtshan nyid sna tshogs brgyad cu rtsa bzhi rab tu shes pa de ltar byang chub sems dpa' sems can gyi spyod pa'i mtshan nyid mngon par shes par 'gyur ro //
translated: They know the characteristics of the nirvāṇa of each and every sentient being. They know the eighty-four thousand different kinds of attachment of sentient beings. In this way, bodhisattvas have the supernormal knowledge that is the characteristic of the conduct of sentient beings.

original: bsam pa'i tshul shes pas sems can nyon mongs pa dam pas bcings pa las yongs su thar par nus so //
analyzed: bsam pa'i tshul shes pas sems can nyon mongs pa dam pas bcings pa las yongs su thar par nus so //
translated: By knowing the way of thinking, they are able to liberate sentient beings from the tight bonds of the afflictions.

original: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du byang chub sems dpa' nyon mongs pa dang / rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du sems can yongs su smin par byed do //
translated: In the same way, bodhisattvas bring sentient beings to maturity in buddha-fields that are afflicted by the five degenerations.

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems can mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang lhan cig tu 'grogs pa rnams la snying rje chen po rgyun mi gcod cing yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'dug pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i rtsal chen po'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems can mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang lhan cig tu 'grogs pa rnams la snying rje chen po rgyun mi gcod cing yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir 'dug pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i rtsal chen po'o //
translated: This is also a great power of the bodhisattvas: they do not give up on sentient beings who are accompanied by the roots of non-virtue, and they remain in order to bring them to maturity.

original: yang byang chub sems dpa' dgra rnam par 'grel bas 'di bstan pa ston pa na phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med par byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par lhags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' chu bo gangg'a sum cu'i bye ma snyed mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa thob par gyur to //🔽byang chub sems dpa' chu bo gangg'a'i bye ma snyed kyis dga' ba byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa de dag de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa gang na ba de logs su thal mo sbyar te phyag btsal nas mgrin gcig tu 'di ched du
analyzed: yang byang chub sems dpa' dgra rnam par 'grel bas 'di bstan pa ston pa na phyogs bcu'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing tshad med par byang chub sems dpa' yang dag par lhags pa dang / byang chub sems dpa' chu bo gangg'a sum cu'i bye ma snyed mi skye ba'i chos kyi bzod pa thob par gyur to // byang chub sems dpa' chu bo gangg'a'i bye ma snyed kyis dga' ba byed pa zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin thob pa de dag de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pa gang na ba de logs su thal mo sbyar te phyag btsal nas mgrin gcig tu 'di ched du
translated: and as many bodhisattvas as there are grains of sand in thirty Ganges Rivers attained the acceptance of the non-arising of dharmas.

original: brjod pa ched du brjod do //
analyzed: brjod pa ched du brjod do //
translated: Those bodhisattvas as numerous as the sands of the Ganges who had attained the samâdhi called joyful bowed with folded hands in the direction of the Tathagata Shakyamuni and with one voice uttered this exalted utterance:

original: chu bo gang rnams blta dka' chu bos khyer //
analyzed: chu bo gang rnams blta dka' chu bos khyer //
translated: Those who are carried away by the difficult-to-see currents of the rivers,

original: nga rgyal mngon pa'i nga rgyal yul @304a *//
analyzed: nga rgyal mngon pa'i nga rgyal yul @304a *//
translated: who are proud and conceited,

original: las shes // nyon mongs rgya mtsho las ni mthar phyin med //
analyzed: las shes // nyon mongs rgya mtsho las ni mthar phyin med //
translated: have not reached the end of the ocean of afflictions.

original: lam gyis bdag cag kyang ni rnam par gnas //
analyzed: lam gyis bdag cag kyang ni rnam par gnas //
translated: And we will also abide on the path.

original: sems can gang rnams nyon mongs gdung bas gdungs //
analyzed: sems can gang rnams nyon mongs gdung bas gdungs //
translated: “Those beings who are tormented by the afflictions,

original: nyon mongs sangs rgyas zhing du rtag rnams myos //
analyzed: nyon mongs sangs rgyas zhing du rtag rnams myos //
translated: Who are always intoxicated in the buddha realm of the afflictions,

original: ngan song 'gro bar rtag tu sdug bsngal bsags //
analyzed: ngan song 'gro bar rtag tu sdug bsngal bsags //
translated: Who always accumulate suffering in the lower realms,

original: 'chad mkhan dam pa'i don gyi theg pa ston //🔽bdag cag nyon mongs sems can rnams dgos pas //
analyzed: 'chad mkhan dam pa'i don gyi theg pa ston // bdag cag nyon mongs sems can rnams dgos pas //
translated: And who are not interested in the Dharma—🔽“We will make aspirations for that buddha realm

original: sangs rgyas zhing der smon lam byed 'gyur ba //
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhing der smon lam byed 'gyur ba //
translated: In order to benefit those beings who are afflicted.

original: nyon mongs zhing du bdag cag spyad pa spyod //
analyzed: nyon mongs zhing du bdag cag spyad pa spyod //
translated: We will practice in the realm of the afflictions

original: sems can nyon mongs dam bcings grol bar byed //
analyzed: sems can nyon mongs dam bcings grol bar byed //
translated: And liberate beings who are bound by the afflictions.

original: gang dag 'dod chags zhe sdang nga rgyal dregs //
analyzed: gang dag 'dod chags zhe sdang nga rgyal dregs //
translated: “Those who are attached to desire, anger, pride, and arrogance,

original: gti mug lam stor sdig pa rab byed pa //
analyzed: gti mug lam stor sdig pa rab byed pa //
translated: Who have lost the path of wisdom and commit evil deeds,

original: sdig pa thams cad las ni bdag cag bzlog /
analyzed: sdig pa thams cad las ni bdag cag bzlog /
translated: We will turn them away from all evil

original: 'khor ba'i dgon pa 'jigs las rab tu sgrol //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i dgon pa 'jigs las rab tu sgrol //
translated: And liberate them from the terrifying wilderness of saṃsāra.

original: gang dmyal byol song yi dvags 'jig rten du //
analyzed: gang dmyal byol song yi dvags 'jig rten du //
translated: “Those who are always in the hells, animal realm, or world of the pretas,

original: rtag tu 'dod med sdug bsngal myong ba dag /
analyzed: rtag tu 'dod med sdug bsngal myong ba dag /
translated: Who experience suffering without any desire,

original: bdag cag sdug bsngal thams cad las grol byed //
analyzed: bdag cag sdug bsngal thams cad las grol byed //
translated: We are freed from all suffering.

original: nyon mongs sangs rgyas zhing du byang chub spyod //
analyzed: nyon mongs sangs rgyas zhing du byang chub spyod //
translated: We will purify the buddhafield of afflictions and practice the conduct of awakening.

original: yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma lus par khyab pa'i 'khor thams cad dang ldan pa des kyang legs so //
analyzed: yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma lus par khyab pa'i 'khor thams cad dang ldan pa des kyang legs so //
translated: ” The entire retinue, which filled the entire buddha realm, also exclaimed, “Excellent!

original: zhes bya ba byin te /
analyzed: zhes bya ba byin te /
translated: Thus he gave the name.🔽

original: skyes bu dam pa legs par spobs shing mchog tu rgya che ba'i brtson 'grus brtan pa la brtson pa pha rol gnon pa sems can yongs su smin pa'i chos kyi sgo bstan pa legs so legs so //
analyzed: skyes bu dam pa legs par spobs shing mchog tu rgya che ba'i brtson 'grus brtan pa la brtson pa pha rol gnon pa sems can yongs su smin pa'i chos kyi sgo bstan pa legs so legs so //
translated: “Excellent, excellent, O sublime being! You are eloquent and steadfast in your supreme and vast diligence. You are a hero who teaches the Dharma of bringing sentient beings to full maturity.

original: gang chu bo gangg'a'i bye ma snyed kyi skyes bu dam @304b pa 'dis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byang chub kyi spyod pa bor  te rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du spyod pa la brtson no //
analyzed: gang chu bo gangg'a'i bye ma snyed kyi skyes bu dam @304b pa 'dis sangs rgyas kyi zhing yongs su dag par byang chub kyi spyod pa bor  te rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du spyod pa la brtson no //
translated: This sublime being, who is as numerous as the grains of sand in the river Ganges, has abandoned the conduct of awakening in a pure buddha realm and is now striving in the conduct in a buddha realm with five corruptions.

original: sems can mtshams med pa byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos spong ba dang / 'phags pa la skur ba 'debs pa dang / lus tshig pa dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang lhan cig tu 'grogs pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir snying rje chen po bskyed do //
analyzed: sems can mtshams med pa byed pa dang / dam pa'i chos spong ba dang / 'phags pa la skur ba 'debs pa dang / lus tshig pa dang / mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang lhan cig tu 'grogs pa rnams yongs su smin par bya ba'i phyir snying rje chen po bskyed do //
translated: He generates great compassion in order to bring to maturity those sentient beings who commit the crimes with an immediate consequence, who abandon the holy Dharma, who revile the noble ones, who are burned by the fire of hatred, and who are accompanied by the roots of nonvirtue.

original: nyon mongs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du ston to //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing bla na med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du ston to //
translated: He reveals the buddhafield of afflictions as the unsurpassed buddhafield.

original: lus med pa phung po spong ba'i mtha' ston to //
analyzed: lus med pa phung po spong ba'i mtha' ston to //
translated: He reveals the end of the abandonment of the body as the absence of a body.

original: tshig tsam gyis skyes bu de dag brtson par 'gyur ba de dag la gang lha dang 'jig rten du bcas pas mchod pa mchog tu rgya chen po byed na /
analyzed: tshig tsam gyis skyes bu de dag brtson par 'gyur ba de dag la gang lha dang 'jig rten du bcas pas mchod pa mchog tu rgya chen po byed na /
translated: If those beings who are diligent through mere words are worshipped with the highest, most vast worship by the world and its gods,

original: de dag gi brtan pa'i brtson 'grus pha rol gnon pa 'di la brtson pa lta ci smos te /
analyzed: de dag gi brtan pa'i brtson 'grus pha rol gnon pa 'di la brtson pa lta ci smos te /
translated: how much more so those who are diligent in this steadfast diligence and effort!

original: ji ltar tshig gis dam bcas pa da ltar dgos pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar tshig gis dam bcas pa da ltar dgos pa thams cad yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as they have vowed with words, now all their needs will be completely fulfilled.

original: de nas de nyid kyi tshe na de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pas legs so //🔽zhes bya ba byin te skyes bu dam pa /
analyzed: de nas de nyid kyi tshe na de bzhin gshegs pa sh'akya thub pas legs so // zhes bya ba byin te skyes bu dam pa /
translated: Then at that time the Tathāgata Śākyamuni applauded, saying,

original: legs so legs so //
analyzed: legs so legs so //
translated: “Excellent!🔽Excellent, O noble son!

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: ji ltar smra ba'i tshig tsam gyis rtsom par 'gyur ba de de bzhin te /
analyzed: ji ltar smra ba'i tshig tsam gyis rtsom par 'gyur ba de de bzhin te /
translated: it is just as you have said.

original: de dag la gang lha dang 'jig rten du bcas pas mchod pa mchog tu rgya chen po byed na /
analyzed: de dag la gang lha dang 'jig rten du bcas pas mchod pa mchog tu rgya chen po byed na /
translated: If they are to be worshipped with the highest, most vast worship by the world and its gods,

original: de'i shes pas nyon mongs pa dang rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du rnam pa de lta bu'i de dag gi rtsal chen po bya bar 'gyur ba lta ci smos te /
analyzed: de'i shes pas nyon mongs pa dang rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing du rnam pa de lta bu'i de dag gi rtsal chen po bya bar 'gyur ba lta ci smos te /
translated: what need is there to speak of those who, with their knowledge, will perform such great feats in a buddha realm with afflictions and five turbidities?

original: mtshams med pa byed pa nas mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang lhan cig tu @305a *//
analyzed: mtshams med pa byed pa nas mi dge ba'i rtsa ba dang lhan cig tu @305a *//
translated: Those who have committed the five acts of immediate retribution up to those who have committed nonvirtuous actions

original: 'grogs pa'i bar du rnam pa de lta bu'i brten pa'i brtson 'grus pha rol gnon pa'i thabs la mkhas pas yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'grogs pa'i bar du rnam pa de lta bu'i brten pa'i brtson 'grus pha rol gnon pa'i thabs la mkhas pas yongs su smin par 'gyur ro //
translated: will be brought to full maturity through such perseverance, such heroism, such skill in means.

original: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' dgra rnam par 'grel bas de ltar sems can yongs su smin pa shes rab kyi thabs la mkhas pa'i chos kyi sgo bstan nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshig 'di brjod ma thag tu de nas de nyid kyi tshe na stong gsum gyi
analyzed: ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' dgra rnam par 'grel bas de ltar sems can yongs su smin pa shes rab kyi thabs la mkhas pa'i chos kyi sgo bstan nas bcom ldan 'das kyis tshig 'di brjod ma thag tu de nas de nyid kyi tshe na stong gsum gyi
translated: Just as the bodhisattva Dṛḍhavrata taught the Dharma gateway of the skillful means of wisdom to sentient beings, in the same way, as soon as the Blessed One spoke these words, at that very moment, in this trichiliocosm, the earth shook in six ways.

original: stong chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi sa chen po lan drug tu g-yos so //
analyzed: stong chen po'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi sa chen po lan drug tu g-yos so //
translated: “Just as the bodhisattva Vikurvaṇa taught the Dharma door of skillful means and wisdom to sentient beings, so too, as soon as the Blessed One had spoken these words, the great earth of this trichiliocosm shook six times.

original: lha rdzas kyi me tog gi char yang rab tu phab po //
analyzed: lha rdzas kyi me tog gi char yang rab tu phab po //
translated: A rain of divine flowers fell,

original: lha rdzas kyi rol mo'ang rab tu dkrol to //
analyzed: lha rdzas kyi rol mo'ang rab tu dkrol to //
translated: and divine music was played.

original: lha dang / dri za dang / mi'i 'khor thams cad dang ldan pa de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' dgra rnam par 'grel ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' chu bo gangg'a'i bye ma snyed po de dag la mchog tu rgya che ba'i mchod pa'i las kyi phyir brtson no //
analyzed: lha dang / dri za dang / mi'i 'khor thams cad dang ldan pa de dag kyang byang chub sems dpa' dgra rnam par 'grel ba dang / byang chub sems dpa' chu bo gangg'a'i bye ma snyed po de dag la mchog tu rgya che ba'i mchod pa'i las kyi phyir brtson no //
translated: The entire retinue of gods, gandharvas, and humans made offerings to the bodhisattva Vikurvaṇa and to the bodhisattvas as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, in order to make vast offerings.

original: ji snyed ye shes mdzod 'di bstan du gsol //
analyzed: ji snyed ye shes mdzod 'di bstan du gsol //
translated: Please teach this treasury of wisdom.”

original: ye shes phyir yang ston pa 'di nyid ston //
analyzed: ye shes phyir yang ston pa 'di nyid ston //
translated: And the wisdom of the buddhas is taught by this teacher.

original: mkhyen pa khyod kyis gang gi slob ston pa //
analyzed: mkhyen pa khyod kyis gang gi slob ston pa //
translated: “The one who teaches you, O Omniscient One,

original: thub pa shes pa'i smra ba 'di la 'jug /
analyzed: thub pa shes pa'i smra ba 'di la 'jug /
translated: Is the one who enters into this speech of the Sage’s wisdom.🔽“The one who enters into this teaching of the wisdom

original: mkhyen pa can gyi zhing mang bye ba la //🔽thob pa'i ye shes ston pa 'di la 'jug /
analyzed: mkhyen pa can gyi zhing mang bye ba la // thob pa'i ye shes ston pa 'di la 'jug /
translated: That is attained in the many millions of realms of the Omniscient One,

original: bdag ni ye shes 'brog sa myur gnas shing //
analyzed: bdag ni ye shes 'brog sa myur gnas shing //
translated: Will quickly reach the wilderness of wisdom

original: tshul 'di la'ang ye shes lam rab ston //🔽ji ltar byang chub spyod phyir shes 'gyur ba //
analyzed: tshul 'di la'ang ye shes lam rab ston // ji ltar byang chub spyod phyir shes 'gyur ba //
translated: And teach the path of wisdom in this way.

original: rgyal ba ye shes rgyal mtshan 'di la 'jug /
analyzed: rgyal ba ye shes rgyal mtshan 'di la 'jug /
translated: “The one who enters into this victory banner of wisdom of the Jina🔽Will know how to practice the conduct of awakening.

original: ji ltar nam mkha' dri med stong pa'i chos //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha' dri med stong pa'i chos //
translated: “The one who enters into this teaching of the Dharma of the empty, stainless sky

original: bdag @305b dang mthun pa'i gtam dag bstan du gsol //
analyzed: bdag @305b dang mthun pa'i gtam dag bstan du gsol //
translated: Will teach the Dharma that is in accord with the self.

original: ston mkhan mi yi gtso bo 'di la mchog /
analyzed: ston mkhan mi yi gtso bo 'di la mchog /
translated: “The one who enters into this supreme teaching of the teacher, the foremost being,

original: mchog tu yid du 'ong zhing mdzes pa ston //
analyzed: mchog tu yid du 'ong zhing mdzes pa ston //
translated: Will teach the supreme, delightful, and beautiful Dharma.🔽“The one who enters into this teaching of the Dharma of emptiness

original: stong pa nyid kyis nyon mongs dgra zil gnon //
analyzed: stong pa nyid kyis nyon mongs dgra zil gnon //
translated: Will conquer the enemy of the kleśas

original: rtag pa dang ni chad pa thal bar byas //
analyzed: rtag pa dang ni chad pa thal bar byas //
translated: And destroy eternalism and nihilism.🔽“The one who enters into this teaching of the Dharma of the emptiness of phenomena

original: dpa' dang rtul phod gang zag dam pa mchog /
analyzed: dpa' dang rtul phod gang zag dam pa mchog /
translated: Will be a supreme, excellent, and courageous being.

original: sred pa zhi ba gang zag dam pa mchog /
analyzed: sred pa zhi ba gang zag dam pa mchog /
translated: The pacification of craving is the supreme, highest person.

original: sred pa zhi zhing zhi gnas rab tu ston //
analyzed: sred pa zhi zhing zhi gnas rab tu ston //
translated: The pacification of craving is the teaching of tranquility.

original: rgyal ba rab tu zhi ba 'di la 'jug /
analyzed: rgyal ba rab tu zhi ba 'di la 'jug /
translated: The Victorious One has entered into this peace.

original: rgyal ba stong pa nyid zhi rab bstan gsol //
analyzed: rgyal ba stong pa nyid zhi rab bstan gsol //
translated: The Victorious One has taught the peace of emptiness.

original: rgyal ba stong pa nyid 'di la yang 'jug /
analyzed: rgyal ba stong pa nyid 'di la yang 'jug /
translated: The Victorious One has entered into this emptiness.

original: kha dog dung dang kha ba 'dra ba yi //
analyzed: kha dog dung dang kha ba 'dra ba yi //
translated: The color of a conch or snow,

original: zhi ba mdzes pa'i stong pa nyid bstan gsol //
analyzed: zhi ba mdzes pa'i stong pa nyid bstan gsol //
translated: The beautiful peace of emptiness has been taught.

original: nyan thos kyi ni 'di la tshogs rnams spangs //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi ni 'di la tshogs rnams spangs //
translated: The assembly of hearers has abandoned this.

original: ston gyi nyi ma zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ltar //
analyzed: ston gyi nyi ma zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ltar //
translated: Like the sun and moon in the autumn sky,

original: gtso bo dag gis shin tu gsal shing mdzes //
analyzed: gtso bo dag gis shin tu gsal shing mdzes //
translated: The principal ones are very clear and beautiful.

original: 'dir ni lam zhi stong pa nyid bstan gsol //
analyzed: 'dir ni lam zhi stong pa nyid bstan gsol //
translated: Here, the path of peace, emptiness, has been taught.

original: brgya byin tshangs pa'i skad ltar sgra dbyangs snyan //
analyzed: brgya byin tshangs pa'i skad ltar sgra dbyangs snyan //
translated: Like the voice of Indra and Brahma, the sound is pleasant.

original: sems can dma' la thugs brtse chen po yis //
analyzed: sems can dma' la thugs brtse chen po yis //
translated: With great compassion for inferior beings,

original: thub pa 'di ni stong pa nyid la 'jug /
analyzed: thub pa 'di ni stong pa nyid la 'jug /
translated: The Sage has entered into emptiness.

original: mya ngan dang bral 'gro ba 'di la tshim //
analyzed: mya ngan dang bral 'gro ba 'di la tshim //
translated: Free from sorrow, he satisfies this world.

original: dma' ba spyod pa rtag tu byin brlabs pas; ;shes rab mang gzugs stong pa nyid zhi gsungs //
analyzed: dma' ba spyod pa rtag tu byin brlabs pas; ;shes rab mang gzugs stong pa nyid zhi gsungs //
translated: You have taught the peace of emptiness, which is the form of great wisdom.

original: sdig pa bcom zhing nyes tshogs dri ma med //
analyzed: sdig pa bcom zhing nyes tshogs dri ma med //
translated: You have destroyed evil and the mass of faults, and are stainless.

original: 'di ni 'gro la theg pa ngan pa spangs //
analyzed: 'di ni 'gro la theg pa ngan pa spangs //
translated: You have abandoned the inferior vehicles for beings.

original: dge ba'i mtshan nyid spyod yul rab nyams pas kyi ma'o da ltar stong pa nyid zhi gsungs //
analyzed: dge ba'i mtshan nyid spyod yul rab nyams pas kyi ma'o da ltar stong pa nyid zhi gsungs //
translated: You have taught the peace of emptiness, which is the domain of the characteristics of virtue.

original: rma bya ngang pa ne tso ske ka dbyangs //
analyzed: rma bya ngang pa ne tso ske ka dbyangs //
translated: The sounds of peacocks, geese, parrots, and cuckoos

original: mnyams pa'i phyogs cha can gyi sgra rnams 'jig /🔽tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis mngon par bstod nas lha rdzas @306a *//
analyzed: mnyams pa'i phyogs cha can gyi sgra rnams 'jig / tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis mngon par bstod nas lha rdzas @306a *//
translated: Are destroyed in the direction of the harmonious sound.

original: kyi me tog autpal dang / padmo dang / ku mu da dang / bunda r'i kas mngon par gtor to //
analyzed: kyi me tog autpal dang / padmo dang / ku mu da dang / bunda r'i kas mngon par gtor to //
translated: Having praised with these verses, they scattered divine flowers of utpala, padma, kumuda, and puṇḍarīka.

original: 'phags pa yang dag par sbyor ba'i tshul nam mkha'i mdog gis 'dul ba'i bzod pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo le'u bzhi pa'o ////
analyzed: 'phags pa yang dag par sbyor ba'i tshul nam mkha'i mdog gis 'dul ba'i bzod pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo le'u bzhi pa'o ////
translated: This was the fourth chapter in the “Skill in Means” section of the Mahāyāna sūtra “The Teaching of Akṣayamati.”

original: de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros mtha' yas pa'i tshogs kyi rgyal pos bcom ldan 'das ji tsam du khang pa brtsegs pa na mi bzhugs pa de tsam gyis bcom ldan 'das kyi don gyi slad du lha rdzas kyi gser dang / lha rdzas kyi bee d'urya sngon po'i skas mngon par sprul te skas de dag gi ngos gnyis la bram ze'i byis pa tshe lo sum cu pa lta bu tshangs dbyangs dang ldan pa gser gyi dbyig pa dang gdugs 'dzin pa //
analyzed: de nas byang chub sems dpa' blo gros mtha' yas pa'i tshogs kyi rgyal pos bcom ldan 'das ji tsam du khang pa brtsegs pa na mi bzhugs pa de tsam gyis bcom ldan 'das kyi don gyi slad du lha rdzas kyi gser dang / lha rdzas kyi bee d'urya sngon po'i skas mngon par sprul te skas de dag gi ngos gnyis la bram ze'i byis pa tshe lo sum cu pa lta bu tshangs dbyangs dang ldan pa gser gyi dbyig pa dang gdugs 'dzin pa //
translated: Then the bodhisattva king of the infinite assembly of wisdom emanated stairs of divine gold and divine blue beryl for the Blessed One to use in not remaining in the kūṭāgāra. On both sides of the stairs he emanated eighty-four thousand young brahmins, each with a lifespan of thirty years, who had the voice of Brahmā and held golden staffs and parasols.

original: tshangs pa'i spyod lam dang ldan pa stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi mngon par sprul to //
analyzed: tshangs pa'i spyod lam dang ldan pa stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi mngon par sprul to //
translated: They were emanated with the conduct of Brahmā.

original: de nas bram ze'i byis pa de dag bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar te phyag btsal nas bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis mngon par bstod do //
analyzed: de nas bram ze'i byis pa de dag bcom ldan 'das ga la ba de logs su thal mo sbyar te phyag btsal nas bcom ldan 'das la tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gis mngon par bstod do //
translated: Then the young brahmins bowed to the Blessed One with palms joined and praised the Blessed One with these verses:

original: khyod ni rab nyon mongs la sngon thugs bskyed //
analyzed: khyod ni rab nyon mongs la sngon thugs bskyed //
translated: You have previously given rise to the mind of awakening for the sake of those with afflictions.

original: nyon mongs theg la byang chub phan pa'i rgyu //
analyzed: nyon mongs theg la byang chub phan pa'i rgyu //
translated: Afflictions are the cause for the benefit of awakening in the vehicle of the afflictions.🔽The victors are revered for the sake of pacifying the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs zhi phyir rgyal ba bsnyen kyang bkur; ;nyon mongs thabs mdzad rgyal ba 'dir gshegs gsol //
analyzed: nyon mongs zhi phyir rgyal ba bsnyen kyang bkur; ;nyon mongs thabs mdzad rgyal ba 'dir gshegs gsol //
translated: Victors, who employ the methods of the afflictions, please come here!

original: nyon mongs spyod pa thams cad khyod kyis spangs //
analyzed: nyon mongs spyod pa thams cad khyod kyis spangs //
translated: You have abandoned all the conduct of the afflictions.

original: sems can nyon mongs la ni rtag tu gnyen //
analyzed: sems can nyon mongs la ni rtag tu gnyen //
translated: You are always a friend to beings with afflictions.

original: khyod ni nyon mongs @306b las las 'gro ba bzlog /
analyzed: khyod ni nyon mongs @306b las las 'gro ba bzlog /
translated: You turn beings away from the actions of the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs rgal ba'i rgyus ni rtag tu myos //
analyzed: nyon mongs rgal ba'i rgyus ni rtag tu myos //
translated: You are always intoxicated by the cause of crossing over the afflictions.

original: nyon mongs ma lus khyod kyis rab tu zhi //
analyzed: nyon mongs ma lus khyod kyis rab tu zhi //
translated: You have completely pacified the afflictions.

original: bdag gi blos ni nyon mongs dra ba bcad //
analyzed: bdag gi blos ni nyon mongs dra ba bcad //
translated: My mind has cut through the net of the afflictions.

original: 'gro ba rtag tu nyon mongs chu las sgrol; ;nyon mongs sun 'byin rgyal pa 'dir gshegs gsol //
analyzed: 'gro ba rtag tu nyon mongs chu las sgrol; ;nyon mongs sun 'byin rgyal pa 'dir gshegs gsol //
translated: Victors, who liberate beings from the water of the afflictions, please come here!

original: nyon mongs zhing du byang chub dam par reg /
analyzed: nyon mongs zhing du byang chub dam par reg /
translated: You have reached the highest awakening in the field of the afflictions.

original: ye shes sgron 'chang 'gro shes nyams pa yi //
analyzed: ye shes sgron 'chang 'gro shes nyams pa yi //
translated: You hold the lamp of wisdom and show liberation

original: sems can thams cad la ni thar ston pa //
analyzed: sems can thams cad la ni thar ston pa //
translated: to all beings who have lost the path.

original: nyon mongs nyon mongs zhi phyir 'dir gshegs gsol //
analyzed: nyon mongs nyon mongs zhi phyir 'dir gshegs gsol //
translated: You came here to pacify the afflictions.

original: ye shes 'od zer gyis ni rnam thar ston //
analyzed: ye shes 'od zer gyis ni rnam thar ston //
translated: With the light of wisdom, you reveal liberation.

original: khyod thugs brtse bas 'gro bas shes nyams khyab //
analyzed: khyod thugs brtse bas 'gro bas shes nyams khyab //
translated: Your mind is compassionate, and you pervade the world with your knowledge.

original: ye shes kyis ni 'gro ba mig ldan pas //
analyzed: ye shes kyis ni 'gro ba mig ldan pas //
translated: With wisdom, you give beings eyes to see.

original: rgyal ba ye shes nyi ma 'dir gshegs gsol //
analyzed: rgyal ba ye shes nyi ma 'dir gshegs gsol //
translated: O Victorious One, sun of wisdom, please come here!

original: mkhyen pas lha dang mi mang thar par mdzad //
analyzed: mkhyen pas lha dang mi mang thar par mdzad //
translated: With your knowledge, you liberate many gods and humans.

original: khyod kyi ye shes srog dang gang zag med //
analyzed: khyod kyi ye shes srog dang gang zag med //
translated: Your wisdom is free of life force and personhood.

original: thub pa ye shes dpa' pa 'di la 'jug /
analyzed: thub pa ye shes dpa' pa 'di la 'jug /
translated: O Sage, this is how you enter into wisdom.

original: nyon mongs pa la sbyin mdzod dran pa gsungs //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa la sbyin mdzod dran pa gsungs //
translated: Please teach the generosity that is free of afflictions and the mindfulness that is free of afflictions.

original: nyi ma zla ba mchog tu mdzes pa'i spyan //
analyzed: nyi ma zla ba mchog tu mdzes pa'i spyan //
translated: Your eyes are as beautiful as the sun and moon.

original: rgyal ba sems can thal mo sbyar la gsungs //
analyzed: rgyal ba sems can thal mo sbyar la gsungs //
translated: O Victorious One, please teach those who join their palms in supplication.

original: thub pa byang chub mchog phyir bstan du gsol //
analyzed: thub pa byang chub mchog phyir bstan du gsol //
translated: O Sage, please reveal the supreme enlightenment.

original: 'phags pa thub pa 'di la 'jug pa gsungs //
analyzed: 'phags pa thub pa 'di la 'jug pa gsungs //
translated: Please teach this noble sage.

original: rgyal ba byang chub rgyu can mdzes gzigs pa //
analyzed: rgyal ba byang chub rgyu can mdzes gzigs pa //
translated: O Victorious One, you see the beautiful causes of enlightenment.

original: phyogs bzhi 'dir ni yang dag lhags mang la //
analyzed: phyogs bzhi 'dir ni yang dag lhags mang la //
translated: Many have gathered in the four directions.

original: stong pa nyid dang bzod spyod shes gyur gsungs //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang bzod spyod shes gyur gsungs //
translated: And the emptiness of patience and conduct.

original: rgyal ba dpa' gtong 'di la shin tu 'dug /🔽bram ze'i byis pa de dag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan 'di smras ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das kyis legs so //
analyzed: rgyal ba dpa' gtong 'di la shin tu 'dug / bram ze'i byis pa de dag gis bcom ldan 'das kyi yon tan 'di smras ma thag tu bcom ldan 'das kyis legs so //
translated: The Victorious One, the Hero, is well established in this.

original: zhes bya @307a *//
analyzed: zhes bya @307a *//
translated: As soon as those young brahmins had spoken these praises of the qualities of the Blessed One, the Blessed One said, “Excellent!”

original: ba byin te //
analyzed: ba byin te //
translated: and gave his approval.🔽Then, as the Sage, the Seer, rose from his seat, this entire great buddha realm shook in six ways,

original: de nas drang srong thub pa gdan de las bzhengs pa dang / de nyid kyi tshe na thams cad dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing chen po 'di yan drug tu g-yos so; ;lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / lha ma yin dang /
analyzed: de nas drang srong thub pa gdan de las bzhengs pa dang / de nyid kyi tshe na thams cad dang ldan pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing chen po 'di yan drug tu g-yos so; ;lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / lha ma yin dang /
translated: and gods, nāgas, yakṣas, asuras,

original: mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po du mas kyang mi mjed kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma lus par lha rdzas kyi me tog gi char mngon par phab bo //
analyzed: mi 'am ci dang / lto 'phye chen po du mas kyang mi mjed kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing ma lus par lha rdzas kyi me tog gi char mngon par phab bo //
translated: garuḍas, kinnaras, and mahoragas caused a rain of divine flowers to fall throughout the entire buddha realm of Sahā.

original: lha rdzas kyi aa ga ru dang / ta ka ra dang / dus dang mthun pa'i tsandan gyi char mngon par phab bo //
analyzed: lha rdzas kyi aa ga ru dang / ta ka ra dang / dus dang mthun pa'i tsandan gyi char mngon par phab bo //
translated: They caused a rain of divine agarwood, tagara, and timely sandalwood to fall.

original: lha rdzas kyi gos dang / rgyan dang / yid bzhin gyi gos dang / nor bu dang / mu tig gi se mo do dang / rin po che'i char mngon par phab bo //
analyzed: lha rdzas kyi gos dang / rgyan dang / yid bzhin gyi gos dang / nor bu dang / mu tig gi se mo do dang / rin po che'i char mngon par phab bo //
translated: They caused a rain of divine garments, ornaments, wish-fulfilling garments, jewels, pearl necklaces, and precious substances to fall.

original: lha rdzas kyi rol mo rdung ba mngon par dkrol to //
analyzed: lha rdzas kyi rol mo rdung ba mngon par dkrol to //
translated: They played divine music and cymbals.

original: dbyangs kyis lhung lhung legs kyi sgra phyung nas 'di skad ces gsol to; ;bdag cag sngon ma bstan pa'i chos mnyan par bgyi'o //
analyzed: dbyangs kyis lhung lhung legs kyi sgra phyung nas 'di skad ces gsol to; ;bdag cag sngon ma bstan pa'i chos mnyan par bgyi'o //
translated: They sang and made the sound of “Excellent!” and said, “We have never before listened to the Dharma that is taught.

original: bdud kyi yul las yang dag par shin tu 'da' bar bgyi'o //
analyzed: bdud kyi yul las yang dag par shin tu 'da' bar bgyi'o //
translated: We will completely transcend the domain of the māras.

original: nyon mongs pa'i yul gzhom par bgyi'o //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i yul gzhom par bgyi'o //
translated: We will conquer the domain of the afflictions.

original: ye shes kyi yul khong du chud par bgyi'o //
analyzed: ye shes kyi yul khong du chud par bgyi'o //
translated: We will comprehend the domain of wisdom.

original: zab mo'i stong pa nyid kyi lam khong du chud par bgyi'o //
analyzed: zab mo'i stong pa nyid kyi lam khong du chud par bgyi'o //
translated: We will comprehend the profound path of emptiness.”

original: zhes gsol pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das khang pa brtsegs pa de dag la 'dzegs te sengge'i khri bshams pa de nyid la bzhugs nas mi mjed kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad dang ldan pa sa dang nam mkha' khyab pa'i 'khor kun cang mi smra bar gyur nas thal mo
analyzed: zhes gsol pa dang / de nas bcom ldan 'das khang pa brtsegs pa de dag la 'dzegs te sengge'i khri bshams pa de nyid la bzhugs nas mi mjed kyi sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad dang ldan pa sa dang nam mkha' khyab pa'i 'khor kun cang mi smra bar gyur nas thal mo
translated: Having made this request, the Blessed One ascended those stacked houses and, sitting on the very lion throne he had arranged, the entire assembly of the Sahā buddha realm, filling the earth and sky, became silent and with palms joined

original: sbyar @307b te sems rtse gcig tu drang srong thub pa la lta bar gyur to //
analyzed: sbyar @307b te sems rtse gcig tu drang srong thub pa la lta bar gyur to //
translated: gazed one-pointedly at Sage Muni.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad dang ldan pa ma lus par sa dang nam mkha' khyab pa'i 'khor la rnam par gzigs nas de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad dang ldan pa ma lus par sa dang nam mkha' khyab pa'i 'khor la rnam par gzigs nas de'i tshe tshigs su bcad pa 'di dag gsungs so //
translated: Then the Blessed One, surveying the entire assembly of the Sahā buddha realm, filling the earth and sky without exception, at that time spoke these verses:

original: sems can ji snyed 'dir ni kun lhags pa //
analyzed: sems can ji snyed 'dir ni kun lhags pa //
translated: All sentient beings who have gathered here,

original: byang chub 'dod rnams yongs su chos tshol na //
analyzed: byang chub 'dod rnams yongs su chos tshol na //
translated: those who seek the Dharma out of desire for enlightenment,

original: byang chub mchog gi spyod pa rab bstan gyi //
analyzed: byang chub mchog gi spyod pa rab bstan gyi //
translated: I shall teach the conduct of supreme enlightenment.

original: de dag thams cad rtse gcig sems su nyon //
analyzed: de dag thams cad rtse gcig sems su nyon //
translated: Listen one-pointedly to all of it.

original: sems can la la gti mug sred pas bsgribs //
analyzed: sems can la la gti mug sred pas bsgribs //
translated: Some sentient beings are obscured by ignorance and craving,

original: phung po dag la'ang lta ba rnam mi spong //
analyzed: phung po dag la'ang lta ba rnam mi spong //
translated: And do not abandon views even with regard to the aggregates.

original: gang dag da dung byang chub mchog spyod brtson //
analyzed: gang dag da dung byang chub mchog spyod brtson //
translated: Those who still strive for supreme awakening

original: yang yang 'di la yon tan cung zad spyod //
analyzed: yang yang 'di la yon tan cung zad spyod //
translated: Will again and again engage in the slightest virtue in this regard.

original: dbang po drug la stong pa mi lta ste //
analyzed: dbang po drug la stong pa mi lta ste //
translated: Do not look at the six sense faculties as empty,

original: mtshan ma med pa'i 'dzin pa bdag la zung //
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa'i 'dzin pa bdag la zung //
translated: But grasp at the self as the apprehension of signlessness.

original: byang chub phyir ni cung zad brtson spyod kyi //
analyzed: byang chub phyir ni cung zad brtson spyod kyi //
translated: Those who strive a little for awakening

original: shes rab yon tan thams cad spyod pa med //
analyzed: shes rab yon tan thams cad spyod pa med //
translated: Do not engage in the practice of the wisdom that is the source of all qualities.

original: ji ltar me 'dod khyim gyi nang du ni //
analyzed: ji ltar me 'dod khyim gyi nang du ni //
translated: Just as one who desires fire in a house

original: btsal bas kyang ni me dag rnyed ma gyur //
analyzed: btsal bas kyang ni me dag rnyed ma gyur //
translated: Will not find fire by searching for it,

original: de ltar sems can la la byang chub 'dod //
analyzed: de ltar sems can la la byang chub 'dod //
translated: So some sentient beings desire awakening

original: stong pa bsgoms par shes rab thob pa med //
analyzed: stong pa bsgoms par shes rab thob pa med //
translated: But do not attain wisdom through meditating on emptiness.

original: de bas gang dag byang chub sdug 'dod pa //🔽phung po khams dang skye mched mtshan ma dag /
analyzed: de bas gang dag byang chub sdug 'dod pa // phung po khams dang skye mched mtshan ma dag /
translated: Therefore, those who desire the bliss of awakening🔽Should view all the aggregates, elements, and sense bases as signs,

original: rmi lam smig rgyu lta bur thams cad ltos //
analyzed: rmi lam smig rgyu lta bur thams cad ltos //
translated: Like a dream or a mirage.

original: 'di ni byang chub dam pa mchog gi lam //
analyzed: 'di ni byang chub dam pa mchog gi lam //
translated: This is the path to supreme, genuine awakening.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' bzang skyong la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis byang chub sems dpa' bzang skyong la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the bodhisattva Bhadrapāla:

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul nam mkha'i mdog gis 'dul @308a *//🔽ba'i bzod pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bdud kyi yul thams cad las yang dag par shin tu 'das te nga yir bya ba dang / bdag gir bya ba thams cad kyi srid pa'i bag la nyal ba dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul nam mkha'i mdog gis 'dul @308a *// ba'i bzod pa 'di la gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' bdud kyi yul thams cad las yang dag par shin tu 'das te nga yir bya ba dang / bdag gir bya ba thams cad kyi srid pa'i bag la nyal ba dang / mtshan ma med pa dang /
translated: “Son of noble family,🔽the bodhisattva who abides in this acceptance that is the method of correct conduct, the color of space,

original: ma rig par lta ba thams cad spangs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ma rig par lta ba thams cad spangs par 'gyur ro //
translated: has completely transcended all the domains of Māra. He abandons all the latent tendencies of existence related to ‘mine’ and ‘mine,’ and all the views of signs and ignorance.

original: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad 'dres pa med pa dang / sems can gyi go cha dang / sems sgyu ma lta bu dang / tshor ba du ba dang / rdul dang / nam mkha' dang / sprin lta bur rab tu shes so //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad 'dres pa med pa dang / sems can gyi go cha dang / sems sgyu ma lta bu dang / tshor ba du ba dang / rdul dang / nam mkha' dang / sprin lta bur rab tu shes so //
translated: He understands all worlds to be unmixed, and the armor of sentient beings to be like an illusion, and he understands feelings to be like smoke, dust, space, and clouds.

original: mtshan ma dang mtshan nyid thams cad nam mkha' spros pa lta bur rab tu shes so //
analyzed: mtshan ma dang mtshan nyid thams cad nam mkha' spros pa lta bur rab tu shes so //
translated: He understands all signs and characteristics to be like space free of elaborations.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad las 'dus par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad las 'dus par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be the gathering of all roots of virtue.

original: las yongs su zad cing sems can nye bar 'tsho bar yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: las yongs su zad cing sems can nye bar 'tsho bar yang 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be the one who exhausts karma and sustains sentient beings.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang ma bskyed pa'i gnyen lta bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba bskyed pa dang ma bskyed pa'i gnyen lta bur 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be like a friend to those who have and have not generated roots of virtue.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la sgrib pa med pa ston par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad la sgrib pa med pa ston par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be the one who reveals the unobstructedness of all the qualities of the Buddha.

original: pha rol gyi rgol ba thams cad nam mkha' dang mtshungs par thul ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: pha rol gyi rgol ba thams cad nam mkha' dang mtshungs par thul ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be the one who conquers all opponents, who is unassailable like space.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rgyas pa sengge lta bu dang / rgya mtsho chen po lta bu'i chen po'i char gyi chu bo rab tu gtong ba dang / 'khrul pa med pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / chags pa med pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa dang /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos thams cad yongs su rgyas pa sengge lta bu dang / rgya mtsho chen po lta bu'i chen po'i char gyi chu bo rab tu gtong ba dang / 'khrul pa med pa'i mngon par shes pa dang / chags pa med pa'i spobs pa dang ldan pa dang /
translated: He will be the one who rains down the great rain of the ocean of all the qualities of the Buddha, like a lion, and who is endowed with unmistaken superknowledge and unimpeded eloquence.

original: bstod pa dang / rab tu bsngags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bstod pa dang / rab tu bsngags par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will be the one who is praised and extolled.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family!

original: bzod pa 'di bsgoms pa nas lus dbang du btsugs @308b ba'i bar du 'di las sangs rgyas kyi yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzod pa 'di bsgoms pa nas lus dbang du btsugs @308b ba'i bar du 'di las sangs rgyas kyi yon tan bsam gyis mi khyab par 'gyur ro //
translated: From the cultivation of this patience up to the subjugation of the body, the inconceivable qualities of the Buddha will be attained.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: de la bzod pa 'di rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de la bzod pa 'di rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: This patience is of two kinds:

original: yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul gyi bzod pa dang / nam mkha'i mdog gis 'dul ba'i bzod par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul gyi bzod pa dang / nam mkha'i mdog gis 'dul ba'i bzod par 'gyur ro //
translated: the patience of the way of right practice and the patience of the discipline of the color of space.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: de la yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul gyi bzod pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul gyi bzod pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the patience of the way of right practice?

original: rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: It is of five kinds.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul gyi bzod pa rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul gyi bzod pa rnam pa lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five kinds of patience of the way of right practice?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed dang / rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: form, feeling, perception, mental formations, and consciousness.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: de la gzugs kyi phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gzugs kyi phung po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the aggregate of form?

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of good family!

original: rnam pa brgyad de /
analyzed: rnam pa brgyad de /
translated: It is of eight kinds:

original: byang chub sems dpas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa brtags pa'i bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas tshul bzhin yid la byed pa brtags pa'i bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva should cultivate the acceptance that comes from properly contemplating the mind.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: what are the eight?

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Form is

original: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po bzhi'o //
translated: the four great elements.

original: gzugs zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: gzugs zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Form is

original: nad do // 'dod chags zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: nad do // 'dod chags zhes bya ba ni /
translated: disease. Desire is

original: rnam par 'jig pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid do //
analyzed: rnam par 'jig pa'i chos kyi mtshan nyid do //
translated: the characteristic of the nature of destruction.

original: gang rnam par 'jig pa'i rang bzhin de ni /
analyzed: gang rnam par 'jig pa'i rang bzhin de ni /
translated: That which has the nature of destruction

original: mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'o //
translated: is impermanent.

original: de'i rang bzhin ni /
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin ni /
translated: Its nature

original: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa stong pa nyid yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: is the emptiness of the absence of things, which is cut off.

original: phyi dang nang gi rab 'bring tha ma'i nyon mongs pa'i rgyun bcad do //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi rab 'bring tha ma'i nyon mongs pa'i rgyun bcad do //
translated: The continuum of inner and outer afflictions, whether superior, middling, or inferior, is cut off.

original: nam mkha' ji ltar thams cad dang ldan pa de bzhin du mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / stong pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i bzod pa sgom par byed do //
analyzed: nam mkha' ji ltar thams cad dang ldan pa de bzhin du mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bdag med pa dang / stong pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i bzod pa sgom par byed do //
translated: Just as space is endowed with everything, so too one cultivates acceptance endowed with the characteristics of impermanence, suffering, no-self, and emptiness.

original: 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa'i sems can yongs su smin pa nye bar 'tsho ba'i bzod par blta bar bya'o //🔽rigs kyi @309a *//
analyzed: 'di ni / byang chub sems dpa'i sems can yongs su smin pa nye bar 'tsho ba'i bzod par blta bar bya'o // rigs kyi @309a *//
translated: This is the bodhisattva’s patience that sustains the ripening of beings.

original: bu; gzhan yang gzugs de'ang 'byung ba chen po bzhi ste /🔽rigs kyi bu /🔽'byung ba chen po bzhi po 'di dag nang gi'am /
analyzed: bu; gzhan yang gzugs de'ang 'byung ba chen po bzhi ste / rigs kyi bu / 'byung ba chen po bzhi po 'di dag nang gi'am /
translated: “Noble son, moreover, form is the four great elements.

original: phyi rol gyi'am /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi'am /
translated: Noble son, these four great elements are either internal or external,

original: che ba'am / bra ba'am /
analyzed: che ba'am / bra ba'am /
translated: gross or subtle,🔽low or exalted,

original: dma' ba'am / bde ba'am /
analyzed: dma' ba'am / bde ba'am /
translated: pleasant or unpleasant,

original: gal te ring ba'am /
analyzed: gal te ring ba'am /
translated: far or near.

original: gal te nye ba de dag thams cad mi 'gro /🔽rnam par mi 'gro /
analyzed: gal te nye ba de dag thams cad mi 'gro / rnam par mi 'gro /
translated: All of them are not going, not coming,

original: mi skye / mi 'byung /
analyzed: mi skye / mi 'byung /
translated: not arising, not occurring,

original: bdag med / bdag gi med par brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag med / bdag gi med par brtag par bya'o //
translated: not self, and not mine.

original: zad pa'i tshul dang / zhi gnas kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshul dang / rtog pa med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i tshul dang / 'byung ba med cing mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: zad pa'i tshul dang / zhi gnas kyi mtshan nyid kyi tshul dang / rtog pa med pa dang / smon pa med pa'i tshul dang / 'byung ba med cing mtshan ma med pa'i tshul gyis brtag par bya'o //
translated: They should be examined in terms of the way of exhaustion, the way of the characteristics of tranquility, the way of non-conceptuality and non-aspiration, and the way of non-arising and the absence of marks.

original: ji ltar rdul shin tu phra ba kun 'byung ba dang / lus kun 'byung ba'i phyir nang gi sa'i khams sra bar brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar rdul shin tu phra ba kun 'byung ba dang / lus kun 'byung ba'i phyir nang gi sa'i khams sra bar brtag par bya'o //
translated: The inner earth element should be examined as solidity, because it is the source of all subtle particles and the source of the body.

original: shin tu phra ba'i rdul gcig po de la ji ltar lhag mthong phra mos brtag /
analyzed: shin tu phra ba'i rdul gcig po de la ji ltar lhag mthong phra mos brtag /
translated: “How should one examine a single subtle particle with subtle insight?

original: rdul phra mo gcig po de la ji ltar mtshan nyid med pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi spyod lam du gyur par rab tu shes pa dag med pa dang / rnam pa dang bral bar rab tu shes /
analyzed: rdul phra mo gcig po de la ji ltar mtshan nyid med pa'i nyon mongs pa thams cad kyi spyod lam du gyur par rab tu shes pa dag med pa dang / rnam pa dang bral bar rab tu shes /
translated: One should know that a single subtle particle is devoid of all the activities of the afflictions, which are devoid of characteristics, and devoid of aspects.

original: dngos po med pa dang / tshig gi lam dang bral ba dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / sgra dbyangs thams cad dang bral bar rab tu shes /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang / tshig gi lam dang bral ba dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / sgra dbyangs thams cad dang bral bar rab tu shes /
translated: One should know that it is non-existent, devoid of the path of words, non-apprehensible, and devoid of all sounds and tones.

original: bdag med pa dang bral ba dang / bdud kyi mtshan nyid rab tu shes /🔽yi ge med pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen dang bral bar rab tu shes /
analyzed: bdag med pa dang bral ba dang / bdud kyi mtshan nyid rab tu shes / yi ge med pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen dang bral bar rab tu shes /
translated: One should know that it is devoid of self and devoid of the characteristics of Māra.🔽One should know that it is devoid of letters and devoid of causes and conditions.

original: dngos po med pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen dang bral bar rab tu shes /
analyzed: dngos po med pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen dang bral bar rab tu shes /
translated: One should know that it is non-existent and devoid of causes and conditions.

original: mtshan ma med pa las rdul shin tu phra bar rab tu shes /
analyzed: mtshan ma med pa las rdul shin tu phra bar rab tu shes /
translated: In the absence of characteristics, one should understand the most subtle particles.

original: ji @309b ltar 'du byed thams cad rab tu zhi ba la rnam par brgyad po de dag gi rdul shin tu phra mo gcig tu brtag go /
analyzed: ji @309b ltar 'du byed thams cad rab tu zhi ba la rnam par brgyad po de dag gi rdul shin tu phra mo gcig tu brtag go /
translated: In the pacification of all formations, one should consider a single most subtle particle in terms of these eight aspects.

original: de bzhin du gnyis pa dang / de bzhin du gsum pa nas nang gi lus thams cad kyi bar du gcig la'ang so sor rnam pa brgyad po 'di dag gis rdul shin tu phra mo gcig tu brtag go /
analyzed: de bzhin du gnyis pa dang / de bzhin du gsum pa nas nang gi lus thams cad kyi bar du gcig la'ang so sor rnam pa brgyad po 'di dag gis rdul shin tu phra mo gcig tu brtag go /
translated: In the same way, one should consider a second [particle], and in the same way, a third, and so on, until one has considered all the particles of the inner body in terms of these eight individual aspects.

original: nang gi lus ji lta ba de bzhin du phyi rol gyi lus kyi sa'i khams kyang rnam pa brgyad po 'di dag gis so sor rdul shin tu phra bar brtag go /🔽mtshan nyid med pa nas mtshan ma med pa'i bar du sa'i khams thams cad nang gi'am /
analyzed: nang gi lus ji lta ba de bzhin du phyi rol gyi lus kyi sa'i khams kyang rnam pa brgyad po 'di dag gis so sor rdul shin tu phra bar brtag go / mtshan nyid med pa nas mtshan ma med pa'i bar du sa'i khams thams cad nang gi'am /
translated: Just as with the inner body, one should also consider the earth element of the outer body in terms of these eight aspects.

original: phyi rol gyi'am /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi'am /
translated: From the absence of characteristics up to the absence of marks, all earth elements, whether inner or outer,

original: che ba'am / phra ba'am /
analyzed: che ba'am / phra ba'am /
translated: whether great or small,

original: dma' ba'am / bde ba'am /
analyzed: dma' ba'am / bde ba'am /
translated: whether low or high,

original: gang ring ba'am /
analyzed: gang ring ba'am /
translated: whether far or near,

original: gang nye ba de dag thams cad zad pa'i chos su yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
analyzed: gang nye ba de dag thams cad zad pa'i chos su yang dag par rjes su mthong ngo //
translated: He sees all that is near as having the nature of exhaustion.

original: gang zad pa 'di ni /
analyzed: gang zad pa 'di ni /
translated: That which is exhausted

original: mi rtag pa'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa'o //
translated: is impermanent.

original: gang mi rtag pa 'di'ang sdug bsngal ba'o //
analyzed: gang mi rtag pa 'di'ang sdug bsngal ba'o //
translated: That which is impermanent is suffering.

original: gang mi 'byung ba de bdag med pa'o //
analyzed: gang mi 'byung ba de bdag med pa'o //
translated: That which does not arise is selfless.

original: gang 'du byed thams cad kyi tshig gi lam dang phral ba de'ang stong pa ste /
analyzed: gang 'du byed thams cad kyi tshig gi lam dang phral ba de'ang stong pa ste /
translated: That which is free from the path of words of all conditioned things is also empty.

original: ji ltar phyi dang nang gi sa'i khams ji lta ba bzhin du stong par rab tu shes pa de ltar rab 'bring tha ma'i nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar phyi dang nang gi sa'i khams ji lta ba bzhin du stong par rab tu shes pa de ltar rab 'bring tha ma'i nyon mongs pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as he knows the outer and inner earth element to be empty, in the same way, the afflictions of the highest, middling, and lowest levels are pacified.

original: nam mkha' ji ltar 'du shes med cing tshor ba med pa de bzhin du sa'i khams kyang 'du shes med cing tshor ba med pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i bzod pa sgom par byed pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i sems can thams cad @310a *//
analyzed: nam mkha' ji ltar 'du shes med cing tshor ba med pa de bzhin du sa'i khams kyang 'du shes med cing tshor ba med pa dang / mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa dang / bdag med pa'i mtshan nyid dang ldan pa'i bzod pa sgom par byed pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i sems can thams cad @310a *//
translated: Just as space is without perception and without sensation, so too is the earth element without perception and without sensation.

original: yongs su smin pa nye bar 'tsho ba'i bzod par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: yongs su smin pa nye bar 'tsho ba'i bzod par blta bar bya'o //
translated: This patience that is cultivated with the characteristics of impermanence, suffering, emptiness, and no-self should be regarded as the bodhisattvas’ patience that brings about the ripening of all sentient beings.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: gzhan yang lus 'di la gsher ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
analyzed: gzhan yang lus 'di la gsher ba'i mtshan nyid ni /
translated: furthermore, the characteristic of moisture in this body is water.

original: chu ste / chu'i mtshan nyid phran tshogs su na skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas tsam du nang gi lus chu'i khams thams cad so sor thigs pa tsam du lhag mthong gi tshul gyis brtag go /
analyzed: chu ste / chu'i mtshan nyid phran tshogs su na skra'i rtse mo'i cha shas tsam du nang gi lus chu'i khams thams cad so sor thigs pa tsam du lhag mthong gi tshul gyis brtag go /
translated: With the method of insight, one should examine all the water elements in the body, down to the smallest particle, down to the smallest part of the tip of a hair.

original: che ba'am / phra ba'am /
analyzed: che ba'am / phra ba'am /
translated: Whether great or small,🔽whether low or high,

original: dma' ba'am; bde ba'i mtshan nyid med pa /
analyzed: dma' ba'am; bde ba'i mtshan nyid med pa /
translated: it has no characteristics of pleasure.

original: nyon mongs pa thams cad dang bral ba ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu shes pa nas mtshan ma med pa'i bar du de dag thigs pa tsam du 'du byed thams cad nye bar zhi bar rab tu shes pa ji lta bur thigs pa gcig la rnam pa🔽brgyad po de dag gis ji lta ba bzhin du brtag go /
