ten powers, the fearlessnesses, the detailed and thorough knowledges, and the distinct attributes of a Buddha, that they are dwelling in the objective supports of the śrāvaka vehicle, the pratyekabuddha vehicle, and the Great Vehicle, that they are dwelling in the objective supports of the four concentrations, four immeasurables, and four formless absorptions, that they are dwelling in the objective supports of the thirty-seven dharmas on the side of awakening, that they are dwelling in the objective supports of the fruit of entering the stream, the fruit of being tied to one more rebirth, the fruit of no longer being subject to rebirth, arhatship, individual enlightenment, and unsurpassed, perfect, complete awakening, that they are dwelling in the objective supports of the five eyes, the six superknowledges, the four individual correct knowledges, and the four forms of fearlessness, that they are dwelling in the objective supports of the thirty-two major marks of a great person and the eighty minor signs, that they are dwelling in the objective supports of the ten tathāgata powers, the four fearlessnesses, the four detailed and thorough knowledges, great love, great compassion, and the eighteen distinct attributes of a buddha, that they are dwelling in the objective supports of the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of path aspects, and the knowledge of all aspects, that they are dwelling in the objective supports of the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of path aspects, and the knowledge of all aspects, that they are dwelling in the objective supports of the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of path aspects, and the knowledge of all aspects, that they are dwelling in the objective supports of the knowledge of all aspects, the knowledge of path aspects, and the knowledge of all aspects, that they are dwelling in the objective supports of the knowledge of all

original: gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag la gnyis su med pa'i gnas dang / dus gsum tha mi dad pa dang / mi skye ba dang / mi 'gag pa dang / chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa dang / 'phel ba med par snyems pa 'di ni /🔽tshul gcig pa mnyam pa nyid kyi bzod pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: gang pha rol tu phyin pa drug po 'di dag la gnyis su med pa'i gnas dang / dus gsum tha mi dad pa dang / mi skye ba dang / mi 'gag pa dang / chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa dang / 'phel ba med par snyems pa 'di ni / tshul gcig pa mnyam pa nyid kyi bzod pa sgom pa'o //
translated: The acceptance of the non-differentiation of the three times, of non-production, of non-stopping, of non-annihilation, of permanence, of non-increase, and of the non-duality of the six perfections is the cultivation of the acceptance of the sameness of the one principle.🔽

original: bam po bdun pa /
analyzed: bam po bdun pa /
translated: This is the cultivation of the acceptance of the sameness of the single principle.

original: gang yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa spangs te theg pa chen po btsal nas ro myang ba'i yon tan la mngon par chags @337b shing reg nas snod dang snod ma yin par char 'bebs pa dang / sdom pa dang sdom pa med pa la rnam par rtog pa dang /
analyzed: gang yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa spangs te theg pa chen po btsal nas ro myang ba'i yon tan la mngon par chags @337b shing reg nas snod dang snod ma yin par char 'bebs pa dang / sdom pa dang sdom pa med pa la rnam par rtog pa dang /
translated: Those who, having abandoned the vehicles of the śrāvakas and pratyekabuddhas, seek the Great Vehicle, who, having tasted the qualities of enjoyment, become attached to them, who rain down on both worthy and unworthy vessels, who conceptualize both those who are restrained and those who are unrestrained,

original: sems can dang / srog dang / skye ba dang / gso ba dang / gang zag dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa la rgyu dang rkyen du dmigs pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu la gnas shing snyems pa 'di dag kyang zag pa dang bcas pa nye bar len pa'i 'du byed kyis sdug bsngal la bzod pa rnam par 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: sems can dang / srog dang / skye ba dang / gso ba dang / gang zag dang / byed pa po dang / byed du 'jug pa la rgyu dang rkyen du dmigs pa dang / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i 'bras bu la gnas shing snyems pa 'di dag kyang zag pa dang bcas pa nye bar len pa'i 'du byed kyis sdug bsngal la bzod pa rnam par 'jig pa'o //
translated: The acceptance of suffering is destroyed by the contaminated formations that are the appropriated aggregates, which are the objects of the views that there is a sentient being, a life-force, a rebirth, a nourisher, a person, an agent, and an instigator, and which are the objects of the views that there are causes and conditions, and that there are virtuous and nonvirtuous effects.

original: gang yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i dus gsum gyi sdom pa la rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / 'dzin pa med pa dang / gtong ba med pa dang / bskyed pa med pa dang /
analyzed: gang yang nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa'i dus gsum gyi sdom pa la rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / 'dzin pa med pa dang / gtong ba med pa dang / bskyed pa med pa dang /
translated: The acceptance of suffering is also destroyed by the views that there is no cause, no effect, no effort, no great teacher, no world beyond, no past and future lives, and no arhats in the present.

original: bskyung ba med pa dang / bla na med pa'i theg pa chen po'i dus gsum gyi sdom pa la'ang rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / 'dzin pa med pa dang / gtong ba med pa dang / bskyed pa med pa dang /
analyzed: bskyung ba med pa dang / bla na med pa'i theg pa chen po'i dus gsum gyi sdom pa la'ang rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / 'dzin pa med pa dang / gtong ba med pa dang / bskyed pa med pa dang /
translated: The unconditioned and unoriginated vows of the Great Vehicle, which are beyond the three times, are also without conceptualization, without discursive thought, without grasping, without relinquishing, without arising,🔽without subsiding, without reference to the state of pure conduct, and without the characteristics of the path of words of all conditioned things.

original: bskyung ba med pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa med pa dang / 'du byed thams cad kyi tshig gi lam la snyems pa med pa'i mtshan nyid la mi dmigs pa 'di dag kyang tshul gcig gi mnyam pa nyid kyi chos thams cad mngon sum du 'byung ba med par stong par ston pa'i bzod pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no
analyzed: bskyung ba med pa dang / tshangs par spyod pa'i dngos po la dmigs pa med pa dang / 'du byed thams cad kyi tshig gi lam la snyems pa med pa'i mtshan nyid la mi dmigs pa 'di dag kyang tshul gcig gi mnyam pa nyid kyi chos thams cad mngon sum du 'byung ba med par stong par ston pa'i bzod pa yongs su rdzogs pa yin no
translated: This is the complete acceptance that reveals the emptiness of the non-appearance of all phenomena, which are of the same mode and of the same nature.

original: // 'di'ang tshul khrims nye bar len pa la 'byung ba med cing 'gog pa med par blta'o //
analyzed: // 'di'ang tshul khrims nye bar len pa la 'byung ba med cing 'gog pa med par blta'o //
translated: This is also the view that the appropriation of discipline is neither produced nor ceased.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis @338a *//
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis @338a *//
translated: The Blessed One

original: bzod pa bsgom pa'i don du gsungs pa de ni /
analyzed: bzod pa bsgom pa'i don du gsungs pa de ni /
translated: taught this for the sake of cultivating patience.

original: 'di skad brjod do //
analyzed: 'di skad brjod do //
translated: This is what was said:

original: rigs dang mi rigs zhugs pa rnams //
analyzed: rigs dang mi rigs zhugs pa rnams //
translated: “Those who are engaged in what is right and what is wrong

original: 'du byed rtag pa'i blo gros te //
analyzed: 'du byed rtag pa'i blo gros te //
translated: Have the idea that compounded things are permanent.

original: tshul khrims brtul zhugs byin brlabs las //
analyzed: tshul khrims brtul zhugs byin brlabs las //
translated: From the blessing of discipline and ritual,

original: yongs su 'khyams pas rab sdug bsngal //
analyzed: yongs su 'khyams pas rab sdug bsngal //
translated: They wander, suffering greatly.

original: dngos po med pa'i phung po rnams //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'i phung po rnams //
translated: “The aggregates are not real things.

original: stong pa'i chos la byed pa med //
analyzed: stong pa'i chos la byed pa med //
translated: In empty phenomena there is no action.

original: bdag med chos la 'jug pa rnams //
analyzed: bdag med chos la 'jug pa rnams //
translated: Those who engage with the teaching of no-self

original: ji ltar bye ma bzhin du mthong //🔽'du byed rnams la snyems pa yi //
analyzed: ji ltar bye ma bzhin du mthong // 'du byed rnams la snyems pa yi //
translated: See it as being like sand.🔽“The yogis and yoginīs who are conceited

original: brtul zhugs rnal 'byor spyod kyis mthong //
analyzed: brtul zhugs rnal 'byor spyod kyis mthong //
translated: About compounded things see discipline.

original: 'di la snying rje bskyed pas na //
analyzed: 'di la snying rje bskyed pas na //
translated: They generate compassion for them

original: sems can bye ba rnam par 'dul //
analyzed: sems can bye ba rnam par 'dul //
translated: And train millions of sentient beings.🔽“They teach the Dharma to living beings,🔽Teaching the aggregates to be without a self,🔽Like an illusion, a mirage, or a dream,

original: sgyu ma smig rgyu rmi lam dang // lus med cing ni gnas med pa //🔽bdag med phung po ston pa dang // srog chags rnams la chos kyang ston //
analyzed: sgyu ma smig rgyu rmi lam dang // lus med cing ni gnas med pa // bdag med phung po ston pa dang // srog chags rnams la chos kyang ston //
translated: Without a body or a location.

original: chos kun tshul gcig bdag med pas //
analyzed: chos kun tshul gcig bdag med pas //
translated: “All phenomena are the same in being without a self,

original: stong pa nyid pas skye 'gag med //
analyzed: stong pa nyid pas skye 'gag med //
translated: Empty, without arising or ceasing.

original: srog chags rnams la bzod pa ston //
analyzed: srog chags rnams la bzod pa ston //
translated: They teach patience to living beings🔽And train millions of sentient beings.

original: rtog par rnam rtog the tshom bcad //
analyzed: rtog par rnam rtog the tshom bcad //
translated: And cut through the doubts of conceptual thought.

original: bzod pa ma nor de bzhin nyid //
analyzed: bzod pa ma nor de bzhin nyid //
translated: Patience is the unerring suchness.

original: tshul khrims brtul zhugs snyems pa yis //
analyzed: tshul khrims brtul zhugs snyems pa yis //
translated: Through the pride of discipline and ritual,

original: bcings pa thams cad gcod par 'gyur //
analyzed: bcings pa thams cad gcod par 'gyur //
translated: All bonds will be severed.

original: ji ltar me mar mun pa la //
analyzed: ji ltar me mar mun pa la //
translated: Just as a lamp in the darkness

original: byung nas mun pa bsal pa la //
analyzed: byung nas mun pa bsal pa la //
translated: Removes the darkness,

original: bcings pa thams cad mthong ba bzhin; ;bzod pa nyi shu pas pa yis //
analyzed: bcings pa thams cad mthong ba bzhin; ;bzod pa nyi shu pas pa yis //
translated: So too does the patience of the twenty-first

original: mun nag de ni rab zhugs kyang //
analyzed: mun nag de ni rab zhugs kyang //
translated: Enter the darkness

original: de ni srid pa skye mi 'gyur //
analyzed: de ni srid pa skye mi 'gyur //
translated: And not give rise to existence.

original: bzod pa sgom la dpa' ba yis //
analyzed: bzod pa sgom la dpa' ba yis //
translated: Those who are heroic in cultivating patience

original: sred pa thams cad zad par byed //🔽'khor @338b ba na ni yun ring por //
analyzed: sred pa thams cad zad par byed // 'khor @338b ba na ni yun ring por //
translated: Exhaust all craving.🔽Those who have long been

original: 'khor bar gyur pa'i mi rnams kyang //
analyzed: 'khor bar gyur pa'i mi rnams kyang //
translated: In the cycle of saṃsāra

original: sred pa las ni rnam par grol //
analyzed: sred pa las ni rnam par grol //
translated: Are liberated from craving.

original: de dag mya ngan 'das pa ni //
analyzed: de dag mya ngan 'das pa ni //
translated: Their nirvāṇa

original: bgrang bar yang ni mi chog ste //
analyzed: bgrang bar yang ni mi chog ste //
translated: Cannot be counted.🔽Just as a well-trained soldier

original: mtshon cha shin tu bslabs pas na; ;dgra rnams kun la 'jigs pa med //
analyzed: mtshon cha shin tu bslabs pas na; ;dgra rnams kun la 'jigs pa med //
translated: Has no fear of any enemy,

original: bzod pa shin tu bsgoms pa des //
analyzed: bzod pa shin tu bsgoms pa des //
translated: So too does one who has well cultivated patience

original: nyon mongs thams cad rab tu 'joms //
analyzed: nyon mongs thams cad rab tu 'joms //
translated: Destroy all afflictions.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de la bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la bdag tu smra ba'i nye bar len pa gang zhe na /
translated: what is the appropriation of the doctrine of self?

original: bdag ni / rang bzhin gyis med pa yin mod kyi /
analyzed: bdag ni / rang bzhin gyis med pa yin mod kyi /
translated: The self is indeed devoid of intrinsic existence.

original: 'on kyang 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la bdag tu smra bas rmongs nas bdag skyed de /
analyzed: 'on kyang 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la bdag tu smra bas rmongs nas bdag skyed de /
translated: Nevertheless, due to the delusion of speaking of the five sense pleasures as the self, the self is produced.

original: mig ni / bdag tu rab tu shes /🔽mig gi rnam par shes pa'ang bde ba dang sdug bsngal la 'jug pa skye ba la mngon par chags par byed pa nas yid bdag tu rab tu shes shing yid kyi rnam par shes pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal la 'jug pa skye ba la mngon par chags
analyzed: mig ni / bdag tu rab tu shes / mig gi rnam par shes pa'ang bde ba dang sdug bsngal la 'jug pa skye ba la mngon par chags par byed pa nas yid bdag tu rab tu shes shing yid kyi rnam par shes pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal la 'jug pa skye ba la mngon par chags
translated: The eye is known as the self.

original: par byed pa'i bar du 'di dag ni /
analyzed: par byed pa'i bar du 'di dag ni /
translated: The visual consciousness is attached to the arising of engagement with pleasure and pain. From the ear known as the self, the auditory consciousness is attached to the arising of engagement with pleasure and pain. From the nose known as the self, the olfactory consciousness is attached to the arising of engagement with pleasure and pain. From the tongue known as the self, the gustatory consciousness is attached to the arising of engagement with pleasure and pain. From the body known as the self, the tactile consciousness is attached to the arising of engagement with pleasure and pain. From the mind known as the self, the mental consciousness is attached to the arising of engagement with pleasure and pain.

original: bden gyi / gzhan ni /
analyzed: bden gyi / gzhan ni /
translated: These are true,

original: gti mug go snyam pa'o //
analyzed: gti mug go snyam pa'o //
translated: while the others are deluded.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: skye mched drug rang gi yul las bden pa ste /
analyzed: skye mched drug rang gi yul las bden pa ste /
translated: The six sense sources are true in relation to their own objects.

original: rigs kyi bu /🔽mig ni / 'di ltar bdag ni /🔽bdag ma yin te /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu / mig ni / 'di ltar bdag ni / bdag ma yin te /
translated: Son of noble family,🔽the eye is like this:🔽the self is not the eye.

original: bdag dang bdag gi ma yin pas 'di ltar bdag ni /
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi ma yin pas 'di ltar bdag ni /
translated: The self is not the eye, nor does the self belong to the eye. Therefore, the self is not the eye.

original: bdag gis bskyed par mi 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: bdag gis bskyed par mi 'gyur zhing /
translated: It is not produced by itself.

original: bdag gang yin bdag gi'ang yin te /
analyzed: bdag gang yin bdag gi'ang yin te /
translated: It is not the self, nor is it the self’s.

original: bdag dang bdag gi mig yin no //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gi mig yin no //
translated: It is the self’s eye.

original: de ltar mig kyang bdag yin par rnam par shes pa bskyed nas lus kyi reg pa'i bar du shes par bya'o @339a *//
analyzed: de ltar mig kyang bdag yin par rnam par shes pa bskyed nas lus kyi reg pa'i bar du shes par bya'o @339a *//
translated: In this way, having produced the consciousness that the eye is the self, one should understand up to the body’s contact.

original: snyam pa mi sems te /
analyzed: snyam pa mi sems te /
translated: One does not think,

original: 'on kyang mig gis gzugs ma bskyed de /
analyzed: 'on kyang mig gis gzugs ma bskyed de /
translated: ‘The eye does not produce form.

original: sgras kyang rna ba ma bskyed pa nas lus kyis reg pa'i bar du ma bskyed de /
analyzed: sgras kyang rna ba ma bskyed pa nas lus kyis reg pa'i bar du ma bskyed de /
translated: Sound does not produce the ear, up to the body does not produce contact.

original: reg pas lus ma bskyed /
analyzed: reg pas lus ma bskyed /
translated: Contact does not produce the body.

original: mig gis gzugs ma bskyed de /
analyzed: mig gis gzugs ma bskyed de /
translated: The eye does not produce form.

original: mig gis gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams ma bskyed de /🔽mig gis mig gi rnam par shes pa'ang ma bskyed /
analyzed: mig gis gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams ma bskyed de / mig gis mig gi rnam par shes pa'ang ma bskyed /
translated: The eye does not produce form, feeling, discrimination, and compositional factors.🔽The eye also does not produce eye consciousness.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas kyang mig ma bskyed de /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas kyang mig ma bskyed de /
translated: Eye consciousness also does not produce the eye.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pas kyang mig ma bskyed de /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pas kyang mig ma bskyed de /
translated: Eye consciousness also does not produce the eye.

original: yang mig gis rna ba'i yul rab tu mi shes te /
analyzed: yang mig gis rna ba'i yul rab tu mi shes te /
translated: Moreover, the eye does not know the object of the ear.

original: rna bas kyang mig gi yul rab tu mi shes pa nas yid kyis chos kyi yul rab tu mi shes te /
analyzed: rna bas kyang mig gi yul rab tu mi shes pa nas yid kyis chos kyi yul rab tu mi shes te /
translated: The ear does not know the object of the eye, and so on up to: the mind does not know the object of dharmas.

original: chos kyis kyang yid kyi yul rab tu mi shes so //
analyzed: chos kyis kyang yid kyi yul rab tu mi shes so //
translated: Dharmas do not know the object of the mind.

original: skye mched 'di dag thams cad ni /
analyzed: skye mched 'di dag thams cad ni /
translated: All these sense-spheres🔽are empty of the five sense-qualities and the five aggregates.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang / phung po lnga rnams kyi rgyu dang rkyen la dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid las phyi dang nang gi phung po dang / skye mched 'di dag thams cad ni /🔽gcig la gcig rnam par rtog pa'i rgyus stong bar 'gyur te; 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang phung po lnga rnams gcig la gcig rgyu dang rkyen du dmigs shing /
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang / phung po lnga rnams kyi rgyu dang rkyen la dmigs pa'i ngo bo nyid las phyi dang nang gi phung po dang / skye mched 'di dag thams cad ni / gcig la gcig rnam par rtog pa'i rgyus stong bar 'gyur te; 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga dang phung po lnga rnams gcig la gcig rgyu dang rkyen du dmigs shing /
translated: All these inner and outer aggregates and sense-spheres are empty of each other, because they are the cause and condition of each other.

original: rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gcig gis gcig stong ste /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa'i ngo bo nyid kyis gcig gis gcig stong ste /
translated: The five sense-qualities and the five aggregates are the cause and condition of each other, and they are empty of each other because they are the nature of conceptualization.

original: gang nang gi phung po dang / skye mched rnams ni /
analyzed: gang nang gi phung po dang / skye mched rnams ni /
translated: The inner aggregates and sense-spheres

original: gcig gi yul du gcig mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: gcig gi yul du gcig mi 'gyur te /
translated: are not the object of each other.

original: de bzhin du nang dang phyi'i dngos por ma yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du nang dang phyi'i dngos por ma yin te /
translated: In the same way, they are not inner and outer things.

original: phyi'i yang nang gi phung po dang skye mched rnams yul du mi @339b 'gyur ro //
analyzed: phyi'i yang nang gi phung po dang skye mched rnams yul du mi @339b 'gyur ro //
translated: The outer and inner aggregates and sense sources are not objects.

original: de ltar phyi nang gi dngos po thams cad gcig gi yul gcig ma yin zhing /
analyzed: de ltar phyi nang gi dngos po thams cad gcig gi yul gcig ma yin zhing /
translated: In this way, all outer and inner things are not objects of each other.

original: gcig la gcig rgyu dang rkyen du dmigs shing rnam par rtog pa'i yul du mi 'gyur mod kyi; 'on kyang sred pa'i tshul du ston te /
analyzed: gcig la gcig rgyu dang rkyen du dmigs shing rnam par rtog pa'i yul du mi 'gyur mod kyi; 'on kyang sred pa'i tshul du ston te /
translated: Although they are not observed as causes and conditions for each other, they are still taught as objects of craving.

original: de'ang rgyu ma'i tshul lo //🔽sgyu ma'i tshul gang yin pa de ni /🔽de bzhin nyid ma yin no //
analyzed: de'ang rgyu ma'i tshul lo // sgyu ma'i tshul gang yin pa de ni / de bzhin nyid ma yin no //
translated: That is the way of causes.🔽The way of illusion is not suchness.

original: gang de bzhin nyid tshul ma yin pa de ni /🔽med do // gang med pa de la ni /
analyzed: gang de bzhin nyid tshul ma yin pa de ni / med do // gang med pa de la ni /
translated: That which is not the way of suchness does not exist.

original: skye ba med do //🔽gang skye ba med pa de ni /
analyzed: skye ba med do // gang skye ba med pa de ni /
translated: That which does not exist has no arising.

original: 'gag pa med de /
analyzed: 'gag pa med de /
translated: That which has no arising has no cessation.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: chos thams cad la ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad la ni /
translated: all phenomena

original: skye ba dang 'gag pa med do //
analyzed: skye ba dang 'gag pa med do //
translated: have no arising and no cessation.

original: 'on kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo thams cad ni /
translated: However, all ordinary, childish beings

original: dka' bar byed pa ste /
analyzed: dka' bar byed pa ste /
translated: are difficult to help.

original: gang la bdag med pa de skyed cing de ltar mi dge ba'i rgyu dang rkyen la dmigs nas gzugs bskyed nas thar pa de las yongs su 'khyams nas ngan song du yun ring por mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu so sor myong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang la bdag med pa de skyed cing de ltar mi dge ba'i rgyu dang rkyen la dmigs nas gzugs bskyed nas thar pa de las yongs su 'khyams nas ngan song du yun ring por mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu so sor myong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: That which is without self produces that which is without self. Thus, having observed the causes and conditions of non-virtue, one produces form. Having wandered from that liberation, one experiences the results of the lower realms for a long time.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di lta ste /🔽dper na / shing ni /
analyzed: 'di lta ste / dper na / shing ni /
translated: it is like this:🔽a tree

original: me ma yin la shing la me'ang med de /
analyzed: me ma yin la shing la me'ang med de /
translated: is not fire, nor is fire in the tree.

original: shing dang mer 'dres pa'ang ma yin mod kyi /
analyzed: shing dang mer 'dres pa'ang ma yin mod kyi /
translated: Fire and the tree are not mixed together.

original: 'on kyang me 'dod pa'i mi zhig gis lag pa gnyis kyis shing la shing sbyar ba dang de las me byung nas shing de nyid tshig par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'on kyang me 'dod pa'i mi zhig gis lag pa gnyis kyis shing la shing sbyar ba dang de las me byung nas shing de nyid tshig par 'gyur ro //
translated: Nevertheless, if a person who desires fire were to rub together the wood with his two hands, fire would arise from that and the wood would be burned.

original: rigs kyi bu; de bzhin du phyi nang gi dngos po de dag thams cad kyang gcig gis gcig stong zhing gcig gi yul gcig ma yin la /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu; de bzhin du phyi nang gi dngos po de dag thams cad kyang gcig gis gcig stong zhing gcig gi yul gcig ma yin la /
translated: Son of noble family, in the same way, all those external and internal things are empty of each other, and the domain of one is not the other.

original: tshul gcig cing bdag med de stong mod kyi /
analyzed: tshul gcig cing bdag med de stong mod kyi /
translated: They are of the same mode, and are without self, and are empty.

original: @340a *// 'on kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo dka' bar byed pa rnams kyis bdag med pa'i chos stong pa la chags nas phan tshun nas bsdus pas na log par spyod pa gsum gyi rgyu dang rkyen bskyed de /
analyzed: @340a *// 'on kyang byis pa so so'i skye bo dka' bar byed pa rnams kyis bdag med pa'i chos stong pa la chags nas phan tshun nas bsdus pas na log par spyod pa gsum gyi rgyu dang rkyen bskyed de /
translated: Nevertheless, childish ordinary beings, who are difficult to help, become attached to the Dharma of selflessness and emptiness, and then quarrel with each other, giving rise to the causes and conditions of the three kinds of wrong conduct.

original: rgyu dang rkyen des ngan song gsum du mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu so sor myong nas 'khor ba na yun ring por 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyu dang rkyen des ngan song gsum du mi 'dod pa'i 'bras bu so sor myong nas 'khor ba na yun ring por 'khor bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By those causes and conditions, they experience the undesirable results individually in the three lower realms, and they will continue to wander for a long time in saṃsāra.

original: 'on kyang gang phyi nang gi chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid bdag med cing stong par 'du shes pa de dag ni /
analyzed: 'on kyang gang phyi nang gi chos thams cad kyi ngo bo nyid bdag med cing stong par 'du shes pa de dag ni /
translated: Nevertheless, those who perceive the nature of all inner and outer phenomena to be selfless and empty,

original: yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul gyis bzod pa 'di yongs su rdzogs nas myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //
analyzed: yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul gyis bzod pa 'di yongs su rdzogs nas myur du bla na med pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub mngon par 'tshang rgya'o //
translated: having perfected this acceptance through the way of correct practice, will quickly attain manifestly perfect buddhahood in unsurpassed, genuinely perfect enlightenment.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis don 'di bsdus te gsungs pa de la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis don 'di bsdus te gsungs pa de la 'di skad ces bka' stsal to //
translated: The Blessed One summarized the meaning of this and said the following:

original: bdag dang bdag gis byin brlabs so //
analyzed: bdag dang bdag gis byin brlabs so //
translated: “I and mine” are blessed.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la chags //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la chags //
translated: Are attached to the five sense pleasures.

original: mig ni bdag tu rab tu shes //
analyzed: mig ni bdag tu rab tu shes //
translated: “The eye is known to be the self,

original: rna ba sna dang de ltar yid //
analyzed: rna ba sna dang de ltar yid //
translated: And the ear, nose, and likewise the mind.

original: bde dang sdug bsngal rab tu shes //
analyzed: bde dang sdug bsngal rab tu shes //
translated: They know happiness and suffering,🔽And through conceit toward all formations,

original: 'du byed kun la snyems pas na; ;ngan song rnams kyang rab tu bskyed //
analyzed: 'du byed kun la snyems pas na; ;ngan song rnams kyang rab tu bskyed //
translated: They produce the lower realms.

original: de bas de dag dka' bar byed //
analyzed: de bas de dag dka' bar byed //
translated: “Therefore, they make things difficult for themselves.

original: chos rnams 'di dag byed med pa //
analyzed: chos rnams 'di dag byed med pa //
translated: These phenomena are without action,

original: spros med yi ge med pa ste //🔽ji ltar 'jigs pa'i me las ni //
analyzed: spros med yi ge med pa ste // ji ltar 'jigs pa'i me las ni //
translated: Without conceptual elaboration, and without letters.🔽Just as fire arises

original: ngan song rnams ni bskyed par 'gyur //
analyzed: ngan song rnams ni bskyed par 'gyur //
translated: From the fear of the lower realms.

original: 'dir tshogs gnas pa ji snyed pa //
analyzed: 'dir tshogs gnas pa ji snyed pa //
translated: “All of you who are gathered here,

original: dge ba khyed la brjod par bya //🔽chos rnams kun gyi de nyid la //
analyzed: dge ba khyed la brjod par bya // chos rnams kun gyi de nyid la //
translated: I will tell you what is virtuous.🔽You should cultivate the suchness🔽Of all phenomena and attain acceptance.

original: bsgoms la bzod pa rtogs par @340b byos; ;'du byed rnams la rgyu med de //
analyzed: bsgoms la bzod pa rtogs par @340b byos; ;'du byed rnams la rgyu med de //
translated: “Formations are without cause,

original: bdag gi rang bzhin med pas na //
analyzed: bdag gi rang bzhin med pas na //
translated: Because they do not have a self-nature.

original: las kyi rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyang //
analyzed: las kyi rgyu dang rkyen rnams kyang //
translated: The causes and conditions of karma

original: gcig nas gcig tu mi shes so //🔽phyi rol dang ni nang rnams kyi //
analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu mi shes so // phyi rol dang ni nang rnams kyi //
translated: Are not known from one to the other.🔽“All phenomena, both outer and inner,

original: chos rnams kun la ba dang / med de //
analyzed: chos rnams kun la ba dang / med de //
translated: Are neither existent nor nonexistent.

original: zab cing zhi ba'i chos nyid ni //
analyzed: zab cing zhi ba'i chos nyid ni //
translated: The profound and peaceful nature of reality

original: bus pa 'dis ni mi shes so //
analyzed: bus pa 'dis ni mi shes so //
translated: is not understood by the childish.

original: ji ltar nam mkha'i chos rnams la //
analyzed: ji ltar nam mkha'i chos rnams la //
translated: Just as the phenomena of space

original: thams cad nye bar rtog pa med //🔽mtshan dang mtshan ma med pa yi //
analyzed: thams cad nye bar rtog pa med // mtshan dang mtshan ma med pa yi //
translated: are not conceived of as anything at all,

original: de bzhin bzod pa rnam par sgom //🔽phyi rol dang ni nang dag gi /
analyzed: de bzhin bzod pa rnam par sgom // phyi rol dang ni nang dag gi /
translated: so too should one cultivate patience🔽with regard to the character and the absence of character.🔽There is no pride in the external

original: nam mkha' la ni snyems pa med //
analyzed: nam mkha' la ni snyems pa med //
translated: or the internal space.

original: stong pa'i bzod pa de bsgoms pa //
analyzed: stong pa'i bzod pa de bsgoms pa //
translated: Cultivating the patience of emptiness,

original: de bzhin 'du byed blta bar bya //
analyzed: de bzhin 'du byed blta bar bya //
translated: one should view the conditioned in the same way.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad mthong ba ni //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad mthong ba ni //
translated: Seeing all the buddhas,

original: thams cad chos la gti mug med //
analyzed: thams cad chos la gti mug med //
translated: one is not confused about any phenomenon.

original: dge ba dran ldan 'gyur ba dag /
analyzed: dge ba dran ldan 'gyur ba dag /
translated: Those who are mindful of virtue

original: gang gi de bzhin bzod pa sgom //
analyzed: gang gi de bzhin bzod pa sgom //
translated: cultivate patience in the same way.

original: chos kyi sbyin pa cung zad kyang //
analyzed: chos kyi sbyin pa cung zad kyang //
translated: The gift of the Dharma is not

original: kun tu 'dzin cing mthong ba med //
analyzed: kun tu 'dzin cing mthong ba med //
translated: grasped at all, nor is it seen.

original: de ltar bzod pa gang sgom pa //
analyzed: de ltar bzod pa gang sgom pa //
translated: Those who cultivate patience in this way

original: snying po la ni gnas zhes bya //
analyzed: snying po la ni gnas zhes bya //
translated: are said to abide in the essence.

original: nye bar len pa'i rkyen gyis kyang srid pa rtogs te /
analyzed: nye bar len pa'i rkyen gyis kyang srid pa rtogs te /
translated: Existence is understood through the condition of appropriation.

original: nye bar len pa 'di bzhi ni /
analyzed: nye bar len pa 'di bzhi ni /
translated: These four appropriations

original: skad cig ma'o //
analyzed: skad cig ma'o //
translated: are momentary.

original: de la skye zhing 'gag pa'i nye bar len pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pos ni /
analyzed: de la skye zhing 'gag pa'i nye bar len pa'i skad cig ma gnyis pos ni /
translated: The two moments of appropriation that arise and cease

original: srid pa nye bar skyed do //
analyzed: srid pa nye bar skyed do //
translated: generate existence.

original: srid pa gsum ni /
analyzed: srid pa gsum ni /
translated: The three existences are

original: 'dod pa'i srid pa dang / gzugs kyi srid pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i srid pa dang / gzugs kyi srid pa dang / gzugs med pa'i srid pa'o //
translated: the existence of the desire realm, the existence of the form realm, and the existence of the formless realm.

original: de la 'dod pa'i srid pa ni /
analyzed: de la 'dod pa'i srid pa ni /
translated: Among them, the existence of the desire realm

original: sems can rnams la rnam par slu ba ste /
analyzed: sems can rnams la rnam par slu ba ste /
translated: decieves sentient beings.

original: sems can dmyal ba chen po brgyad dang / byol song dang / yi dvags dang / gling chen po bzhi @341a *//
analyzed: sems can dmyal ba chen po brgyad dang / byol song dang / yi dvags dang / gling chen po bzhi @341a *//
translated: The eight great hells, the animal realm, the ghost realm, the four great continents,

original: dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i gnas drug po 'di dag ni /
analyzed: dang / 'dod pa na spyod pa'i lha'i gnas drug po 'di dag ni /
translated: and the six heavenly realms of the desire realm—

original: gling bzhi pa'i 'dod pa'i srid pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: gling bzhi pa'i 'dod pa'i srid pa zhes bya'o //
translated: these are called the desire existence of the four continents.

original: gzug kyi srid pa ni /
analyzed: gzug kyi srid pa ni /
translated: The existence of the form realm

original: gzugs la spyod pa'i lha'i gnas bcu drug ste /
analyzed: gzugs la spyod pa'i lha'i gnas bcu drug ste /
translated: is the sixteen heavenly realms of the form realm.

original: 'di ni / gzugs kyi srid pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / gzugs kyi srid pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the existence of the form realm.

original: de la gzugs med pa'i srid pa ni /
analyzed: de la gzugs med pa'i srid pa ni /
translated: The existence of the formless realm

original: gzugs med pa la spyod pa'i lha'i gnas bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzugs med pa la spyod pa'i lha'i gnas bzhi ste /
translated: is the four heavenly realms of the formless realm.

original: 'di ni / gling bzhi ba'i gzugs med pa'i srid pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / gling bzhi ba'i gzugs med pa'i srid pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called the formless realm of the four continents.

original: de la rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: de la rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gang rgyu dang rkyen la dmigs nas ngan song gsum du srid pa de ni /
analyzed: gang rgyu dang rkyen la dmigs nas ngan song gsum du srid pa de ni /
translated: the existence that arises in the three lower realms due to causes and conditions

original: gcig tu tshul bzhin med pa'i yid la byed pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la snyems pa 'di la srid pa 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gcig tu tshul bzhin med pa'i yid la byed pa zag pa dang bcas pa'i 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la snyems pa 'di la srid pa 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: arises from the existence of the five contaminated sense objects that are not properly attended to.

original: gang yang gzugs kyi khams kyi gnas gzhan bcu gcig gi srid pa 'byung ba de'ang zag pa dang bcas pa dge ba'i rgyu'i srid pa ste /
analyzed: gang yang gzugs kyi khams kyi gnas gzhan bcu gcig gi srid pa 'byung ba de'ang zag pa dang bcas pa dge ba'i rgyu'i srid pa ste /
translated: The existence that arises in the eleven other abodes of the form realm is also a contaminated virtuous cause of existence.

original: gang 'di la gzugs kyi khams kyi gnas gzhan lnga'i srid pa 'byung ba'i rgyu de dge ba la dmigs pa'i rgyu bzod pa la dmigs pa'i dngos po rnams sa dang po nas sa bdun pa'i bar du de la skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang 'di la gzugs kyi khams kyi gnas gzhan lnga'i srid pa 'byung ba'i rgyu de dge ba la dmigs pa'i rgyu bzod pa la dmigs pa'i dngos po rnams sa dang po nas sa bdun pa'i bar du de la skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The causes for the arising of existence in the five other abodes of the form realm are the causes for the virtuous focus, which are the objects of focus of the acceptance stage, and they arise from the first stage up to the seventh stage.

original: gang yang gcig tu dge ba'i rgyu stong pa nyid sgom pa'i phyir bzod pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni; sa brgyad pa dang / sa dgu pa dang / sa bcu pa gcig tu dge ba'i rgyud la srid pa 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gang yang gcig tu dge ba'i rgyu stong pa nyid sgom pa'i phyir bzod pa yongs su rdzogs pa ni; sa brgyad pa dang / sa dgu pa dang / sa bcu pa gcig tu dge ba'i rgyud la srid pa 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: The complete perfection of patience is the eighth, ninth, and tenth stages, which are the continuum of the cause of complete virtue.

original: 'di ni / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rgyus gzugs kyi dngos po mngon par @341b 'byung ba de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi srid pa 'byung ba rnam par dag pa dang / yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig gi dge ba'i rgyu'i srid pa 'byung ngo //🔽dngos po dang / dngos po med pa thams cad bsdus pa dang bral ba 'di ni /
analyzed: 'di ni / dge ba dang mi dge ba'i rgyus gzugs kyi dngos po mngon par @341b 'byung ba de bzhin du nyon mongs pa'i rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi srid pa 'byung ba rnam par dag pa dang / yang sangs rgyas kyi zhing gcig gi dge ba'i rgyu'i srid pa 'byung ngo // dngos po dang / dngos po med pa thams cad bsdus pa dang bral ba 'di ni /
translated: Just as the arising of the entity of form is due to the cause of virtue and nonvirtue, in the same way, the arising of the existence of the buddhas is due to the cause of the purity of the five afflictive obscurations and the cause of virtue in a single buddha realm.

original: bzod pa sgom pa'o //
analyzed: bzod pa sgom pa'o //
translated: This is the meditation on patience, which is free from the inclusion of all entities and nonentities.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'di lta bur dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin la rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / kun nas spyod pa med pa 'di'i rgyu dang rkyen la dmigs pa dang / 'dres pa med pa dang /🔽'byung ba med pa dang / 'gog pa med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di lta bur dngos po yod pa dang / dngos po med pa'i rang bzhin la rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / kun nas spyod pa med pa 'di'i rgyu dang rkyen la dmigs pa dang / 'dres pa med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang / 'gog pa med par 'gyur ro //
translated: This is the cause and condition of the non-observation of the unmixed and the non-arising and non-cessation of all phenomena.🔽In this way, bodhisattvas who are of the nature of space cultivate the acceptance that all things are reversed, and that all formations are engaged in the three times.

original: de la'ang ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha'i rang bzhin dag dngos po thams cad las ldog pa'i 'du byed thams cad dus gsum kun tu spyod pa'i bzod pa sgom par byed pa ni; dngos po dang / dngos po med pa thams cad ces bya'o //
analyzed: de la'ang ji ltar byang chub sems dpa' nam mkha'i rang bzhin dag dngos po thams cad las ldog pa'i 'du byed thams cad dus gsum kun tu spyod pa'i bzod pa sgom par byed pa ni; dngos po dang / dngos po med pa thams cad ces bya'o //
translated: This is called ‘all things and non-things.’

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi gnas gzhan chu'i zla ba dang mnyam par mthong ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi gnas gzhan chu'i zla ba dang mnyam par mthong ba ni /
translated: Seeing all buddha realms as other abodes, equal to the moon in the water,

original: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa'i glog ma gyogs pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa'i glog ma gyogs pa yin no //
translated: is the swift lightning that does not depend on others.

original: dus gsum gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi phyi ma'i mtha'i ye shes la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dus gsum gyi dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad kyi phyi ma'i mtha'i ye shes la mkhas par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will become skilled in the wisdom of the roots of virtue of the three times.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: nyon mongs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di la byang chub sems dpa' punda r'i ka skye bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'di la byang chub sems dpa' punda r'i ka skye bar 'gyur ro //
translated: in this buddha realm of afflictions, the bodhisattva Puṇyaraśmi will be born.

original: snying rje chen po sa brgyad pa brtan pa'i brtson 'grus yang dag par len pa'i phung po thams cad la dmigs pa @342a *//🔽med pa; gzugs thams cad las phyir log pa /
analyzed: snying rje chen po sa brgyad pa brtan pa'i brtson 'grus yang dag par len pa'i phung po thams cad la dmigs pa @342a *// med pa; gzugs thams cad las phyir log pa /
translated: He will attain the eighth level, called The Immutable One, and will take up the practice of diligence. He will focus on all the aggregates,🔽but he will not be attached to any of them.

original: chos thams cad 'byung ba dang / zad pa la gnas pa med cing spyod pa med do //
analyzed: chos thams cad 'byung ba dang / zad pa la gnas pa med cing spyod pa med do //
translated: He will not abide in the arising or cessation of any phenomena, nor will he engage in any activity.

original: 'du byed thams cad la'ang yid dang / mtshan ma gnyis ka'ang 'byung ba med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad la'ang yid dang / mtshan ma gnyis ka'ang 'byung ba med par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will not give rise to either the mind or the signs of all formations.

original: gnyis lta bu med pa'i dus gsum thams cad la dmigs pa med pa dang / nyon mongs med pa'i chos kyi dbyings dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gnyis lta bu med pa'i dus gsum thams cad la dmigs pa med pa dang / nyon mongs med pa'i chos kyi dbyings dang / yang dag pa'i mtha' mngon du byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will not focus on the three times, which are nondual and beyond duality. He will actualize the realm of phenomena, which is free of afflictions, and the limit of reality.

original: dngos po gang la'ang 'phel ba dang 'bri bar rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba'ang med /
analyzed: dngos po gang la'ang 'phel ba dang 'bri bar rnam par rtog par 'gyur ba'ang med /
translated: There is no conceptualization of things as increasing or decreasing.

original: tshad med pa'i sems dang yid gnyis rnam par dmigs pa dang bral ba la 'jug pa med pa dang / dus gsum thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings tshul gcig par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: tshad med pa'i sems dang yid gnyis rnam par dmigs pa dang bral ba la 'jug pa med pa dang / dus gsum thams cad kyi chos kyi dbyings tshul gcig par rab tu shes so //
translated: The immeasurable mind and mental activity are free from the apprehension of objects, and there is no engagement. The way of the realm of phenomena of all three times is known to be one.

original: 'di la rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: 'di la rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs dang ldan pa'i chos la gnas shing dmigs pa med pa dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa dang / gang zag med pa'i phyir rnam par shes so //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i gzugs dang ldan pa'i chos la gnas shing dmigs pa med pa dang / chos thams cad bdag med pa dang / gang zag med pa'i phyir rnam par shes so //
translated: the bodhisattvas, abiding in the form of the Dharma, are free from apprehending objects and cognize all phenomena to be devoid of self and person.

original: khams gsum thams cad la bdag po med pa'i dus gsum thams cad la nga ro dang sgra dbyangs 'gyur ba la so sor gnas shing 'byung ba med par 'gyur /
analyzed: khams gsum thams cad la bdag po med pa'i dus gsum thams cad la nga ro dang sgra dbyangs 'gyur ba la so sor gnas shing 'byung ba med par 'gyur /
translated: In all three times, the three realms are devoid of an owner, and the sound of the voice is transformed and abides in each place without arising.

original: srid pa thams cad tshul gcig gis dngos po med pa'i kun gzhi med pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen med brtag tu 'du phyed thams cad dang bral ba la'ang rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa @342b med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang /
analyzed: srid pa thams cad tshul gcig gis dngos po med pa'i kun gzhi med pa dang / rgyu dang rkyen med brtag tu 'du phyed thams cad dang bral ba la'ang rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa @342b med pa dang / 'byung ba med pa dang /
translated: They are nonconceptual, nonconceptualized, unoriginated,

original: 'gog pa med cing mngon sum du mi byed do //
analyzed: 'gog pa med cing mngon sum du mi byed do //
translated: and not to be actualized.

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la'ang rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med do //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa la'ang rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med do //
translated: They are nonconceptual and nonconceptualized with regard to the vehicles of the hearers and solitary buddhas.

original: sems can rnams la 'khor ba dang 'chi 'pho dmigs pa med do //
analyzed: sems can rnams la 'khor ba dang 'chi 'pho dmigs pa med do //
translated: They do not observe the cyclic existence and death of sentient beings.

original: rtag pa dang chad pa spangs pa'i byang chub kyi sems snying rje chen po la dmigs pa dor ba med pa dang / rgyu med pa thams cad kun nas bslang ba rnam par spyod pa stong par khong du chud pas bzod pa sgom par byed /
analyzed: rtag pa dang chad pa spangs pa'i byang chub kyi sems snying rje chen po la dmigs pa dor ba med pa dang / rgyu med pa thams cad kun nas bslang ba rnam par spyod pa stong par khong du chud pas bzod pa sgom par byed /
translated: They cultivate patience by abandoning eternalism and nihilism, by not abandoning the bodhicitta of great compassion, by being free from causes, and by understanding the emptiness of all that is to be engaged in.

original: de nas srid pa thams cad rnam par spyod pa stug po gtong bar byed /
analyzed: de nas srid pa thams cad rnam par spyod pa stug po gtong bar byed /
translated: Then, they emit the thick cloud of the conduct of all existences.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi gnas gzhan dag chu'i zla ba dang 'dra bar mthong ba ni /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad kyi gnas gzhan dag chu'i zla ba dang 'dra bar mthong ba ni /
translated: They see the abodes of all buddhafields as like reflections of the moon in water.

original: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa'i glog mgyogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dring mi 'jog pa'i glog mgyogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: They become like lightning, not dependent on others.

original: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dus gsum gyi phyi ma'i mtha'i ye shes la mkhas par 'gyur ro //🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba thams cad dus gsum gyi phyi ma'i mtha'i ye shes la mkhas par 'gyur ro // 'di lta ste /
translated: They become skilled in the wisdom of the roots of merit of the three times.

original: dper na / rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: dper na / rigs kyi bu /
translated: For example, noble sons,

original: ma dros pa'i chus 'khor ba'i chu yongs su zag pa'i sa'i phyogs yang dag par 'tsho ba'i mig ces bya ba'i me tog chen po mchog tu blta na sdug pa'i dri zhim pos gang ba /
analyzed: ma dros pa'i chus 'khor ba'i chu yongs su zag pa'i sa'i phyogs yang dag par 'tsho ba'i mig ces bya ba'i me tog chen po mchog tu blta na sdug pa'i dri zhim pos gang ba /
translated: the great flower called the eye of perfect life, which is very beautiful to behold, is filled with the fragrance of the water of Lake Anavatapta, which completely fills the region of the earth with water.

original: cung zad lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin rnams kyi lus kyi nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba de'ang ma dros par 'gro zhing de yang dag par 'tsho ba'i mig me tog chen po'i sman gyi dri bsnams pas mig gi nyes pa sbom po thams cad kyi nad dang /
analyzed: cung zad lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin rnams kyi lus kyi nyes pa sbom por 'gyur ba de'ang ma dros par 'gro zhing de yang dag par 'tsho ba'i mig me tog chen po'i sman gyi dri bsnams pas mig gi nyes pa sbom po thams cad kyi nad dang /
translated: The gods, nāgas, and yakṣas who have gross physical faults will also go to Lake Anavatapta. When they smell the scent of the great flower medicine that is the eye of the perfect life, all their gross eye faults and

original: lus kyi nyes pa sbom po'i nad @343a *//
analyzed: lus kyi nyes pa sbom po'i nad @343a *//
translated: gross physical illnesses

original: kyis kyang de yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: kyis kyang de yongs su dag par 'gyur ro //
translated: will be completely purified.

original: me tog chen po'i sman gyi dris nyams pa med pa dang / stobs med pas rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / dga' ba med pa dang / khro ba med pa 'di la de bzhin du dga' ba'ang med par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: me tog chen po'i sman gyi dris nyams pa med pa dang / stobs med pas rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa dang / dga' ba med pa dang / khro ba med pa 'di la de bzhin du dga' ba'ang med par 'gyur ro //
translated: Those who are without the scent of the great flower medicine, who are weak, who are without thought, who are without discursive thought, who are without joy, and who are without anger will also become like that, without joy.

original: bdag 'di ltar yon tan dang ldan pas sems can rnams nad rab tu zhi ba de bzhin du rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: bdag 'di ltar yon tan dang ldan pas sems can rnams nad rab tu zhi ba de bzhin du rigs kyi bu /
translated: “ ‘I have such qualities, and I pacify the illnesses of sentient beings.

original: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes stong pa nyid kyi bzod pa'i go skabs 'dod par 'gyur /
analyzed: snying rje chen po dang ldan pa'i byang chub sems dpa' sgrib pa med pa'i ye shes stong pa nyid kyi bzod pa'i go skabs 'dod par 'gyur /
translated: Bodhisattvas who have great compassion and who wish for the opportunity of the acceptance of emptiness, which is unobstructed wisdom,

original: srid pa thams cad kyi dngos po snying po la gnas pa /
analyzed: srid pa thams cad kyi dngos po snying po la gnas pa /
translated: will be able to remain in the essence of all things in existence.

original: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba spyod pa shin tu 'dod par 'gyur /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho dang skye ba spyod pa shin tu 'dod par 'gyur /
translated: They will be able to transcend birth and death.

original: de skye ba slu bar byed /
analyzed: de skye ba slu bar byed /
translated: Birth is deceptive.

original: gang skye ba slu bar byed pa de chos thams cad slu bar byed; gang chos thams cad slu bar byed pa de theg pa gsum spyod pa'i lam la 'jug pa'i stobs kyi rjes su thob ba slu bar byed do //
analyzed: gang skye ba slu bar byed pa de chos thams cad slu bar byed; gang chos thams cad slu bar byed pa de theg pa gsum spyod pa'i lam la 'jug pa'i stobs kyi rjes su thob ba slu bar byed do //
translated: If birth is deceptive, then all phenomena are deceptive. If all phenomena are deceptive, then the power of entering the path of practicing the three vehicles is deceptive.

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is this?

original: phung po gcig nas gcig tu rnam par spyod pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa la byin gyis rlob pa'ang med /
analyzed: phung po gcig nas gcig tu rnam par spyod pa'i byin gyis brlabs pa la byin gyis rlob pa'ang med /
translated: The blessing of the transformation from one aggregate to another is not a blessing.

original: gcig nas gcig tu yang dag par 'du ba'ang med /
analyzed: gcig nas gcig tu yang dag par 'du ba'ang med /
translated: There is no true gathering from one to another.

original: bdag gi yul la gnas pa'ang med; gcig nas gcig tu gnas la 'dug pa'ang med /
analyzed: bdag gi yul la gnas pa'ang med; gcig nas gcig tu gnas la 'dug pa'ang med /
translated: There is no abiding in one’s own domain, and there is no abiding from one to another.

original: skad cig mar kun tu spyod pa'ang med /
analyzed: skad cig mar kun tu spyod pa'ang med /
translated: There is no instant in which it is active.

original: skad cig ma'i rgyud la gnas pa'ang med /
analyzed: skad cig ma'i rgyud la gnas pa'ang med /
translated: There is no instant in which it is present.

original: dus gsum thams cad kyi @343b gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang / tshad med pa dang / mi chung ba'i chos kyang med /
analyzed: dus gsum thams cad kyi @343b gzugs dang / gzugs med pa dang / tshad med pa dang / mi chung ba'i chos kyang med /
translated: There is no form or formless, no finite or infinite, in any of the three times.

original: gang gcig nas gcig tu nye bar len pa dang / byin gyis rlob pa dang / 'jug pa dang / 'dzin pa pa dang / 'gebs pa dang / nyams pa dang / rab tu snang ba ni /
analyzed: gang gcig nas gcig tu nye bar len pa dang / byin gyis rlob pa dang / 'jug pa dang / 'dzin pa pa dang / 'gebs pa dang / nyams pa dang / rab tu snang ba ni /
translated: It is that which is appropriated, empowered, engaged, grasped, covered, diminished, or illuminated from one moment to the next.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: it is like this:

original: dper na / nam mkha' la rlung skye ba med pa dang / byin gyis brlabs med pa nas rnam par rtog pa med pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: dper na / nam mkha' la rlung skye ba med pa dang / byin gyis brlabs med pa nas rnam par rtog pa med pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The wind arises in space, but it is not empowered, and so on, up to: it is not conceptualized.

original: yang rlung la nam mkha' skye ba med pa nas rnam par rtog pa med pa'i bar du ste /
analyzed: yang rlung la nam mkha' skye ba med pa nas rnam par rtog pa med pa'i bar du ste /
translated: Again, space arises in the wind, but it is not empowered, and so on, up to: it is not conceptualized.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de ltar de bzhin du chos thams cad la gcig nas gcig tu cung zad kyang skye ba med pa nas rnam par rtog pa med pa'i bar du ji ltar chos thams cad rgyu ba med pa dang / nye bar spyod pa med pa dang / tha dad pa med pa dang /
analyzed: de ltar de bzhin du chos thams cad la gcig nas gcig tu cung zad kyang skye ba med pa nas rnam par rtog pa med pa'i bar du ji ltar chos thams cad rgyu ba med pa dang / nye bar spyod pa med pa dang / tha dad pa med pa dang /
translated: In the same way, all phenomena are not produced from one to another, not even in the slightest, up to being non-conceptual. Just as all phenomena are without movement, without utilization, without distinction,

original: snang ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa dang / rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa de thams cad skye bar mi shes pa dang /
analyzed: snang ba med pa dang / skye ba med pa dang / 'gag pa med pa dang / chad pa med pa dang / rtag pa med pa dang / rtog pa med pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med pa de thams cad skye bar mi shes pa dang /
translated: without appearance, without arising, without ceasing, without annihilation, without permanence, without conceptualization, and without discursive thought, he does not know any of that as arising,

original: nye bar skye ba med pa dang / rjes su skye ba med pa dang / bdag por rab tu mi shes so //
analyzed: nye bar skye ba med pa dang / rjes su skye ba med pa dang / bdag por rab tu mi shes so //
translated: nor does he know it as not arising, not arising after, or not being a dominant condition.

original: ji lta bur nam mkha' la rlung skye ba dang 'gog pa med pa de ltar de bzhin du phung po rnams skye ba zad par rab tu shes so //
analyzed: ji lta bur nam mkha' la rlung skye ba dang 'gog pa med pa de ltar de bzhin du phung po rnams skye ba zad par rab tu shes so //
translated: Just as wind arises and ceases in space, in the same way, he knows the extinction of the arising of the aggregates.

original: de skye ba dang / yi ge med pa thams cad dang / dngos po med par rab tu shes so //🔽de chos thams cad kyi rjes su song ba dang / yang dag par song ba @344a *//
analyzed: de skye ba dang / yi ge med pa thams cad dang / dngos po med par rab tu shes so // de chos thams cad kyi rjes su song ba dang / yang dag par song ba @344a *//
translated: He knows that all phenomena are beyond the three times, and that they are beyond the three times.🔽He does not see the past, the future, or the present.🔽He does not see the past, the future, or the present.🔽He does not see the past, the future, or the present.🔽He does not see the past, the future, or the present.

original: mi shes pa dang / shin tu 'das pa gcig nas gcig tu rnam par spyod par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //🔽ci la'ang chags pa med do //🔽btags pa med do //
analyzed: mi shes pa dang / shin tu 'das pa gcig nas gcig tu rnam par spyod par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // ci la'ang chags pa med do // btags pa med do //
translated: He does not see the past, the future, or the present.

original: btang ba med do //🔽chos thams cad tha mi dad par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: btang ba med do // chos thams cad tha mi dad par yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
