original: de dus gsum thams cad kyi chos thams cad la gnas pa'i sgo skye bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
analyzed: de dus gsum thams cad kyi chos thams cad la gnas pa'i sgo skye bar yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo //
translated: He does not see the past, the future, or the present.🔽He does not see

original: gang de ltar skye ba dang lta ba bral ba de chos thams cad gzhan la rag ma lus pa'i ye shes mdzod kyi chos dang ldan pa gnyis mngon du ma byung zhing bdud bzhi las shin tu 'das pa de chos thams cad gsog pa yang dag par rjes🔽su mi mthong ngo //🔽de chos thams cad dang bral bas khams gsum thams cad kyi skye ba las shin tu 'das pa ni'ang skye ba med /
analyzed: gang de ltar skye ba dang lta ba bral ba de chos thams cad gzhan la rag ma lus pa'i ye shes mdzod kyi chos dang ldan pa gnyis mngon du ma byung zhing bdud bzhi las shin tu 'das pa de chos thams cad gsog pa yang dag par rjes su mi mthong ngo // de chos thams cad dang bral bas khams gsum thams cad kyi skye ba las shin tu 'das pa ni'ang skye ba med /
translated: Those who are free from birth and views possess the Dharma of the treasure of wisdom that does not depend on others. Those who do not manifest the two and who have completely transcended the four māras do not see the accumulation of any phenomena.🔽They do not see the arising of any phenomena.

original: 'gog pa med /
analyzed: 'gog pa med /
translated: They do not see the cessation of any phenomena.

original: 'chi 'pho ba med /
analyzed: 'chi 'pho ba med /
translated: They do not see the death and transference of any phenomena.

original: 'byung ba'ang med do //
analyzed: 'byung ba'ang med do //
translated: They do not see the arising of any phenomena.

original: zhing thams cad sprin mgyogs pa dang mnyam par mthong zhing sems can rnams yongs su smin pa'i phyir nye bar song ngo //
analyzed: zhing thams cad sprin mgyogs pa dang mnyam par mthong zhing sems can rnams yongs su smin pa'i phyir nye bar song ngo //
translated: They see all realms as being like the swift wind, and they approach in order to ripen beings.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' skye ba la shin tu bzla ba'i phyir yang dag par spyod pa'i bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar byang chub sems dpa' skye ba la shin tu bzla ba'i phyir yang dag par spyod pa'i bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: in this way, bodhisattvas should cultivate the acceptance of correct conduct in order to master birth.

original: de la rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: de la rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gang gti mug skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi la rtog par 'gyur /
analyzed: gang gti mug skye ba'i rkyen gyis rga shi la rtog par 'gyur /
translated: “The conditions that give rise to delusion are investigated in relation to aging and death.

original: skad cig ma dang ldan pa'i skye bos rga ba la 'tshe bar byed /
analyzed: skad cig ma dang ldan pa'i skye bos rga ba la 'tshe bar byed /
translated: The arising of beings is afflicted by aging.

original: skyes bu gti mug pa 'di'i 'du byed @344b rnams phyi dang nang gi slu ba dang / gzhan yang gnyis su med pa'i tshor ba ji snyed pa rnam par shes pas rga shing bral ba nas 'khrug pa dang bral ba'i bar du rtog pa med /
analyzed: skyes bu gti mug pa 'di'i 'du byed @344b rnams phyi dang nang gi slu ba dang / gzhan yang gnyis su med pa'i tshor ba ji snyed pa rnam par shes pas rga shing bral ba nas 'khrug pa dang bral ba'i bar du rtog pa med /
translated: The deluded person does not understand that the formations are deceptive, both externally and internally, and that all feelings, which are nondual, are free from consciousness, from aging and death, up to being free from conflict.

original: rnam par rtog pa med cing slu ba med pa de ltar de bzhin du tshe'i rlangs pa yang dag par shes pa nam mkha' 'dra bar mnyam pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i mnyam pa nyid dang / gnyis su med pa'i lus la slu ba med pas 'phags pa ma yin pa'i rdzun gnyis dang bral ba'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med cing slu ba med pa de ltar de bzhin du tshe'i rlangs pa yang dag par shes pa nam mkha' 'dra bar mnyam pa rnam par rtog pa med pa'i mnyam pa nyid dang / gnyis su med pa'i lus la slu ba med pas 'phags pa ma yin pa'i rdzun gnyis dang bral ba'o //
translated: Without conceptualization, without deception, just as it is, the vapor of life is understood to be the same as space, the same as nonconceptual sameness, and the nondeceptive body is nondual, free from the two kinds of lies of the non-ārya.”

original: ji ltar chos thams cad kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa med pa'i rga shi 'dres pa med pa de bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes pa rga shi slu ba'i 'dod chags la thug pa nas 'khrug pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: ji ltar chos thams cad kyi dbyings rang bzhin gyis nyon mongs pa med pa'i rga shi 'dres pa med pa de bzhin du mig gi rnam par shes pa rga shi slu ba'i 'dod chags la thug pa nas 'khrug pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Just as the realm of all dharmas is by nature free from defilement, and is not mixed up with old age and death, so also is eye-consciousness, up to the deception of old age and death, and the attachment up to the disturbance.

original: de bzhin du rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ji snyed pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa rga shi slu bas na 'dod chags 'khrug pa la thug pa'i bar du de ltar 'dres pa med do //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba'i rnam par shes pa ji snyed pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa rga shi slu bas na 'dod chags 'khrug pa la thug pa'i bar du de ltar 'dres pa med do //
translated: And so also with the extent of ear-consciousness, up to the extent of mind-consciousness, up to the deception of old age and death, and the attachment up to the disturbance.

original: yang mig gi rnam par shes pa rga shi slu ba 'dod chags med pa'i mtha' nas 'khrug pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: yang mig gi rnam par shes pa rga shi slu ba 'dod chags med pa'i mtha' nas 'khrug pa'i bar du'o //
translated: And again, eye-consciousness is not mixed up with the deception of old age and death, up to the limit of non-attachment, and up to the limit of disturbance.

original: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la 'dres pa med pa de bzhin du rga shi slu ba'i mtha' nas 'khrug pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed rnams dang / rnam par shes pa la 'dres pa med pa de bzhin du rga shi slu ba'i mtha' nas 'khrug pa'i bar du'o //
translated: And so also with feeling, perception, the saṃskāras and consciousness, up to the deception of old age and death, and up to the limit of disturbance.

original: yang mig rga ba nas 'khrug pa'i bar du yang dag par 'dus pa med do //
analyzed: yang mig rga ba nas 'khrug pa'i bar du yang dag par 'dus pa med do //
translated: And again, old age is not mixed up with eye, up to disturbance.

original: de kho na nyid la dmigs pas na de bzhin du sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rga shi nas 'khrug pa'i bar du yang dag par @345a *//🔽'dus pa med do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la dmigs pas na de bzhin du sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi rga shi nas 'khrug pa'i bar du yang dag par @345a *// 'dus pa med do //
translated: In the same way, the nose, tongue, body, and mind, from old age and death up to conflict, are not real.

original: de kho na nyid la dmigs pas na gzugs kyi rga shi nas 'khrug pa'i bar du yang dag par 'dus pa med do //🔽de kho na nyid la dmigs pas na rnam par shes pa'i rga shi 'di ji snyed pa nas 'khrug pa'i bar du kun tu chad pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'i tha dad pa med do //
analyzed: de kho na nyid la dmigs pas na gzugs kyi rga shi nas 'khrug pa'i bar du yang dag par 'dus pa med do // de kho na nyid la dmigs pas na rnam par shes pa'i rga shi 'di ji snyed pa nas 'khrug pa'i bar du kun tu chad pa 'dod chags dang bral ba'i tha dad pa med do //
translated: In the same way, form, from old age and death up to conflict, is not real.🔽In the same way, consciousness, from old age and death up to conflict, is not real.

original: tshe'i rlangs pa yang dag par shes pa'i rga shi nas 'khrug pa'i bar du 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mtha' kun tu chad pa'o //
analyzed: tshe'i rlangs pa yang dag par shes pa'i rga shi nas 'khrug pa'i bar du 'dod chags dang bral ba'i mtha' kun tu chad pa'o //
translated: In the same way, the end of old age and death up to the end of conflict is not real.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'di la'ang tshor ba'i phung po rnams de bzhin du byang chub sems dpas tshor ba'i phung po bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la'ang tshor ba'i phung po rnams de bzhin du byang chub sems dpas tshor ba'i phung po bsgom par bya'o //
translated: in the same way, the bodhisattva should cultivate the aggregate of feeling.

original: gang khams gsum na dus gsum gyi tshor ba med pa 'byung ba zad pa la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa'i bzod pa 'di sgom par byed pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad yongs su smin pa nye bar 'tsho ba'i bzod pa la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: gang khams gsum na dus gsum gyi tshor ba med pa 'byung ba zad pa la mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa'i bzod pa 'di sgom par byed pa 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad yongs su smin pa nye bar 'tsho ba'i bzod pa la blta bar bya'o //
translated: The bodhisattva should also consider this acceptance of impermanence, suffering, and emptiness in the extinction of the elements, which is free from the feelings of the three times in the three realms, as the acceptance that nourishes the maturation of all sentient beings.

original: gzhan yang rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: gzhan yang rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Moreover, son of noble family,

original: byang chub sems dpas 'du shes kyi phung po la'ang tshul bzhin du brtag pa'i phyir bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpas 'du shes kyi phung po la'ang tshul bzhin du brtag pa'i phyir bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: the bodhisattva should cultivate acceptance by properly investigating the aggregate of perceptions.

original: de la 'du shes kyi phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'du shes kyi phung po gang zhe na /
translated: What is the aggregate of perceptions?

original: 'du shes kyi tshogs drug ste /
analyzed: 'du shes kyi tshogs drug ste /
translated: It is the six groups of perceptions:

original: mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i 'du shes so //
analyzed: mig gi 'dus te reg pa dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus dang / yid kyi 'dus te reg pa'i 'du shes so //
translated: the perceptions of contact through the coming together of eye, ear, nose, tongue, body, and mind.

original: de la mig gi 'dus te reg pa ni /
analyzed: de la mig gi 'dus te reg pa ni /
translated: What is contact through the coming together of eye?

original: gsum 'dus pa'i reg pa ste /
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa'i reg pa ste /
translated: It is contact through the coming together of three factors.

original: gang mig @345b dang / rnam par shes pa dang / gzugs kyi 'du shes 'byung bar byed pa 'di ni /
analyzed: gang mig @345b dang / rnam par shes pa dang / gzugs kyi 'du shes 'byung bar byed pa 'di ni /
translated: The eye, consciousness, and the perception of form are the three that come together.

original: gsum 'dus pa reg pa'i rkyen gyis 'du shes kun 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gsum 'dus pa reg pa'i rkyen gyis 'du shes kun 'byung bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The condition of contact is the arising of perception.

original: gang mig gi gzugs la'ang byed pa med pa dang / rnam pa med pa dang / lbu ba'i phung po lta bur dus gsum thams cad kyi 'du byed stong pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu sbyor ba gsungs so //
analyzed: gang mig gi gzugs la'ang byed pa med pa dang / rnam pa med pa dang / lbu ba'i phung po lta bur dus gsum thams cad kyi 'du byed stong pa ji lta ba bzhin du rab tu sbyor ba gsungs so //
translated: The eye has no activity, no form, and is like a mass of foam. The three times are all empty of formative activity.

original: gang mig gi rnam par shes pa ni /
analyzed: gang mig gi rnam par shes pa ni /
translated: The eye consciousness

original: ci la'ang 'ong ba dang 'gro ba snyems par rab tu mi shes so //
analyzed: ci la'ang 'ong ba dang 'gro ba snyems par rab tu mi shes so //
translated: does not know how to come or go.

original: khams gsum thams cad yul dang gnas med pa mig gi rnam par shes pa des stong pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pas stong ba'i bar du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: khams gsum thams cad yul dang gnas med pa mig gi rnam par shes pa des stong pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pas stong ba'i bar du shes par bya'o //
translated: The three realms are without object or location. The eye consciousness is empty, up to the mind consciousness being empty.

original: gang skye mched drug gi 'du shes 'byung ba de tshor ba'o //
analyzed: gang skye mched drug gi 'du shes 'byung ba de tshor ba'o //
translated: The arising of the perception of the six sense sources is feeling.

original: gang tshor ba de rtog pa'o //
analyzed: gang tshor ba de rtog pa'o //
translated: Whatever is feeling is conceptualization.

original: gang rtog pa de snyems pa'o //
analyzed: gang rtog pa de snyems pa'o //
translated: Whatever is conceptualization is conceit.

original: gang snyems pa de nye bar len pa'o //
analyzed: gang snyems pa de nye bar len pa'o //
translated: That which is conceited is appropriation.

original: gang nye bar len pa 'byung ba nas 'khrug pa'i bar du kun nas ldang ste /
analyzed: gang nye bar len pa 'byung ba nas 'khrug pa'i bar du kun nas ldang ste /
translated: From the arising of appropriation up to disturbance, there is arousing.

original: de bas na /
analyzed: de bas na /
translated: Therefore,

original: byang chub sems dpa' 'du shes tshul bzhin du brtag pa'i phyir bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //🔽bzod pa sgom pa'i reg pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir 'du shes yongs su shes pa yin no //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' 'du shes tshul bzhin du brtag pa'i phyir bzod pa bsgom par bya'o // bzod pa sgom pa'i reg pa yongs su shes pa'i phyir 'du shes yongs su shes pa yin no //
translated: the bodhisattva cultivates patience in order to investigate the modes of perception correctly.🔽The knowledge of the six collections of perception is the knowledge of perception through the complete understanding of the contact that cultivates patience.

original: yid kyi 'du shes kyi bar du bzod pa de bsgoms pas 'du shes kyi tshogs drug bzod pa de sgom pa yongs su shes pa la rtog pa med /
analyzed: yid kyi 'du shes kyi bar du bzod pa de bsgoms pas 'du shes kyi tshogs drug bzod pa de sgom pa yongs su shes pa la rtog pa med /
translated: The cultivation of patience with regard to the perception of the mind up to the perception of the mental objects is the cultivation of patience with regard to the six collections of perception.

original: rnam par rtog pa med /
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa med /
translated: The cultivation of patience is without conceptualization, without discrimination,

original: nye bar mi 'gro /🔽nye bar len pa med /
analyzed: nye bar mi 'gro / nye bar len pa med /
translated: without going,🔽without appropriation,

original: byin gyis rlob pa med na mngon par chags @346a *//🔽pa'ang med do //
analyzed: byin gyis rlob pa med na mngon par chags @346a *//🔽pa'ang med do //
translated: without blessing, and without attachment.

original: 'du shes thams cad rang bzhin med pa yongs su chags pa'i bzod pa de bsgoms pa'i rjes su 'byung ba ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pa ci la'ang chags pa med do //
analyzed: 'du shes thams cad rang bzhin med pa yongs su chags pa'i bzod pa de bsgoms pa'i rjes su 'byung ba ji lta ba bzhin yongs su shes pa ci la'ang chags pa med do //
translated: The subsequent understanding of the meditation on the acceptance of the non-apprehension of all perceptions is the non-apprehension of any attachment.

original: khams gsum thams cad kyi dus gsum gnas pa med pa dang / gnas med pa dang / 'khrul ba med pa dang / zhig pa med pa dang / blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa dang / gnyis su bya ba med pa'i chos kyi dbyings la yang dag par gzhol ba'i 'du shes thams cad shes pa ni cis kyang dbye ba med do //
analyzed: khams gsum thams cad kyi dus gsum gnas pa med pa dang / gnas med pa dang / 'khrul ba med pa dang / zhig pa med pa dang / blang ba med pa dang / dor ba med pa dang / gnyis su bya ba med pa'i chos kyi dbyings la yang dag par gzhol ba'i 'du shes thams cad shes pa ni cis kyang dbye ba med do //
translated: The understanding of all perceptions that are directed toward the realm of phenomena, which is without the three times of the three realms, without location, without error, without destruction, without acceptance, without rejection, and without duality, is not divided by anything.

original: de 'du shes thams cad nye bar len pa med pa'i yid ci la'ang dmigs pa med pa ni so so yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul gyi bzod pa la sgom pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de 'du shes thams cad nye bar len pa med pa'i yid ci la'ang dmigs pa med pa ni so so yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul gyi bzod pa la sgom pa zhes bya'o //
translated: The mind that is without the appropriation of all perceptions and that is without the apprehension of anything is called the meditation on the acceptance of the way of the correct understanding of each.

original: 'du shes thams cad ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa'i bzod pa sgom par byed pa 'di la'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad yongs su smin pa nye bar 'tsho ba'i bzod pa la blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'du shes thams cad ni mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong pa'i bzod pa sgom par byed pa 'di la'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems can thams cad yongs su smin pa nye bar 'tsho ba'i bzod pa la blta bar bya'o //
translated: In this patience that cultivates the acceptance of the impermanence, suffering, and emptiness of all perceptions, the bodhisattva should be seen to be living by the patience that brings all beings to maturity.

original: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpas yang 'du byed yongs su shes pa'i bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: rigs kyi bu byang chub sems dpas yang 'du byed yongs su shes pa'i bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: “Son of noble family, the bodhisattva should cultivate the patience that is the understanding of the conditioned.

original: de la 'du byed gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la 'du byed gang zhe na /
translated: What are conditioned things?

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: They are as follows:

original: 'du byed rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'du byed rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The three types of conditioned things.

original: gsum gang zhe na /
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na /
translated: What are the three?

original: lus kyi 'du byed dang / ngag gi 'du byed dang / yid kyi 'du byed do //
analyzed: lus kyi 'du byed dang / ngag gi 'du byed dang / yid kyi 'du byed do //
translated: Bodily conditioning, verbal conditioning, and mental conditioning.

original: lus kyi 'du byed ni dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba'o //
analyzed: lus kyi 'du byed ni dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba'o //
translated: Bodily conditioning is the in- and out-breath.

original: ngag gi @346b 'du byed ni rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gi @346b 'du byed ni rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa'o //
translated: Verbal conditioning is discursive thought and analysis.

original: yid kyi 'du byed ni 'du shes dang / sems pa'o //
analyzed: yid kyi 'du byed ni 'du shes dang / sems pa'o //
translated: Mental conditioning is perception and intention.

original: de la rigs kyi bu lus kyi 'du byed dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba tshul bzhin du brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de la rigs kyi bu lus kyi 'du byed dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba tshul bzhin du brtag par bya'o //
translated: Son of noble family, you should properly investigate the bodily processes of the in- and out-breath.

original: lus thams cad stong phrag dgu bcu rtsa gnyis sam /🔽ba spu'i khung bu bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag dgu bcu rtsa dgu lhag tsam gyi lus thams cad shin tu phra ba'i rdul dgu bcu rtsa dgu'i kha'i sgo nas shin tu phra ba'i rdul brgya stong phrag bcu bsags so //
analyzed: lus thams cad stong phrag dgu bcu rtsa gnyis sam / ba spu'i khung bu bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong phrag dgu bcu rtsa dgu lhag tsam gyi lus thams cad shin tu phra ba'i rdul dgu bcu rtsa dgu'i kha'i sgo nas shin tu phra ba'i rdul brgya stong phrag bcu bsags so //
translated: The entire body has ninety-two thousand channels,🔽or else it has a little more than ninety-nine trillion hair pores. The entire body is made up of ninety-nine particles, and each of these particles has a hundred thousand openings.

original: nyes pa med pa'i mi'i ba spu'i khung bu 'di gcig 'grangs pas lus thams cad kyi ba spu'i khung bu thams cad kyi sgo stong phrag dgu bcu rtsa dgu ji lta bur kha'i sgo nas dbugs rgyu ba de lta bur ba spu'i khung bu thams cad nas dbugs
analyzed: nyes pa med pa'i mi'i ba spu'i khung bu 'di gcig 'grangs pas lus thams cad kyi ba spu'i khung bu thams cad kyi sgo stong phrag dgu bcu rtsa dgu ji lta bur kha'i sgo nas dbugs rgyu ba de lta bur ba spu'i khung bu thams cad nas dbugs
translated: The pores of a faultless human body are counted as one, and the entire body has ninety-nine thousand pores. Just as the breath moves through the mouth, so it moves through all the pores.

original: rgyu'o // zhes dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba thams cad shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rgyu'o // zhes dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba thams cad shes par bya'o //
translated: You should know that all in- and out-breaths move in this way.

original: kha'i sgo thams cad nas dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba'i phung po lnga dag 'byung ba dang zad pa brtag pa'i phyir bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: kha'i sgo thams cad nas dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba'i phung po lnga dag 'byung ba dang zad pa brtag pa'i phyir bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should cultivate patience in order to examine the arising and cessation of the five aggregates in the breath that passes in and out through all the doors of the mouth.

original: de la ngag gi 'du byed gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la ngag gi 'du byed gang zhe na /
translated: What is the formation of speech?

original: gang rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa skad cig mar 'byung zhing 'gog pa 'di la'ang skad cig ma nyi ma gcig la'ang mi brgya stong phrag drug cu rtsa lnga skad cig mar 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa skad cig mar 'byung zhing 'gog pa 'di la'ang skad cig ma nyi ma gcig la'ang mi brgya stong phrag drug cu rtsa lnga skad cig mar 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: The arising and cessation of the momentary conceptual thoughts and analyses. In a single day, there are 65,700,000,000 such moments.

original: de re re la'ang rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa skad cig ma 'byung ba'i phung po lnga thams cad 'byung ngo //🔽'gog go // phung po de re re la'ang tshor ba @347a *//
analyzed: de re re la'ang rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa skad cig ma 'byung ba'i phung po lnga thams cad 'byung ngo // 'gog go // phung po de re re la'ang tshor ba @347a *//
translated: In each of them, the five aggregates arise and cease, with the arising and cessation of momentary conceptual thoughts and analyses.

original: rnam gsum 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rnam gsum 'byung ngo //
translated: In each of those aggregates, the three kinds of feelings arise and cease.

original: 'gog go / tshor ba de re re la'ang 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis thams cad 'byung ngo //
analyzed: 'gog go / tshor ba de re re la'ang 'byung ba'i yan lag bcu gnyis thams cad 'byung ngo //
translated: In each of those feelings, all twelve factors of dependent origination arise and cease.

original: 'gog go // 'byung ba'i yan lag de re re la'ang bag la nyal ba dgu bcu rtsa brgyad 'byung bar 'gyur ro //🔽bag la nyal ba de re re la'ang khams gsum thams cad na spyod pa /
analyzed: 'gog go // 'byung ba'i yan lag de re re la'ang bag la nyal ba dgu bcu rtsa brgyad 'byung bar 'gyur ro // bag la nyal ba de re re la'ang khams gsum thams cad na spyod pa /
translated: And in each of these limbs of arising there are ninety-eight latent tendencies.

original: nyon mongs pa kun 'byung ba la blta bar bya'o; ;'di dag ni /
analyzed: nyon mongs pa kun 'byung ba la blta bar bya'o; ;'di dag ni /
translated: And in each of these latent tendencies there is the origin of all the afflictions that are experienced in the entire three realms.

original: ngag gi 'du byed do //
analyzed: ngag gi 'du byed do //
translated: These are the verbal formations.

original: de 'du shes gang zhe na /
analyzed: de 'du shes gang zhe na /
translated: “What is perception?

original: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba la rnam par rtog pa dang / kun tu nyon mongs pa dang / de phyin ci log thams cad kyi mtshan mas kun tu nyon mongs pa 'di 'du shes so //
analyzed: dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba la rnam par rtog pa dang / kun tu nyon mongs pa dang / de phyin ci log thams cad kyi mtshan mas kun tu nyon mongs pa 'di 'du shes so //
translated: It is the conceptualization and affliction of the in-breath and out-breath, and the affliction of all the characteristics of error. This is perception.

original: de la sems pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la sems pa gang zhe na /
translated: “What is intention?

original: gang sems pa dang / tshor ba dang / phung po dang / rnam par dpyod pa dang / dbang po drug dang // rnam par 'phel ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gang sems pa dang / tshor ba dang / phung po dang / rnam par dpyod pa dang / dbang po drug dang // rnam par 'phel ba 'di ni /
translated: It is the intention, feeling, aggregates, analysis, and the six sense sources. This is intention.

original: se gol gtogs pa tsam gyis kyang 'dod chags kyi kun gzhi nyon mongs pa'i dbang po brgya las 'das pa 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: se gol gtogs pa tsam gyis kyang 'dod chags kyi kun gzhi nyon mongs pa'i dbang po brgya las 'das pa 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: In the same way, the ground of desire arises from the hundred afflictions of the sense organ.

original: zhe sdang gi kun gzhi brgya las 'das pa 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: zhe sdang gi kun gzhi brgya las 'das pa 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: The ground of anger arises from the hundred afflictions.

original: gti mug gi kun gzhi brgya las 'das pa 'byung bar 'gyur /
analyzed: gti mug gi kun gzhi brgya las 'das pa 'byung bar 'gyur /
translated: The ground of ignorance arises from the hundred afflictions.

original: cha shas dpyod pa'i nyon mongs pa brgya las 'das pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba 'di ni /
analyzed: cha shas dpyod pa'i nyon mongs pa brgya las 'das pa 'byung bar 'gyur ba 'di ni /
translated: The afflictions of partial analysis arise from the hundred afflictions.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid do //
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid do //
translated: body, speech, and mind

original: 'du byed do /
analyzed: 'du byed do /
translated: are formations.

original: dpyod pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa dang / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba 'di dag la rnam par rtog pas 'du @347b shes su sems pa dang / bsam pa'i rjes su 'ong ba la byin gyis brlabs pa de la byang chub sems dpa'i dngos po de ltar rang bzhin dang /
analyzed: dpyod pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa dang / dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba 'di dag la rnam par rtog pas 'du @347b shes su sems pa dang / bsam pa'i rjes su 'ong ba la byin gyis brlabs pa de la byang chub sems dpa'i dngos po de ltar rang bzhin dang /
translated: Conceptualizing these as consciousness, and blessing the mind that follows thoughts, the bodhisattvas analyze the nature of things in this way:

original: dus gsum ni /
analyzed: dus gsum ni /
translated: The three times🔽are body, speech, and mind.

original: lus dang / ngag dang / yid do; ;'du byed la dngos po med pa dang / mi zad pa ni /
analyzed: lus dang / ngag dang / yid do; ;'du byed la dngos po med pa dang / mi zad pa ni /
translated: The nonexistence of things and their inexhaustibility🔽are body, speech, and mind.

original: chos kyi dbyings la nyon mongs pa med pa dang / chos kyi dbyings yongs su shes pa ni /
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la nyon mongs pa med pa dang / chos kyi dbyings yongs su shes pa ni /
translated: The dharmadhātu is free from afflictions, and the dharmadhātu is fully cognized.

original: rnam par dag pa rjes su 'ong ba de cir dgos she na; chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam par dag pa de mtshan nyid mi rnyed pa dang / mi 'dzin pa dang / chos kyi dbyings su mi 'byung bar 'gyur ba de yang dag pa'i mtha' mi gsog go /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa rjes su 'ong ba de cir dgos she na; chos kyi mtshan nyid rnam par dag pa de mtshan nyid mi rnyed pa dang / mi 'dzin pa dang / chos kyi dbyings su mi 'byung bar 'gyur ba de yang dag pa'i mtha' mi gsog go /
translated: What is the purpose of the purity that follows? The purity of the characteristics of phenomena is not found, not apprehended, and does not occur in the dharmadhātu.

original: 'du byed kyi mthar mi rnyed pa dang / mi 'dzin pa mi 'gog par 'gyur ba ni /
analyzed: 'du byed kyi mthar mi rnyed pa dang / mi 'dzin pa mi 'gog par 'gyur ba ni /
translated: The limit of conditioned phenomena is not found, not apprehended, and not ceased.

original: de bzhin du 'du byed kyi mtha' dang / de chos kyi dbyings su snyems pa yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / de chos thams cad kyi mtha' dang / gang chos thams cad kyi mtha' dang / de 'du byed gsum dang / dus gsum yongs su gcod pa'i mtha' dang /
analyzed: de bzhin du 'du byed kyi mtha' dang / de chos kyi dbyings su snyems pa yang dag pa'i mtha' dang / de chos thams cad kyi mtha' dang / gang chos thams cad kyi mtha' dang / de 'du byed gsum dang / dus gsum yongs su gcod pa'i mtha' dang /
translated: In the same way, the limit of conditioned phenomena, the limit of the dharmadhātu, the limit of all phenomena, that which is the limit of all phenomena, the three kinds of conditioned phenomena, the limit of the discrimination of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times, the limit of the three times

original: de mtha' yas pa mi gcod pa'i mtha' dang / rjes su mi gcod pa'i mtha' dang / mi rtag pa'i mtha' dang / de lta bu'i mtha' ni /
analyzed: de mtha' yas pa mi gcod pa'i mtha' dang / rjes su mi gcod pa'i mtha' dang / mi rtag pa'i mtha' dang / de lta bu'i mtha' ni /
translated: The end of that is the end of the infinite, the end of the non-cutting, the end of the impermanent, and the end of that kind.

original: dus gsum dang mnyam pa'i mtha' dang / mthar 'gro ba dang / dus gsum dang / lus dang / ngag dang / yid gnyis su med pa'i mtha' dang / dus gsum thams cad kyi mtha' ni /
analyzed: dus gsum dang mnyam pa'i mtha' dang / mthar 'gro ba dang / dus gsum dang / lus dang / ngag dang / yid gnyis su med pa'i mtha' dang / dus gsum thams cad kyi mtha' ni /
translated: The end of the three times is the end of going to the end, the end of the three times, the end of the non-duality of body, speech, and mind, and the end of all three times.

original: 'du byed gsum yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnyis su med pa'i dbang dang / ci'ang ma yin pa'i mtha' dang / reg pa yongs su @348a *//
analyzed: 'du byed gsum yang dag pa'i mtha' la gnyis su med pa'i dbang dang / ci'ang ma yin pa'i mtha' dang / reg pa yongs su @348a *//
translated: The end of the three formative forces is the non-dual power of the perfect end, the end of nothing whatsoever, the end of the non-duality of the complete understanding of contact,

original: shes pa gnyis su med pa'i mtha' dang / 'jigs pa dang bral ba'i mtha' dang / de bzhin du dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba yongs su shes pa'i mtha' dang / de bzhin du nyi shu'i mtha' dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa dang /
analyzed: shes pa gnyis su med pa'i mtha' dang / 'jigs pa dang bral ba'i mtha' dang / de bzhin du dbugs phyi nang du rgyu ba yongs su shes pa'i mtha' dang / de bzhin du nyi shu'i mtha' dang / rnam par rtog pa dang / rnam par dpyod pa dang /
translated: the end of freedom from fear, and likewise the end of the complete understanding of the in-and-out breath, and likewise the end of the twenty, the end of conceptualization and investigation,🔽and the end of the three realms.

original: shing ta la'i mgo bcad pa'i mtha' dang / 'du shes su mi chags par sems pa dang / skad cig ma'i mtha' sems pa'i mtha' dang / de ltar yongs su shes pa ni /
analyzed: shing ta la'i mgo bcad pa'i mtha' dang / 'du shes su mi chags par sems pa dang / skad cig ma'i mtha' sems pa'i mtha' dang / de ltar yongs su shes pa ni /
translated: and the end of the moment is the end of the mind.

original: 'du byed gsum la rnam par mi gcod pa'i mthar yongs su shes pa ni /
analyzed: 'du byed gsum la rnam par mi gcod pa'i mthar yongs su shes pa ni /
translated: Thus, the thorough understanding of the three types of formations is the thorough understanding of the end of non-severance.

original: 'di la dngos po dang / dngos po ma yin par skye ba'o //
analyzed: 'di la dngos po dang / dngos po ma yin par skye ba'o //
translated: Here, there is arising as an entity and arising as a non-entity.

original: yang dngos po las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: yang dngos po las 'das pa zhes bya ba ni /
translated: Moreover, what is called transcending entities

original: 'du byed thams cad la rnam par shes pa med pa dang / 'du byed thams cad la gnyis dang / gnyis su med pa ni /
analyzed: 'du byed thams cad la rnam par shes pa med pa dang / 'du byed thams cad la gnyis dang / gnyis su med pa ni /
translated: is the absence of consciousness in all formations, and the non-duality and non-dualism of all formations.

original: yang dag pa'i mtha'i chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa dang / gsog pa dang / nye bar gsog pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i mtha'i chos kyi dbyings la 'jug pa dang / gsog pa dang / nye bar gsog pa dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: It is the entry into the realm of phenomena, the limit of reality, and the freedom from accumulation and close accumulation.

original: 'di la 'du byed thams cad la byin gyis mi rlob pa'i mtha' dang / dus gsum du phyag 'tshal ba dang bral ba de yang dag par yongs su shes pa dang / yang dag pa'i mthar yongs su shes pa de ni /
analyzed: 'di la 'du byed thams cad la byin gyis mi rlob pa'i mtha' dang / dus gsum du phyag 'tshal ba dang bral ba de yang dag par yongs su shes pa dang / yang dag pa'i mthar yongs su shes pa de ni /
translated: Here, the extreme of not blessing all compounded things and the absence of bowing to the three times are thoroughly known. The thorough knowledge of the limit of reality

original: chos thams cad yongs su shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: chos thams cad yongs su shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: is called the thorough knowledge of all phenomena.

original: yongs su bskor ba'i 'du byed gsum yongs su chad pa'o //
analyzed: yongs su bskor ba'i 'du byed gsum yongs su chad pa'o //
translated: It is the thorough severing of the three compounded activities that are thoroughly turned.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gang dus gsum gyi 'du byed gsum mi gcod pa'i mtshan ma la dmigs pas bzod pa sgom pa yongs su @348b 'dzin to //
analyzed: gang dus gsum gyi 'du byed gsum mi gcod pa'i mtshan ma la dmigs pas bzod pa sgom pa yongs su @348b 'dzin to //
translated: one thoroughly takes up the cultivation of patience by observing the sign of not severing the three compounded activities of the three times.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: 'du byed gsum dang / mtshan ma mi gcod pa dmigs pa spangs pas gnyis su med pa'i bzod pa sgom mo //
analyzed: 'du byed gsum dang / mtshan ma mi gcod pa dmigs pa spangs pas gnyis su med pa'i bzod pa sgom mo //
translated: one cultivates patience without duality by abandoning the observation of not severing the three compounded activities and their signs.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: de'i phyir dus gsum dang / 'du byed gsum po yongs su shes pa'i bzod pa 'di ni /
analyzed: de'i phyir dus gsum dang / 'du byed gsum po yongs su shes pa'i bzod pa 'di ni /
translated: therefore, this patience that thoroughly knows the three times and the three compounded activities

original: so so yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul gyis bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: so so yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul gyis bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: should be cultivated with patience through the method of correct individual practice.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: Son of noble family,

original: gang 'du byed ni /
analyzed: gang 'du byed ni /
translated: Whatever is conditioned

original: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong ba dang / bdag med par bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mi rtag pa dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / stong ba dang / bdag med par bzod pa bsgom par bya'o //
translated: should be cultivated as impermanent, suffering, empty, and selfless.

original: 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i nye bar 'tsho bas sems can yongs su smin pa'i bzod pa sgom par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di'ang byang chub sems dpa'i nye bar 'tsho bas sems can yongs su smin pa'i bzod pa sgom par blta bar bya'o //
translated: This should be regarded as the bodhisattva’s cultivation of patience in bringing sentient beings to maturity through the means of sustenance.

original: de la rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: de la rigs kyi bu /
translated: Noble son,

original: rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i phung po gang zhe na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'byung ba'i phung po gang zhe na /
translated: what is the aggregate of the arising of consciousness?

original: rnam par shes pa drug gi lus dang / mig dang / reg pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug gi lus dang / mig dang / reg pa'i rnam par shes pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is the body of the six consciousnesses, and it is called the eye and the tactile consciousness.

original: gang yang rnam par shes pa'i lus drug dag dus gsum gyi reg pas rnam par gnas pa dang / dus gsum 'byung bas rnam par shes pa dang / dus gsum gyi rnam par shes pas rnam par gnas pa de phan tshun du rtog pa dang /
analyzed: gang yang rnam par shes pa'i lus drug dag dus gsum gyi reg pas rnam par gnas pa dang / dus gsum 'byung bas rnam par shes pa dang / dus gsum gyi rnam par shes pas rnam par gnas pa de phan tshun du rtog pa dang /
translated: The six bodies of consciousness are present in the three times through contact, and consciousness arises through the three times. The consciousness of the three times is present through consciousness, and they mutually conceptualize,

original: rnam par rtog pa dang / kun nas ldang bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rnam par rtog pa dang / kun nas ldang bar 'gyur ro //
translated: conceptualize, and arise.

original: gang yul gyi sred pa la rtog pa dang / dmigs pas bzod par smra ba yongs su 'khrug pa'o //
analyzed: gang yul gyi sred pa la rtog pa dang / dmigs pas bzod par smra ba yongs su 'khrug pa'o //
translated: It is the agitation that comes from the craving for objects and from the acceptance of views.

original: gang mig dang gzugs kyi yul la sred pa la rnam par rtog pas bzod pa yongs su spangs pa'o //🔽'khrug pa'o // reg pa dang tshor ba la rjes su gdungs pas de yul la sred pa'i bzod @349a *//
analyzed: gang mig dang gzugs kyi yul la sred pa la rnam par rtog pas bzod pa yongs su spangs pa'o // 'khrug pa'o // reg pa dang tshor ba la rjes su gdungs pas de yul la sred pa'i bzod @349a *//
translated: It is the complete rejection of the acceptance of views that come from the craving for objects and from the conceptualization of objects.🔽It is the agitation that comes from the craving for objects and from the acceptance of views.

original: pa yongs su spangs pa'o //🔽rnam par 'jig pa'o //
analyzed: pa yongs su spangs pa'o // rnam par 'jig pa'o //
translated: It is the complete rejection of the acceptance of views that come from the craving for objects and from the agitation of contact and sensation.🔽It is the agitation that comes from the craving for objects and from the acceptance of views.

original: yid la rnam par dmigs pas 'du shes kyi zhing la sred pa'i bzod pa yongs su spangs pa'o //🔽'khrug pa'o // dus gsum dang / 'du byed gsum la nye bar chad pa'i yul la sred pa'i bzod pa yongs su spangs pa'o //
analyzed: yid la rnam par dmigs pas 'du shes kyi zhing la sred pa'i bzod pa yongs su spangs pa'o // 'khrug pa'o // dus gsum dang / 'du byed gsum la nye bar chad pa'i yul la sred pa'i bzod pa yongs su spangs pa'o //
translated: It is the complete rejection of the acceptance of views that come from the craving for objects and from the conceptualization of the field of perception.🔽It is the agitation that comes from the craving for objects and from the acceptance of views.🔽It is the complete rejection of the acceptance of views that come from the craving for objects and from the grasping of the three times and the three formative forces as signs.🔽It is the agitation that comes from the craving for objects and from the acceptance of views.

original: 'khrug pa'o // 'du byed gsum dag mtshan mar nye bar 'dzin pa dang / rang gi yul gyi sred pa'i bzod pa yongs su spangs pa'o //
analyzed: 'khrug pa'o // 'du byed gsum dag mtshan mar nye bar 'dzin pa dang / rang gi yul gyi sred pa'i bzod pa yongs su spangs pa'o //
translated: It is the complete rejection of the acceptance of views that come from the craving for objects and from the grasping of the three formative forces as signs.

original: 'khrug pa'o // 'du byed dag kun nas ldang la dmigs pa rang gi yul la sred pa'i bzod pa yongs su spangs pa ni /
analyzed: 'khrug pa'o // 'du byed dag kun nas ldang la dmigs pa rang gi yul la sred pa'i bzod pa yongs su spangs pa ni /
translated: “Conflict” means the conflict between the afflictions and their antidotes.

original: chos kyi dbyings la ci'ang ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bzod pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa'o //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la ci'ang ma yin pa'i nyon mongs pa'i bzod pa thams cad yongs su spangs pa'o //
translated: The bodhisattva’s patience is the complete abandonment of the arising of the afflictions, the complete abandonment of the craving for one’s own objects, and the complete abandonment of all the patience that is the non-existence of the realm of phenomena.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Son of noble family,

original: chos kyi dbyings la kun tu nyon mongs pa med pa'i bzod pa de sgom pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i lus drug gi yul du yid la mi byed do //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings la kun tu nyon mongs pa med pa'i bzod pa de sgom pa dang / rnam par shes pa'i lus drug gi yul du yid la mi byed do //
translated: the bodhisattva who cultivates the patience of the non-affliction of the realm of phenomena does not mentally engage with the objects of the six consciousnesses and the body.

original: de bzod pa bsgoms pa'i rang bzhin dang / sgyu ma lta bu'i sems kyi yul la yang dag par gzhol ba'i yul thams cad la rtog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de bzod pa bsgoms pa'i rang bzhin dang / sgyu ma lta bu'i sems kyi yul la yang dag par gzhol ba'i yul thams cad la rtog par 'gyur ro //
translated: Through the cultivation of patience, the nature of the mind that is absorbed in the object of the illusory mind will be realized in all objects.

original: de la so so yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul gyi bzod pa bsgoms pas de la byang chub sems dpa'i sngon gyi las la brtson par bya'o //
analyzed: de la so so yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul gyi bzod pa bsgoms pas de la byang chub sems dpa'i sngon gyi las la brtson par bya'o //
translated: “In this regard, the bodhisattva should exert himself in his previous actions through the cultivation of the patience of the method of correct practice.

original: gang yang byang chub sems dpas rnam par dbye ba yongs su byas pa dang / mchog gi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su ldang ba 'di ni /
analyzed: gang yang byang chub sems dpas rnam par dbye ba yongs su byas pa dang / mchog gi dge ba'i rtsa ba yongs su ldang ba 'di ni /
translated: The bodhisattvas’ analysis is complete, and their roots of virtue are fully developed.

original: nam mkha' la 'gro bas 'dul ba'i bzod pa yongs su rgyas @349b par sgom pa'i phyir 'di ni /
analyzed: nam mkha' la 'gro bas 'dul ba'i bzod pa yongs su rgyas @349b par sgom pa'i phyir 'di ni /
translated: This is the cultivation of the complete acceptance of the discipline of those who move through space.

original: dus gsum dang / 'du byed thams cad kyi yul du yid la mi byed do //
analyzed: dus gsum dang / 'du byed thams cad kyi yul du yid la mi byed do //
translated: They do not mentally engage with the three times and all conditioned things as objects.

original: snyems pa med do //
analyzed: snyems pa med do //
translated: They are not conceited.

original: dus gsum dang / 'du byed thams cad dag kun nas ldang ba'i lam thams cad du yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang dag par dpyod do //
analyzed: dus gsum dang / 'du byed thams cad dag kun nas ldang ba'i lam thams cad du yid kyi rnam par shes pa yang dag par dpyod do //
translated: They correctly analyze the mental consciousness in all the paths of the arising of the three times and all conditioned things.

original: de bzhin nyid ni /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ni /
translated: Suchness

original: dngos po med pa'o //
analyzed: dngos po med pa'o //
translated: is not a thing.

original: dus gsum dang / 'du byed kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / chos thams cad ni; sgom par rab tu shes pa dang / sgom pa dang bral ba dang / dbyangs ma yin pa dang / ngag gi lam ma yin pa dang / yi ge ma yin pa dang /
analyzed: dus gsum dang / 'du byed kyi rjes su 'jug pa dang / chos thams cad ni; sgom par rab tu shes pa dang / sgom pa dang bral ba dang / dbyangs ma yin pa dang / ngag gi lam ma yin pa dang / yi ge ma yin pa dang /
translated: They know how to cultivate the three times and the engagement with conditioned things, and they know how to cultivate the disengagement from all phenomena, which is not a melody, not a path of speech, and not a letter.

original: rjes su 'byung ba med pa dang / 'gog pa med pa dang / mtshan nyid ma yin pa dang / so so'i theg pa ma yin pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / shin tu dben pa ma yin pa dang /🔽brjod pa med pa dang / shin tu 'jungs pa med pa dang / shin tu zhi ba dang / skad cig mar shin tu dmigs pas rnam par bral ba dang / shin tu zad pa dang / kun gzhi las shin tu bral ba dang / shin tu rnam par gnas pa dang /
analyzed: rjes su 'byung ba med pa dang / 'gog pa med pa dang / mtshan nyid ma yin pa dang / so so'i theg pa ma yin pa dang / dmigs pa med pa dang / mtshan ma med pa dang / shin tu dben pa ma yin pa dang / brjod pa med pa dang / shin tu 'jungs pa med pa dang / shin tu zhi ba dang / skad cig mar shin tu dmigs pas rnam par bral ba dang / shin tu zad pa dang / kun gzhi las shin tu bral ba dang / shin tu rnam par gnas pa dang /
translated: It is not a subsequent occurrence, not a cessation, not a characteristic, not a separate vehicle, not an object, not a sign, not a complete isolation,🔽not an expression, not a complete miserliness, not a complete pacification, not a complete observation of the momentary, not a complete exhaustion, not a complete separation from the all-base, not a complete stability,

original: yul shin tu med pa dang / gtong ba'i sems shin tu med pa dang / rtsa ba shin tu med pa dang / dbang po shin tu ma yin pa dang / shin tu rnam par ma dag pa dang / shin tu bral ba dang / gnyen po shin tu med pa dang /
analyzed: yul shin tu med pa dang / gtong ba'i sems shin tu med pa dang / rtsa ba shin tu med pa dang / dbang po shin tu ma yin pa dang / shin tu rnam par ma dag pa dang / shin tu bral ba dang / gnyen po shin tu med pa dang /
translated: not a complete object, not a complete generosity, not a complete root, not a complete faculty, not a complete purity, not a complete separation, and not a complete antidote.

original: mtshan ma dang dngos po med pa dang / shin tu 'phrog pa med pa dang / shin tu 'thor ba dang / chos thams cad la shin tu dngos po med @350a *//🔽par rab tu shes pa ni /
analyzed: mtshan ma dang dngos po med pa dang / shin tu 'phrog pa med pa dang / shin tu 'thor ba dang / chos thams cad la shin tu dngos po med @350a *// par rab tu shes pa ni /
translated: He knows that all phenomena are without characteristics, without substance, without appropriation, without dispersion, and without any substantial basis.🔽He knows that all phenomena are without a creator, without a feeler, without a hearer, without a knower, without a perceiver, and without an experiencer.

original: byed pa po med pa dang / tshor ba po med pa dang / nyan pa med pa dang / 'dzin pa med pa dang / smig rgyu ba lta bur so sor snang ba dang / chu zla lta bu dang / gzugs brnyan lta bu nam mkha'i rang bzhin cung zad kyang med pa dang /
analyzed: byed pa po med pa dang / tshor ba po med pa dang / nyan pa med pa dang / 'dzin pa med pa dang / smig rgyu ba lta bur so sor snang ba dang / chu zla lta bu dang / gzugs brnyan lta bu nam mkha'i rang bzhin cung zad kyang med pa dang /
translated: He knows that all phenomena are like a mirage, like a reflection, like an echo, like a dream, like an optical illusion, like the moon in water, like a city of gandharvas, and like a phantom.

original: chos thams cad la bdag med pa ni /
analyzed: chos thams cad la bdag med pa ni /
translated: He knows that all phenomena are without substance, without a basis, without a foundation, and without a support.🔽He knows that all phenomena are without a self, without a being, without a soul, without a person, without an individual, without a human, without a human being, without a woman, without a man, and without a neuter.🔽He knows that all phenomena are without a basis, without a support, without a foundation, and without a basis for a foundation.

original: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mnyam pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid gcig pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa la brten pa de chos thams cad la kun tu lta'o //🔽de ltar shin tu 'du byed thams cad ni /
analyzed: mtshan nyid kyi gzhi dang mnyam pa'i mtshan nyid dang / mtshan nyid gcig pa dang / mtshan nyid med pa la brten pa de chos thams cad la kun tu lta'o //🔽de ltar shin tu 'du byed thams cad ni /
translated: He knows that all phenomena are without a basis, without a support, without a foundation, and without a basis for a foundation.

original: de bzhin du dus gsum la kun tu spyod pa'i dngos po de'i bar du chos thams cad la de bzhin nyid du rten pa la kun tu lta'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du dus gsum la kun tu spyod pa'i dngos po de'i bar du chos thams cad la de bzhin nyid du rten pa la kun tu lta'o //
translated: In the same way, in the midst of the things that are experienced in the three times, all phenomena are seen as based on suchness.

original: 'di la'ang byang chub sems dpa' nye bar 'tsho bas sems can thams cad yongs su rgyas pa ni; so sor yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i 'od kyis 'dul ba'i bzod pa blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: 'di la'ang byang chub sems dpa' nye bar 'tsho bas sems can thams cad yongs su rgyas pa ni; so sor yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i 'od kyis 'dul ba'i bzod pa blta bar bya'o //
translated: In this regard, the bodhisattva’s nourishment of all beings through the practice of the way of correct conduct should be seen as the acceptance of the light of space that guides.

original: rigs kyi bu /
analyzed: rigs kyi bu /
translated: “Noble son,

original: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin du gzugs kyi bzod pa bsgom pa'i phyir phyi nang gi 'jam pa dpung tsam thams cad kyis nyon mongs pa rnam par sel bar thams cad du sems pa dang / yid bzhin yongs su rgyas par 'gyur ro; ;'di la bzod pa thams cad ni /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' de bzhin du gzugs kyi bzod pa bsgom pa'i phyir phyi nang gi 'jam pa dpung tsam thams cad kyis nyon mongs pa rnam par sel bar thams cad du sems pa dang / yid bzhin yongs su rgyas par 'gyur ro; ;'di la bzod pa thams cad ni /
translated: in the same way that the bodhisattvas cultivate the acceptance of form, they should also cultivate the acceptance of the inner and outer softness of the body, which is the complete pacification of all afflictions and the complete fulfillment of all wishes. In this regard, all acceptances

original: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos las kun tu 'das pa'o //
analyzed: nyan thos dang / rang sangs rgyas kyi chos las kun tu 'das pa'o //
translated: are beyond the qualities of the hearers and solitary buddhas.

original: 'di la bzod pa thams cad ni /
analyzed: 'di la bzod pa thams cad ni /
translated: In this regard, all acceptances

original: byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa'i yon @350b tan yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' spyod pa'i yon @350b tan yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: It is the perfection of the qualities of the bodhisattva conduct.

original: 'di la bzod pa thams cad ni /
analyzed: 'di la bzod pa thams cad ni /
translated: Here, all the acceptances

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi yon tan kun nas sdud do //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos kyi yon tan kun nas sdud do //
translated: gather together the qualities of the buddhadharmas.

original: 'di la bzod pa thams cad ni /
analyzed: 'di la bzod pa thams cad ni /
translated: Here, all the acceptances

original: gzhan gyi rgol ba'i chos dang lhan cig par 'dzin to //
analyzed: gzhan gyi rgol ba'i chos dang lhan cig par 'dzin to //
translated: hold the Dharma of the opponent.

original: 'di la bzod pa thams cad ni /
analyzed: 'di la bzod pa thams cad ni /
translated: Here, all the acceptances

original: gti mug gi mun pa mun nag 'jig pa'i yid do //
analyzed: gti mug gi mun pa mun nag 'jig pa'i yid do //
translated: are the mind that destroys the darkness of the darkness of delusion.

original: sangs rgyas kyi chos la dga' bar byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi chos la dga' bar byed /
translated: It makes one delight in the buddhadharmas.

original: bsgribs pa dang / sgrib pa thams cad kun tu zad par byed de /
analyzed: bsgribs pa dang / sgrib pa thams cad kun tu zad par byed de /
translated: It causes the exhaustion of all obscurations and obscurations.

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad snang bar byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing thams cad snang bar byed /
translated: It illuminates all buddha realms.

original: sangs rgyas thams cad la dad par byed /
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad la dad par byed /
translated: It causes faith in all buddhas.

original: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi pha rol tu 'gro ba /
analyzed: pha rol tu phyin pa thams cad kyi pha rol tu 'gro ba /
translated: It is the going to the other side of all the perfections.

original: mngon par shes pa thams cad la rnam par rol par byed pa /
analyzed: mngon par shes pa thams cad la rnam par rol par byed pa /
translated: It is the play in all the higher perceptions.

original: ting nge 'dzin gyi gzungs kyi bzod pa sgrub par byed pa 'di ni /
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi gzungs kyi bzod pa sgrub par byed pa 'di ni /
translated: It is the attainment of the acceptance of the dhāraṇī of samādhi.

original: so sor yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i 'od kyis 'dul ba'i bzod pa'o //🔽de la'ang drang srong thub pa la so sor yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i 'od kyis 'dul ba'i bzod pa brjod pa dang / 'chad pa ni; brgya stong phrag drug cu rtsa brgyad kyi chu bo gangg'a'i bye ma snyed kyi phyogs bcu'i khung bur mnyam par 'gro ba ni /

translated: In that, the way of correct practice is the patience of being guided by the light of the sky.🔽The bodhisattva’s practice is the patience of being guided by the light of the sky.🔽The bodhisattva’s practice is the patience of being guided by the light of the sky.🔽The bodhisattva’s practice is the patience of being guided by the light of the sky.🔽The bodhisattva’s practice is the patience of being guided by the light of the sky.

original: byang chub sems dpa'i goms pas so sor yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i 'od kyis 'dul ba'i bzod pa so sor thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa'i goms pas so sor yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i 'od kyis 'dul ba'i bzod pa so sor thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva’s practice is the patience of being guided by the light of the sky.🔽The bodhisattva’s practice is the patience of being guided by the light of the sky.

original: byang chub sems dpa' me bcu rdul yal sum cu rtsa gcig gi ting nge 'dzin gyi skar mda'i @351a *//🔽bdag po so sor thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' me bcu rdul yal sum cu rtsa gcig gi ting nge 'dzin gyi skar mda'i @351a *//🔽bdag po so sor thob par 'gyur ro //

original: byang chub sems dpa' sa ya phrag dgu bcu rtsa gnyis rnam dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin so sor thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sa ya phrag dgu bcu rtsa gnyis rnam dpa' bar 'gro ba'i ting nge 'dzin so sor thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: ninety-two hundred thousand bodhisattvas will attain the samādhi called Heroic Progress.

original: byang chub sems dpa' mdor na de'i bar du chu bo gangg'a'i bye ma snyed kyi bar du rnam pa sna tshogs dang / rnam pa tha dad pa thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi gzungs kyi bzod pa'i chos kyi sgo so sor thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' mdor na de'i bar du chu bo gangg'a'i bye ma snyed kyi bar du rnam pa sna tshogs dang / rnam pa tha dad pa thams cad kyi ting nge 'dzin gyi gzungs kyi bzod pa'i chos kyi sgo so sor thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: In short, bodhisattvas will attain all the various kinds of dhāraṇī, the dhāraṇī of the Dharma gateway of patience, and the samādhi up to the number of grains of sand in the Ganges River.

original: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis sngags kyi tshig 'di brjod do //
analyzed: de nas yang bcom ldan 'das kyis sngags kyi tshig 'di brjod do //
translated: Then the Blessed One spoke these mantra words:

original: bra ma da te /
analyzed: bra ma da te /
translated: brahma-date

original: badzri ma bha aud pad te /🔽aud pad ta /
analyzed: badzri ma bha aud pad te / aud pad ta /
translated: vajri-ma-bhava-pad-te🔽ud-pad-te

original: aud mad te /
analyzed: aud mad te /
translated: ud-ma-date

original: dza sam badzri ma bha sv'ah'a /
analyzed: dza sam badzri ma bha sv'ah'a /
translated: ja-sam-vajri-ma-bhasvaha

original: lha sa ya khrag khrig brgya stong phrag dgu bcu rtsa brgyad 'dis so sor yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i 'od kyis 'dul ba'i bzod pa so sor thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lha sa ya khrag khrig brgya stong phrag dgu bcu rtsa brgyad 'dis so sor yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i 'od kyis 'dul ba'i bzod pa so sor thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: eighty-nine hundred thousand quintillion gods will attain the patience of the method of correct practice, the light of going through space, and the discipline.

original: chu bo gangg'a'i bye ma dang mnyam pa'i lha rnams kyis phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub so sor thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu bo gangg'a'i bye ma dang mnyam pa'i lha rnams kyis phyir mi ldog pa'i byang chub so sor thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The gods equal to the sands of the Ganges River will each attain irreversible enlightenment.

original: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis sngags 'di brjod do //
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das kyis sngags 'di brjod do //
translated: Again, the Blessed One spoke this mantra:🔽Tadyathā:

original: tadya th'a / sa mu dra ba te /
analyzed: tadya th'a / sa mu dra ba te /
translated: Samudravati,

original: ma ru ba te na pi na pi ni /
analyzed: ma ru ba te na pi na pi ni /
translated: maruvati, ninapi ninapi,

original: goor bhe sha de ni sha de ni /
analyzed: goor bhe sha de ni sha de ni /
translated: gorbheśa, deniśa,

original: ai bi dza so ha dza bhi bhe da sam ska r'a bhra sv'ah'a /
analyzed: ai bi dza so ha dza bhi bhe da sam ska r'a bhra sv'ah'a /
translated: ivijasoha, javibhedasamskarābha svāhā.

original: sa ya phrag bdun cu rtsa bdun gyi klu rnams la 'di dag bshad pa 'chad pas bzod pa so sor thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa ya phrag bdun cu rtsa bdun gyi klu rnams la 'di dag bshad pa 'chad pas bzod pa so sor thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The nāgas equal to seventy-seven koṭis will each attain acceptance through explaining this.

original: chu bo gangg'a'i bye ma dang mnyam pa'i klu rnams kyis byang chub kyis phyir mi ldog pa so sor thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: chu bo gangg'a'i bye ma dang mnyam pa'i klu rnams kyis byang chub kyis phyir mi ldog pa so sor thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: The nāgas equal to the sands of the Ganges River will each attain irreversibility for enlightenment.

original: de la @351b bcom ldan 'das kyi sngags kyi tshig 'di brjod do //
analyzed: de la @351b bcom ldan 'das kyi sngags kyi tshig 'di brjod do //
translated: Regarding that, the Blessed One spoke this mantra:🔽Tadyathā:

original: tadya th'a / dza na mi bh'a ba /
analyzed: tadya th'a / dza na mi bh'a ba /

original: su bh'a ba su bh'a ba su bh'a bo //

original: bha ba bo //
analyzed: bha ba bo //

original: lha phran bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong tshad med grangs med pa rnams nam mkha' las lha rdzas kyi me tog gi char 'bebs so //🔽gang phyogs bcu tshad med pa grangs med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir de 'ongs shing lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang /
analyzed: lha phran bye ba khrag khrig brgya phrag stong tshad med grangs med pa rnams nam mkha' las lha rdzas kyi me tog gi char 'bebs so // gang phyogs bcu tshad med pa grangs med pa'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing bye ba khrag khrig brgya stong gi sangs rgyas kyi zhing 'dir de 'ongs shing lha dang / klu dang / gnod sbyin dang / lha ma yin dang / nam mkha' lding dang / mi 'am ci dang /
translated: Countless quintillions of minor gods rained down divine flowers from the sky.🔽The buddhas of countless, limitless quintillions of buddha realms in the ten directions came to this buddha realm.🔽They came with their retinues of śrāvakas, pratyekabuddhas, bodhisattvas, devas, nāgas, yakṣas, gandharvas, asuras, garuḍas, kinnaras, mahoragas, humans, and non-humans.

original: lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa'i 'khor thams cad dang ldan pa de yang dag par 'ongs nas de thams cad kyis dbyangs gcig tu @352a *//
analyzed: lto 'phye chen po dang / mi dang mi ma yin pa'i 'khor thams cad dang ldan pa de yang dag par 'ongs nas de thams cad kyis dbyangs gcig tu @352a *//
translated: They all said in one voice,🔽“Excellent!

original: legs so // zhes bya ba byas te /
analyzed: legs so // zhes bya ba byas te /
translated: Excellent!”

original: de bzhin du tshig 'di brjod par byed do //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshig 'di brjod par byed do //
translated: And they spoke these words:

original: legs so legs so //
analyzed: legs so legs so //
translated: “Excellent! Excellent!

original: bcom ldan 'das lus thams cad rnam par 'jig pa dang / yul thams cad rab tu 'jig pa'i bzod pa bshad pa dang / gzhan la rag ma las pa bdud bzhi'i chos kyi bzod pa lhag pa bshad pa ngo mtshar chen po 'di sngon ma thos so; ;'di la'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag gi spyod pa dang /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das lus thams cad rnam par 'jig pa dang / yul thams cad rab tu 'jig pa'i bzod pa bshad pa dang / gzhan la rag ma las pa bdud bzhi'i chos kyi bzod pa lhag pa bshad pa ngo mtshar chen po 'di sngon ma thos so; ;'di la'ang byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po dag gi spyod pa dang /
translated: Blessed One, it is amazing that you have taught the acceptance of the complete destruction of the body and the complete destruction of all objects, and that you have taught the acceptance of the Dharma of the four māras that is not dependent on others. I have never heard of such a great wonder.

original: bya ba'i gnas kyi sa las shin tu 'das pa'i tshogs 'dren par byed do //
analyzed: bya ba'i gnas kyi sa las shin tu 'das pa'i tshogs 'dren par byed do //
translated: This acceptance also leads to the accumulation of the bodhisattva mahāsattvas’ conduct and activities that transcend the stage of the earth.

original: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun gyi rin po che'i gter thams cad thob par byed pa'i bzod pa ston pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thams cad shes par byed pa rnams thams cad kyi bzod pa sgom pa 'di bshad pa ni /
analyzed: byang chub kyi phyogs sum cu rtsa bdun gyi rin po che'i gter thams cad thob par byed pa'i bzod pa ston pa dang / thams cad mkhyen pa'i ye shes thams cad shes par byed pa rnams thams cad kyi bzod pa sgom pa 'di bshad pa ni /
translated: This teaching on the acceptance that reveals the attainment of the entire precious treasure of the thirty-seven factors of enlightenment and the cultivation of the acceptance of all the knowledge of omniscient wisdom

original: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams brjod du med pa'i don snying rje chen po thob pa la 'jug go /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' sems dpa' chen po rnams brjod du med pa'i don snying rje chen po thob pa la 'jug go /
translated: causes the bodhisattva mahāsattvas to enter into the attainment of the inexpressible meaning of great compassion.

original: thabs la mkhas pa sems can thams cad yongs su smin pa'i ye shes chen po kun tu bsags pa'i brtson 'grus dang / stobs kyi bzod pa rab tu bstan to //
analyzed: thabs la mkhas pa sems can thams cad yongs su smin pa'i ye shes chen po kun tu bsags pa'i brtson 'grus dang / stobs kyi bzod pa rab tu bstan to //
translated: the great wisdom of skillful means that is the diligence of gathering the great accumulation of the ripening of all sentient beings; and the patience of the power of teaching.

original: so sor yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i 'od kyis 'dul ba'i bzod pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo le'u drug go ///
analyzed: so sor yang dag par spyod pa'i tshul nam mkha' la 'gro ba'i 'od kyis 'dul ba'i bzod pa zhes bya ba theg pa chen po'i mdo le'u drug go ///
translated: This concludes the sixth chapter of the Sutra of the Great Vehicle, called “The Patience of Training in the Way of the Sky-Goers.”

original: de nas de nyid kyi tshe na sh'akya thub pa de bzhin gshegs pa @352b dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams skar mda' nyi shu ba'i rgyun bcad de /
analyzed: de nas de nyid kyi tshe na sh'akya thub pa de bzhin gshegs pa @352b dgra bcom pa yang dag par rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams skar mda' nyi shu ba'i rgyun bcad de /
translated: Then, at that time, the thus-gone, worthy, perfect buddha Śākyamuni cut through the stream of twenty meteors.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs su brtsams nas sems can rnams la chos ston to; ;lha dang / dri za dang / mi'i 'khor de thams cad dang ldan pa de ji lta bur sngon gyi gzugs kyi lus kyi gnas par gyur to //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i gzugs su brtsams nas sems can rnams la chos ston to; ;lha dang / dri za dang / mi'i 'khor de thams cad dang ldan pa de ji lta bur sngon gyi gzugs kyi lus kyi gnas par gyur to //
translated: Having created the form of a thus-gone one, he taught the Dharma to sentient beings. The entire retinue of gods, gandharvas, and humans became just like the form of the thus-gone one.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das yang 'khor ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhag ste /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das yang 'khor ba'i dkyil 'khor zhes bya ba'i ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par bzhag ste /
translated: Then the Blessed One entered the meditative absorption called “the maṇḍala of saṃsāra.”

original: yang bcom ldan 'das 'khor ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par zhugs ma thag tu de nas de nyid kyi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi smin mtshams kyi mdzod spu nas kha dog du ma kha dog sna tshogs kyi 'od zer byung ste /
analyzed: yang bcom ldan 'das 'khor ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi ting nge 'dzin la mnyam par zhugs ma thag tu de nas de nyid kyi tshe bcom ldan 'das kyi smin mtshams kyi mdzod spu nas kha dog du ma kha dog sna tshogs kyi 'od zer byung ste /
translated: As soon as the Blessed One entered the meditative absorption called “the maṇḍala of saṃsāra,” at that very moment, from the ūrṇā hair between his eyebrows, light rays of many colors and various hues emerged.

original: 'od zer des phyogs bcu chu bo gangg'a'i bye ma snyed kyi rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa kun snang bar byas so //
analyzed: 'od zer des phyogs bcu chu bo gangg'a'i bye ma snyed kyi rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing gi rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa kun snang bar byas so //
translated: That light illuminated all the solitary buddhas in the buddha realms of the ten directions, as numerous as the sands of the Ganges River, in the fivefold turbid age.

original: ji ltar sems can rnams 'od zer de lus la reg pa de ltar 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi kun gzhi spangs pas de'ang de ltar lus kyi gzugs kyi bde ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar sems can rnams 'od zer de lus la reg pa de ltar 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gi kun gzhi spangs pas de'ang de ltar lus kyi gzugs kyi bde ba dang ldan par 'gyur ro //
translated: Just as the light touched the bodies of those beings, in the same way, by abandoning the basis of desire, anger, and ignorance, they also came to possess the bliss of physical form.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It was like this:

original: dper na / bsam gtan gnyis la yang dag par zhugs pa'i dge slong dag de'ang phyogs bzhi'i rnam par snang ba'i phyir bdag gang du rnam pa 'di 'dra ba'i bde ba dang / tshor ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'ang sangs rgyas kyi mthus na /🔽dpag tshad phyed tsam na sh'akya thub pa de bzhin gshegs @353a *//
analyzed: dper na / bsam gtan gnyis la yang dag par zhugs pa'i dge slong dag de'ang phyogs bzhi'i rnam par snang ba'i phyir bdag gang du rnam pa 'di 'dra ba'i bde ba dang / tshor ba 'byung bar 'gyur ba de'ang sangs rgyas kyi mthus na / dpag tshad phyed tsam na sh'akya thub pa de bzhin gshegs @353a *//
translated: For example, when a monk who has entered the second concentration sees the light of the four directions, he thinks, “Where does this kind of bliss and sensation come from?”🔽By the power of the Buddha, he sees Śākyamuni Tathāgata and his retinue not far away,

original: pa 'khor dang bcas pa mi ring bar mthong ngo //
analyzed: pa 'khor dang bcas pa mi ring bar mthong ngo //
translated: at a distance of half a yojana.🔽Having attained supreme faith, by the power of the Buddha he quickly approaches the Blessed One.

original: mchog tu dang ba thob pa de sangs rgyas kyi mthus cung zad tsam gyis kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du nye bar phyin to; ;de nas de'i dus na'ang phyogs bcu'i rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing stong pa me bcu rdul yal bye ba khrag khrig brgya
analyzed: mchog tu dang ba thob pa de sangs rgyas kyi mthus cung zad tsam gyis kyang bcom ldan 'das kyi drung du nye bar phyin to; ;de nas de'i dus na'ang phyogs bcu'i rnyog pa lnga'i sangs rgyas kyi zhing stong pa me bcu rdul yal bye ba khrag khrig brgya
translated: At that time, by the power of the Buddha, the ten directions become clear, and the ten billion empty buddha-fields of the five turbidities

original: stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi'i rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i sems can 'di dag de ltar sh'akya thub pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i drung du nye bar phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la spyi bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das /
analyzed: stong phrag brgyad cu rtsa bzhi'i rang sangs rgyas kyi theg pa pa'i sems can 'di dag de ltar sh'akya thub pa de bzhin gshegs pa'i drung du nye bar phyin nas bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la spyi bos phyag btsal te bcom ldan 'das /
translated: The eighty-four thousand sentient beings of the Pratyekabuddha Vehicle approached the Tathāgata Śākyamuni and, having bowed their heads at the feet of the Blessed One,

original: kyi spyan sngar chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dug go /
analyzed: kyi spyan sngar chos mnyan pa'i phyir 'dug go /
translated: they sat down in the presence of the Blessed One in order to listen to the Dharma.

original: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis yang byang chub sems dpa' gdul dka' ba bos so //
analyzed: de la bcom ldan 'das kyis yang byang chub sems dpa' gdul dka' ba bos so //
translated: Then the Blessed One also summoned the bodhisattva Duḥprativedha.

original: yul la chags pa'i rigs kyi bu //
analyzed: yul la chags pa'i rigs kyi bu //
translated: “Son of family, attached to objects,

original: rtag tu dga' ba'i bya ba byed //
analyzed: rtag tu dga' ba'i bya ba byed //
translated: always acting out of pleasure,

original: shin tu shes med byis pa dag /
analyzed: shin tu shes med byis pa dag /
translated: ignorant, childish,

original: bde ba'i lam du de mi shes //
analyzed: bde ba'i lam du de mi shes //
translated: they do not know the path of happiness.

original: mun pa'i phung pos de g-yogs so //
analyzed: mun pa'i phung pos de g-yogs so //
translated: They are covered by a mass of darkness

original: 'khor ba yang ni mi 'dor ro //
analyzed: 'khor ba yang ni mi 'dor ro //
translated: and do not abandon saṃsāra.🔽In the realm of minor compositional activity,

original: chung ba'i 'du byed spyod yul la; ;'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la zhen //
analyzed: chung ba'i 'du byed spyod yul la; ;'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la zhen //
translated: they are attached to the five sense pleasures.

original: de dag che yang mngon par 'dod //
analyzed: de dag che yang mngon par 'dod //
translated: Even when they are great, they are not recognized.

original: dug gi chu yang de ltar 'thungs //
analyzed: dug gi chu yang de ltar 'thungs //
translated: They drink poisoned water in that way.

original: sdug bsngal tshor ba rjes su myong //
analyzed: sdug bsngal tshor ba rjes su myong //
translated: And experience the feeling of suffering.

original: 'khor ba la yang mngon par 'dod //
analyzed: 'khor ba la yang mngon par 'dod //
translated: They also desire samsara,

original: sha dang khrag la yang ni za //
analyzed: sha dang khrag la yang ni za //
translated: And eat flesh and blood.

original: 'khor lo de ltar rnam par gnas //
analyzed: 'khor lo de ltar rnam par gnas //
translated: The wheel abides in that way.🔽It is known as the inexhaustible quality

original: yang dang yang du 'khor ba ni //🔽mi zad yon tan du ni shes //
analyzed: yang dang yang du 'khor ba ni // mi zad yon tan du ni shes //
translated: Because it turns again and again.

original: longs spyod rnyed med mi zad pa //
analyzed: longs spyod rnyed med mi zad pa //
translated: Enjoyment is inexhaustible and not obtained.
